The videos are clear and crisp. The photos are truly stunning. And there are so many settings for you to explore.Coming from an android user, using a phone has never been better! This is my 2nd phone and I‚Äôm really glad it is an iPhone. The experience is amazing.So summing up, this is a great purchase and worth the price.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Better choice even in 2024 If budget @40k‚Ä¶ Value For Money üí∞üëç
review_text: First of all Thanks to Amazon and the seller Darshitha Ezone for this Genuine product. I Got this one @41.5k And at that price it was a better option. I compared IPhone 13 With Samsung s23 and both are premium flagship phones and if u love  Android then go with S23  at the same price or Go with Iqoo Flagship series and If u want to move IOS then Go with 13 or 16. I‚Äôm Moving from Android (Iqoo Neo 6) to IPhone 13, and since 1yr Im a IPad user so I‚Äôm habituated to IOS so it‚Äôs not a big deal for me. And coming to my Unboxing experience‚Ä¶Yeah It was very good ‚Ä¶Brand new IPhone , Great performance, Great Display, Best Haptics and Battery as expected not so long lasting as android but can easily give A day Backup on normal usage, If u use 5g continuously so More Data usage and battery backup will be around 4hrs SOT and yeah in the initial device setup hours any mobile becomes warm and now no such heating issues and back camera is awesome but front cam is still better in my Iqoo Neo6 ‚Ä¶anyone thinking 13 and 14 ‚Ä¶No difference at all but compared with 15 yeah there are some differences but not major ones and actually 15 has some major heating issues, Battery backup issues , Camera issues so don‚Äôt go with 15, if u really want Newer series go with iPhone 16 as cameras , Design,AI, Chip and other upgrades are there. But if u just want an iPhone go with 13 or 14 And actually the build quality is slightly better and Give premium feel in 13 and 14 series which is missing in 15 series. Actually I Bought this to use for 1 yr after that I‚Äôll upgrade to Newer iPhone series.Final verdict :: If u just want an iPhone then 13 or 14 is still a good choose for max 3 yrs usage.Beware of The Sellers‚Ä¶Go through their Ratings and Reviews and then only make an order.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Stunning Design and a Beautiful Pink!
review_text: I finally upgraded from my trusty iPhone 5s to the iPhone 13, and let me tell you, it feels like I‚Äôve time-traveled from the past to the future! The pink color is absolutely gorgeous‚Äîit's the perfect blend of subtle and stylish, making the phone look sleek and modern. I‚Äôve received so many compliments on it already.The design is everything you‚Äôd expect from Apple: premium, well-crafted, and just a pleasure to hold. Coming from a 5s, it‚Äôs almost like I was using a rotary phone before this. I half-expected Siri to say, ‚ÄúWelcome to the 21st century!‚ÄùThe display is bright and vibrant, the camera is a huge leap forward, and the overall performance is incredibly smooth. It‚Äôs crazy how much has changed‚Äîface ID feels like magic, and the battery life is a dream compared to my old 5s, which needed a charger practically glued to it.If you‚Äôre thinking about upgrading, especially if you‚Äôre coming from a much older model like I was, don‚Äôt hesitate. This iPhone 13 in pink is a stunner and well worth the leap!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Using after 3 months honest review
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



This is my first iPhone and it always feels good to hold this masterpiece. This looks premium not just because of its branding, it has everything which makes it feel premium. However, despite all the looks and finish, the transition from Android to Apple is not very smooth and you may constantly lack certain features that can make life easy. I was using vivo y19 Lite before this and still have that phone with me. Putting out the feature that is being missed by me-1. Forwarding Anything in Whatsapp: Forwarding anything in Whatsapp from IPhone takes bit more step as compared to what is being offered in Android. This makes the entire process slow for an Android User2. App Switcher: Apple could have easily made App Switcher easy with just light Swipe up, instead they made it with long pressed Swipe up. Why man, why.. You don't have any features for Swipe up, just make it easy to launch.3. Andorid Dialer is Always Missed: Every android has a basic feature, where you can search the contact directly from Phone Dialer, here Dialer is used for Dialing Number only and it will not suggest you similar contact from contacts or last Dial. This is really bad.. If you have to Dial a number directly, use Dialer.. If you have to dial someone from Recent Call log, shift to that and if you to dial someone from contact, shift to that. Man, all this can be done under one button, under dialer. Android user will miss this very badly.4. Sending Multiple Files in Whatsapp: If you wants to add more than 1 file directly from whatsapp, you have to do it twice. In Android, one can simple start selecting from whatspp itself and can select as many files as they wants and can send in a single click. Here for sending multiple files, you have to go to gallery or folder and select all files first and share it through whatsapp.5. No Swipe based shifting from Chats to Status and to calls: In Android Whatsapp, you can switch between Calls, Chats and Status by just swiping, here you have to press button of each.6. Contact Viewing: Contact list sorting method is still out of my mind. Man, make it easy. For example, if one of your contacts First Name or Middle Name or Last Name, any one of thing start with Alphabet "A", than it will be shown on top of the list. Apple, pls adopt any one method or at least allow us to customise it.7. Many Apps in Android are much more refined than its version on Apple.8. This is for those who had use Samsung Pay: Samsung Pay was one of the best app for making UPI or Card Payment, just swipe up from home screen of Samsung Phones (Only S Series) and the app is open for payment, I miss that here very badly.9. Lack of Dual Messenger Facility: You can't use two different WhatsApp numbers here in the same phone, as supported in all android right now.These are the issues that I face right now. Apart from this, the phone is good, the sound is loud and clear, it Feels Premium in Hand, the Touch is very good and Face ID works like a charm. Gesture control customisation is really good and you can customise a lot of things.

Finally got mine hand's on brand new I phone 13, so talking about my experience with I phone is first I was using a I phone se 2020, it was an upgrade from se 2020 to I phone 13, unfortunately most of you guys must be confused in 13/14 here's I'll clear your most of the doubt in short span of words. So talking about the major difference in 13/14 is1- 14 has 6 GB of ram / 13 has 4gbAlthough the optimisation is top-notch in I phones so that won't effect you overall in multi tasking.2- 14 has a little bit of camera change internally such as it can record 4k 30fps in cinematic mode 13 can do 1080p @30fps that's all.3- 14 has a core gpu +1 that's it!Both has a 15 bionic flagship chipsetBoth has same battery life same battery screen on time same size same phone cover can be fit identically to eachother.13 has slightly more battery life than 14 I have watched many videos on YouTube. Its always last 20/25min more because of Ram and management optimisation less load on GPU overall.Using it from few days'great experience always check your phone and do get checked on Apple official website using the serial numbers and all for genuine authentication.Display is top-notchOutdoor viability is awesome.The 60hz display doesn't feel slow at all it's definitely a good way of optimisation in display as well.The touch response is smooth and lag free.Sound the stereo speakers are soooo loud the music has good and cristal clear sound.Great I phone for greater user experience.Function and management optimisation are great.Don't buy 14 and waste your more money about 10k rather then go with 13 and buy a good case and screen guard for that price you will save more and get additional accesories for new phone!!!I'm using a ringke case as it has military grade drop protection and I'm using ringke case from 4 year's.Go for it guys!!Thank you!!

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Flare on camera
review_text: Overall, the quality of the iPhone is impressive. The display is crisp, and the sound quality is excellent. The phone runs smoothly with no lag, hang or performance issues.However, I noticed a significant issue with the camera. When pointing it toward a light source, there is too much lens flare, and ghosting often occurs in photos. This is a flaw that Apple should definitely work on.Additionally, the charging speed could be improved, as it feels slower than expected.In summary, while the phone excels in performance and build quality, the camera's flare problem needs attention.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
I guess no one was ever able to articulate what an iPhone really is
review_text: A phone that cost 60,000 to even over a lakh rupee appeared to be a little bit of a far-fetched Idea not long ago, when friends and family were buying iPhones. I was wondering what‚Äôs so special about this phone, I asked for different opinions, checked videos, but nobody ever clearly encapsulated the idea of an iPhone.Now that I am holding one, I can confidently say that an iPhone is not just about its great camera, or it‚Äôs great looks, an iPhone is an experience, of course, it clicks great pictures, there is nothing much to complain about the battery, but what stands out for me is the fact that an iPhone is about care. Someone, and that someone being Steve Jobs, the founder of Apple, cared enough to create great products. So much that when you hold it in your hands, you don‚Äôt just feel like you‚Äôre holding a piece of technology, but rather a helpful companion that is there to help you share and communicate in ways that make it seem almost like an art. To me, an iPhone gives wings to my creative expression and that makes it what it is, an iPhone is an ally for the creative spirit in you.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Iphone 13
review_text: After purchasing the iPhone 13, I‚Äôm genuinely impressed with its performance and features. Here‚Äôs a detailed review based on my experience:### Design and Build QualityThe iPhone 13 feels incredibly premium in hand. The flat edges and matte finish on the back give it a sleek and modern look. The build quality is top-notch, with the Ceramic Shield front adding a layer of durability that gives me confidence in its longevity.### DisplayThe 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display is absolutely stunning. The colors are vibrant, and the blacks are deep, making everything from photos to videos look fantastic. The brightness levels are impressive, and even in direct sunlight, the screen remains perfectly readable. The slightly smaller notch is a nice touch, offering a bit more screen space.### PerformanceThe A15 Bionic chip is a powerhouse. The iPhone 13 handles everything I throw at it with ease, from multitasking to gaming. Apps open almost instantly, and there's no lag whatsoever. It‚Äôs clear that this phone is built for speed and efficiency.### CameraThe camera system on the iPhone 13 is a standout feature. The 12MP wide and ultra-wide lenses capture stunning photos with great detail and color accuracy. Low-light performance is particularly impressive, thanks to the sensor-shift optical image stabilization. The new Photographic Styles and Cinematic mode are fantastic additions, allowing for creative freedom and professional-looking videos.### Battery LifeBattery life has been a pleasant surprise. I easily get through a full day of use on a single charge, even with heavy usage. The efficiency of the A15 Bionic chip and the slightly larger battery make a noticeable difference compared to previous models.### SoftwareIOS 15 is smooth and intuitive. The new features like Focus modes, enhanced FaceTime capabilities, and improved privacy controls make the user experience even better. Everything feels well-integrated and easy to use.### Overall ImpressionThe iPhone 13 has exceeded my expectations. It offers a perfect balance of performance, design, and innovative features. Whether it‚Äôs the stunning display, powerful camera system, or impressive battery life, every aspect of this phone feels well-thought-out and polished. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a premium smartphone experience.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone 15 A solid upgrade and value for money
review_text: DesignOne of the most noticeable changes to the iPhone 15 is its new design. The phone now has rounded edges, which makes it feel more comfortable in the hand. It also has a new camera bump that is less pronounced than the one on the iPhone 14. DisplayThe iPhone 15 has the same 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display as the iPhone 14. However, the new display is brighter and has better contrast. It also supports HDR10 and Dolby Vision.PerformanceThe iPhone 15 is powered by the new A16 Bionic chip, which is the fastest mobile chip on the market. The A16 Bionic chip is up to 20% faster than the A15 Bionic chip in the iPhone 14.CameraThe iPhone 15 has a new 48-megapixel main camera. The new camera sensor is larger than the one in the iPhone 14, and it has better low-light performance. The iPhone 15 also has a new 12-megapixel ultrawide camera and a new 12-megapixel telephoto camera.Battery lifeThe iPhone 15 has the same battery life as the iPhone 14. This means that you can expect to get around a day of use on a single charge.  Overall  The iPhone 15 is a solid upgrade over the iPhone 14.ProsNew design with rounded edgesMore powerful A16 Bionic chip found in 14 proNew 48-megapixel main cameraBrighter display with upto 2000 nits brightnessUSB C can be used for anythingDynamic IslandCons No 120hz display No Macro photography

Sound is also very big but very crystal clear. Value is on high side,  so though it is very good in all aspects,  many people may find it very difficult to purchase .

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone XR to iPhone 15
review_text: Just made the transition and here‚Äôs my POV on the first ~2 month of usePros- Battery Life is awesome, easily get about a day plus on this, so no Compliants- Screen fluidity is smooooooth! Understandable as I‚Äôm transitioning into an OLED from LCD in XR. The panel gets a solid peak brightness quotient so happy here- Screen brightness is good as compared to XR, 2200 nits, but I hardly go beyond 30% brightness to save some juice. Whilst outside I did crank it up and it‚Äôs spotless- Dynamic Island is fun, yet to use it to the fullest. Like the way it shows the ETA on delivery and Uber. Simple solution instead of you having to get into the app to check on the ETA- Weight, this phone is soo bloody light!! Understandable as XR was a brick, this is soo welcome- Camera is awesome, love the 48MP intervention, the portrait mode and cinematic mode does the job for me.- The Apple eco system, I enjoy seamless integration of my Watch, Mac, IPad Air and IPhone- Apples approach on Security!- Transferring data from my XR to 15 using the built in app is flawlessCons- The phone was over heating , there is a solution to this from Apple = back up the phone and then erase and reset the phone‚Ä¶ including your eSIM settings.. once done set up the phone with the back up‚Ä¶.. works like a charm- I still believe Apple should have thrown in a charging brick with such purchasesIndustry memes- USB C : honestly don‚Äôt give a jack for the reviews out there on this. It‚Äôs just a mode of charging for me and that‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm not going to be transferring any data so yea, 2.0 speed yadadada - thank you so much- Blue is not blue but white! Think people whining about this should go back to 13/14 or those ludicrous blues in Androids!! These are pestle shades people!!- Buying an Apple product to show off!! I mean, you even serious? You buy a product and then comment on why you should not buy one?- 60hz refresh rate for a 80k phone : save your jokes people, there are many of us who appreciate quality and security than how the screen refreshes. For non gamers like me, panel that is here is apt. I‚Äôve seen a ton of folks buying 120hz phones and using it only to make calls, watch some videos and for textingTips of managing battery health- Switch off background app refresh for apps you don‚Äôt need back ground refresh- Avoid wireless charging as this heats your devise up- I charge my phone only using a power bank  not direct wired or wireless charging- Don‚Äôt let the battery go below 20%, keep it always between 95% and 20%- Switch off location services and allow only certain app that needs your location service- Switch on Charging Optimisation under the battery section- I don‚Äôt use vibrate mode for rings/incoming calls etc- My XR after 5 years of use has 86% battery health so I guess I know what I‚Äôm recommending aboveVendor Experience : Appario Retail Private Limited. 5/5, been a regular customer and they have never disappointed me even once. The purchase experience is breezy and quick, thanks team for the support and look forward to the collaboration in the future.‚Ä¶.. watch out for this space. Will keep updating in case of significant change in experience

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The BEST iPhone EVERRRRRRR! : iPhone 15 review after 2 weeks of continuous use
review_text: The display is impressively bright, despite the 60 Hz, which I thought might be a drawback coming from a 120 Hz Android device. Surprisingly, it feels the same. The battery life is solid, providing around 1.5 days for mild phone users. As a developer, with light usage for content consumption and social media, I get around 8 hours of screen on time with 25-30% battery left. It charges quickly to 50% and then trickle charges to 100%, adapting to usage patterns for faster charging. Initially, there were some battery drain and heating issues, but they resolved as the phone learned my usage patterns.Now, the camera is impressive, especially in low light conditions. Despite lacking a dedicated long exposure mode, the default night option, averaging around 3 seconds, captures details even in the dark. Compared to the iPhone 14 and S21FE, the camera quality is top-notch. The auto portrait detection is a standout feature. Believe me no one explain the real use of that auto portrait theoretically until you try it.In terms of network, the dual 5G standby supports Vi and JIO 5G (eSim). Inside my house, I get around 500 Mbps, and outside easily surpass 1 Gbps. Call quality is excellent, with two introduced modes in the mic option available in the control center.This is my personal opinion; I'll update if I find anything noteworthy.

First iphone and not up to the mark
review_text: After using for two days, here's what I found out. First, Android is way better when it comes to selfies. I'm literally looking for Xiaomi 13 pro to drop and I'll just jump for it. Iphone 15 is good when it comes to back camera, which is just unparalleled, with it's spectacular details and original color retention. However, the selfie camera is much worse, it catches all the blemishes on your face and makes you look uglier. Sound quality is superb, without a doubt. Scrolling through the phone is a bit slow compared to other phones, because of the 60hz, but it's still bearable. Voice calling sound is good and clear. USB c is a good thing which at least allowed me to charge on a different charger because I didn't have Apple charger right away. The height of Iphone 15 and plus is funny because they have almost all the same thing just height is bigger for plus. Also, I paid 3k more on this platform because the next day the price dropped on Amazon. At the end of the day, iphone is good, but Android always wins, no matter what.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone 15 A solid upgrade and value for money
review_text: DesignOne of the most noticeable changes to the iPhone 15 is its new design. The phone now has rounded edges, which makes it feel more comfortable in the hand. It also has a new camera bump that is less pronounced than the one on the iPhone 14. DisplayThe iPhone 15 has the same 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display as the iPhone 14. However, the new display is brighter and has better contrast. It also supports HDR10 and Dolby Vision.PerformanceThe iPhone 15 is powered by the new A16 Bionic chip, which is the fastest mobile chip on the market. The A16 Bionic chip is up to 20% faster than the A15 Bionic chip in the iPhone 14.CameraThe iPhone 15 has a new 48-megapixel main camera. The new camera sensor is larger than the one in the iPhone 14, and it has better low-light performance. The iPhone 15 also has a new 12-megapixel ultrawide camera and a new 12-megapixel telephoto camera.Battery lifeThe iPhone 15 has the same battery life as the iPhone 14. This means that you can expect to get around a day of use on a single charge.  Overall  The iPhone 15 is a solid upgrade over the iPhone 14.ProsNew design with rounded edgesMore powerful A16 Bionic chip found in 14 proNew 48-megapixel main cameraBrighter display with upto 2000 nits brightnessUSB C can be used for anythingDynamic IslandCons No 120hz display No Macro photography

review_text: First of it looks very very prime quality and nicely fit in your hands. I am an android user still I don't face issue at the time of operating. In India you have to download required apps from app store free of cost. Apple store not available in India. You can use two sim , one physical micro sim and other esim. Conversion of physical micro sim to esim is very easy and happen in just two hours from your home. But after conversion sms service restricted for 24 hours as per guidelines if TRAI. No issue of connectivity if you have good network strength of your desired operator. Very crispy screen gives no strain on your eyes. Battery life is awesome , 1 one day for heavy user and 2 days for light user. Smooth performance of IOS system, no lags ,no glitches , not a single problem when you get to use. Sound is also very big but very crystal clear. Value is on high side,  so though it is very good in all aspects,  many people may find it very difficult to purchase .

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
iPhone XR to iPhone 15
review_text: Just made the transition and here‚Äôs my POV on the first ~2 month of usePros- Battery Life is awesome, easily get about a day plus on this, so no Compliants- Screen fluidity is smooooooth! Understandable as I‚Äôm transitioning into an OLED from LCD in XR. The panel gets a solid peak brightness quotient so happy here- Screen brightness is good as compared to XR, 2200 nits, but I hardly go beyond 30% brightness to save some juice. Whilst outside I did crank it up and it‚Äôs spotless- Dynamic Island is fun, yet to use it to the fullest. Like the way it shows the ETA on delivery and Uber. Simple solution instead of you having to get into the app to check on the ETA- Weight, this phone is soo bloody light!! Understandable as XR was a brick, this is soo welcome- Camera is awesome, love the 48MP intervention, the portrait mode and cinematic mode does the job for me.- The Apple eco system, I enjoy seamless integration of my Watch, Mac, IPad Air and IPhone- Apples approach on Security!- Transferring data from my XR to 15 using the built in app is flawlessCons- The phone was over heating , there is a solution to this from Apple = back up the phone and then erase and reset the phone‚Ä¶ including your eSIM settings.. once done set up the phone with the back up‚Ä¶.. works like a charm- I still believe Apple should have thrown in a charging brick with such purchasesIndustry memes- USB C : honestly don‚Äôt give a jack for the reviews out there on this. It‚Äôs just a mode of charging for me and that‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm not going to be transferring any data so yea, 2.0 speed yadadada - thank you so much- Blue is not blue but white! Think people whining about this should go back to 13/14 or those ludicrous blues in Androids!! These are pestle shades people!!- Buying an Apple product to show off!! I mean, you even serious? You buy a product and then comment on why you should not buy one?- 60hz refresh rate for a 80k phone : save your jokes people, there are many of us who appreciate quality and security than how the screen refreshes. For non gamers like me, panel that is here is apt. I‚Äôve seen a ton of folks buying 120hz phones and using it only to make calls, watch some videos and for textingTips of managing battery health- Switch off background app refresh for apps you don‚Äôt need back ground refresh- Avoid wireless charging as this heats your devise up- I charge my phone only using a power bank  not direct wired or wireless charging- Don‚Äôt let the battery go below 20%, keep it always between 95% and 20%- Switch off location services and allow only certain app that needs your location service- Switch on Charging Optimisation under the battery section- I don‚Äôt use vibrate mode for rings/incoming calls etc- My XR after 5 years of use has 86% battery health so I guess I know what I‚Äôm recommending aboveVendor Experience : Appario Retail Private Limited. 5/5, been a regular customer and they have never disappointed me even once. The purchase experience is breezy and quick, thanks team for the support and look forward to the collaboration in the future.‚Ä¶.. watch out for this space. Will keep updating in case of significant change in experience

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
The BEST iPhone EVERRRRRRR! : iPhone 15 review after 2 weeks of continuous use
review_text: The display is impressively bright, despite the 60 Hz, which I thought might be a drawback coming from a 120 Hz Android device. Surprisingly, it feels the same. The battery life is solid, providing around 1.5 days for mild phone users. As a developer, with light usage for content consumption and social media, I get around 8 hours of screen on time with 25-30% battery left. It charges quickly to 50% and then trickle charges to 100%, adapting to usage patterns for faster charging. Initially, there were some battery drain and heating issues, but they resolved as the phone learned my usage patterns.Now, the camera is impressive, especially in low light conditions. Despite lacking a dedicated long exposure mode, the default night option, averaging around 3 seconds, captures details even in the dark. Compared to the iPhone 14 and S21FE, the camera quality is top-notch. The auto portrait detection is a standout feature. Believe me no one explain the real use of that auto portrait theoretically until you try it.In terms of network, the dual 5G standby supports Vi and JIO 5G (eSim). Inside my house, I get around 500 Mbps, and outside easily surpass 1 Gbps. Call quality is excellent, with two introduced modes in the mic option available in the control center.This is my personal opinion; I'll update if I find anything noteworthy.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
First iphone and not up to the mark
review_text: After using for two days, here's what I found out. First, Android is way better when it comes to selfies. I'm literally looking for Xiaomi 13 pro to drop and I'll just jump for it. Iphone 15 is good when it comes to back camera, which is just unparalleled, with it's spectacular details and original color retention. However, the selfie camera is much worse, it catches all the blemishes on your face and makes you look uglier. Sound quality is superb, without a doubt. Scrolling through the phone is a bit slow compared to other phones, because of the 60hz, but it's still bearable. Voice calling sound is good and clear. USB c is a good thing which at least allowed me to charge on a different charger because I didn't have Apple charger right away. The height of Iphone 15 and plus is funny because they have almost all the same thing just height is bigger for plus. Also, I paid 3k more on this platform because the next day the price dropped on Amazon. At the end of the day, iphone is good, but Android always wins, no matter what.

review_text: I am writing this review after 1 month of usage.First i would like to start from the key specs of this phone Processor:  1.Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 Octa core (single(1)  core with 3.2GHz clock speed)4 nm flagship processor.  2. Supercomputing Chip Q1.My openion: The best processor under this price range.It can  handle almost very hard situations easily.Taking  about the super computing chip,done a great  thing.Those game lovers definitely love this  phone(tried bgmi-90fps..... awesome feedback)Design:  1.Slim phone  2.Dual tone vegan leather finish(which is nice)  3.Body frame is plastic(Not metal--Disapointed)  4.Given IR blaster, which is also niceDisplay:  1.Ultra-narrow bezels are just 0.15 cm.  2.1.5K 144 Hz LTPO AMOLED Display(it's a great thing  and feels good.Dynamic refreh rate from 0 to  120Hz.144Hz refresh rate obtained in gaming scenario)  3.452 PPI Pixel density,6.78 -inch (17.22 cm) flat screen  having 3000nits peak brightness.2000 Hz Instant Touch  Sampling Rate.  4.wet touch technology which is good and effective in  many scenarIOS,pulse width modulation for eye  protection.Display is totally very good.(Suggestion..Better with 2K disply‚ò∫Ô∏è).Battery:  1.5160 mAh Massive Battery.Which easily last a day for  light usage upto 1 and half day.  2.120W Flash charge Charging time 25 to 100 approax 20  to 30mnts Varies according temparature of the phone  and chrging conditions.Camera:(squircle cam)  1.50 MP IMX920 Night Vision Camera.Which is good and  gives better portrait shots.Editing options are also good.  2. 8 MP Ultra Wide-Angle Camera.(It's not good as much as  I expected.Need upgrade..Only two cam present macro is  absent which absolutely excellent).  3.Video quality is great 8K in Day light and 4K  at night.  4.16MP Front camera..I am not a selfie lover But in my  openion it's not upto the mark. Could be better.Finger print scanner:  It's a decent optical fingerprint scanner working fast  and accurate.costomisation, animation are also good.Cooling system:  6K Vapour chamber liquid cooling system which is a dual  layer metal mesh.It's good and effective. some time  taking so much time to cool, while cooling manually  from iManager it's cooling fast.Could be more sensitive.Operating System:  Funtouch OS 14 Based on android 14  ‚Ä¢ I am first time on this funtouch OS.I really like it and  Minimal bloatwares.Only problems with the notification with V app store must be manually disabledpros:  1.Excellent Hardware performance.  2.Great Display  3.Good main camera(especially portrait shots)-normal skin  toning and small exposure is also there...Some of them  likes that some Not.  4.Decent software  5.Best Battery backup  6.Game changer  7.Great Charging.  An all-rounder under this price rangeCons:  1.Ultrawide camera....Much disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è  2.V-Appstoreüò°Phased issue:At this time while enabling preferred 5g most of the time incoming call is not connecting.I Don't think so it's the problem with the phones network it's the issue with the sim tower(if 5g is all around Hope it will definitely okey)Hopes my openion and review will help someone to decide whether this phone suits with their usage or not..I personally recommend this phone for mad game lovers and hardcore users.. Further updates will definitely add with this review..Thanks..

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good flagship performance
review_text: Design and BuildThe iQOO Neo 9 Pro has a sleek and modern design, featuring a premium glass back and an aluminum frame. The ergonomics are excellent, making it comfortable to hold and use for extended periods.DisplayThe phone boasts a 6.78-inch AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate, providing a smooth and immersive visual experience. The high resolution ensures sharp and vibrant colors, making it ideal for gaming, streaming, and general usage.PerformancePowered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor and up to 12GB of RAM, the iQOO Neo 9 Pro delivers top-tier performance. Multitasking is seamless, and the phone handles demanding applications and games with ease. The Adreno 740 GPU enhances the gaming experience, providing high frame rates and smooth graphics.Battery LifeThe 5000mAh battery offers impressive longevity, easily lasting a full day of heavy usage. The 120W fast charging capability is a standout feature, allowing you to charge the phone from 0 to 100% in about 20 minutes, minimizing downtime.CameraThe iQOO Neo 9 Pro is equipped with a versatile triple-camera setup. The primary 64MP sensor captures detailed and vibrant photos, even in low-light conditions. The ultra-wide and macro lenses add flexibility to your photography, allowing for creative shots in various scenarIOS. The 16MP front camera delivers sharp and clear selfies.SoftwareRunning on iQOO UI based on Android 13, the software experience is smooth and user-friendly. It offers a range of customization options and useful features, enhancing overall usability.ConnectivityThe iQOO Neo 9 Pro supports 5G connectivity, ensuring fast and reliable internet speeds. It also includes Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.3, and NFC, providing a comprehensive connectivity suite for all your needs.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Some Great, some good and some disappointment.
review_text: Review after 45 days-PROS-‚úì‚úì(The Good)Display:- Best part of the device is the display.. it's stunning flagship level either you watch photo or video on it. Got very Brighter and Deep blacks are üî• visual enhancement and MEMC make it more convenient üî•plays 4k HDR video better than its compititions.Processor and processing:- In this category i can call it a flagship killer. Literally it's a monster .It handles everything like champ and IQOO's tuning with 8Gen 2 is just awesome . It's best optimised processor under 45K devices. I run 1 native Camera app, with 2 Gcam app capturing photos simultaneously with a photo editor editing  with Instagram, Facebook, Twitter open...and it handles everything with ease. Well done Iqoo. Fully Paisa wasool.Camera:- IMX920 is lit üî•üî• sensor is so so capable. Photos coming out of it is gorgeous... Very crisp and tons of details. It doesn't boost sky colour like others and captures 90% true to life type yet little vivid and crisp Iqoo style photo. Night mode is the best package. Captures lots of details in even in less light. Almost no noise in night. Iqoo and vivos night mode are industry best, no one can beat.Ultrawide:- firstly it's little disappointing to have a 8 mp sensor with 50 mp. But good tuning... captures good photos with decent dynamic range. Obviously better than some 12 mp ultrawides. Ofcourse lacks details as 8 mp yet good specially in daylight.Selfie cam- it's a decent camera. Got better after update. But lacks night mode and 4k recording.‚úìDecent:- haptics are decent. Set haptics settings high to get better experience. it's medium in default.Sound is decent too... But Dolby Atmos would have been great. Refresh rate is very well optimised..Battery üîã:- it's good battery despite being a performance centric phone. Depends on uses. I'm getting continuous  6h 30 min -7 h SOT with 20% battery left.*Here is a battery saving tips - Never charge above 90% and below 20%. In night Use dark theme when use device less and dark amoled wallpapers which will save idle draining. Turn off auto brightness. Select Network mode to 4G if 5G isn't necessary. 5G drains battery most. Keep device in cool temperature while charging and using. Follow these You will get better experience for sure.√ó√óConsUI:- software experience is the main villain.... horrible experience sometimes... Ex-while playing 4K videos on YouTube crashing after 5min everytime. Where other UI improving rapidly IQOO should be attentive to it's UI polishing.*Update -Regarding app crashing, IQOO addressed the problem with recent software update.Heating:- it's beginning of summer and Phone does heat up with uses. Sometimes it's a bit high though it's not overheating. Device is usable because of plastic frame. I think it's because of -IQOO unlocked full potential of 8Gen2 with dedicated Q1 chip. Not sure of the working of Cooling system. In brief - Yes, device has heating issue.So, use and charge device in cool environment otherwise it will impact the battery life.Design:-design is subjective but it is something that stopping it to be called flagship killer...IQOO should use Better quality vegan leather atleast.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Not for Gamers (BGMI) or 4 finger players
review_text: **Pros....Everything is on the phone is alright...Bgmi or big apps open very fast and run smoothly... Camera is very good...No issues for non gamers... battery charged very first and back up is also good...**Cons....No 3.5 mm Jack socket..So when I connect my ear phone by type C to 3.5 mm Jack when playing BGMI, I can't place my right hand properly although I have big palm...then I rotate the phone and it's better than previous but game is minimising by accidental touch on bottom ..which is not acceptable although now I have noticed a bit improvement.....If no head phone jack given then plz place type C port on Side, not in bottom...No video posted in YouTube regarding this problem.....UI is not up to the mark but manageable...A bit heating issue noticed, I hope it will be manageable during summer..Otherwise everything is alright...3 star given because of the highlights that it's a gaming phone but it's not for that particular issue...otherwise would have given 4 star..

title:

My detailed review after 20 days of use
review_text: I got the glass back version of the Neo 9 Pro 8/128 gb (UFS 3.1) in black color @33k with card discountFirst I will start with the Cons of this device*****Cons*****1.Hole punch cutout for the front camera is too big and it really effects my usage watching multimedia.2.The back design isnt very good the camera are too big and not really proportional to the size of mobile and also they serve no purpose as they arent large sensors but a preference of design .3.Notifications and Software : Funtouch OS isnt very fun they are many notifications from V app store and the device also some with so much bloatware and doesnt even support disabiling for few apps.4.In landscape mode, there seems to be a glitch with notifications where they appear as if there's an additional notification stacked above them, even though there isn't one‚Äîit just leaves a blank space5.The included case and screen protector are very bad .The case gets a gas pocket at its back and comes off while using .It just increasing the waste .*****Pros*****1.Camera performance is very good and do try the Master B/W style in the back camera.The 2x potraits are very good when it gets the edge detection right.Go to the camera settings and turn on motion autofocus and potrait framing and explore more some of the features are off by default2.Battery and Charging is a win for me It takes close to 30mins to charge from 20% -30% to 100%3.Customization features are well built .I can customize Lock screen clock quick toggles on lockscreen Fingerprint sensor look and animation etc .Great customization features4.For me the glass back feels premium enough in hand.I feel its the better option to go with instead of plastic leathry red finish.I am satisfied with black one.5.Performance is very obivious comes with comes with 8gen2 chip no lags observed when using and i saw few issues with heating I have no such issues with my device .6.Software upsates:3yrs software and 4 years of security updates.VERDICT:I would recommed this under 35k for someone who is looking for a smartphone with great performance and a good camera and a decent overall experience .

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Good hardware disappointing software
review_text: After around 3 weeks of usage, here are my ratings:- Look and Feel: 9.5/10 - The phone feels great in hand with excellent weight balance and a nice leather back.- Performance: 10/10 - Top-notch performance with no issues encountered.- Battery Backup: 8.5/10 - Good battery backup despite heavy usage (9 to 12 hours daily), with screen-on time ranging from 6 hours 30 minutes to 8 hours 47 minutes.- Display: 9/10 - The display is vibrant and satisfying.- Main Camera in Daylight: 8/10 - Decent performance in daylight conditions.- Ultrawide: 7/10 - Average performance in ultrawide shots.- Front Camera: 5/10 - Disappointing front camera performance.- Main Camera in Low Light: 5/10 - Main camera performance in low light is subpar.- Software: 4/10 - Despite purchasing the 12GB/256GB variant, the software experience leaves much to be desired. Coming from experiences with OnePlus, MI, Realme, Asus, and Pixel Experience custom ROMs, this phone's software fails to stand out positively. While it offers some customization options, in animations, it falls short in several areas.Firstly, the device comes loaded with bloatware that cannot be uninstalled even with ADB, cluttering the user experience. Most preinstalled apps are subpar, especially the dialer and launcher. The launcher lacks essential customization features like a bottom search bar, options to change icon size, or the number of icons in the app drawer. Additionally, it lacks intuitive gestures like double-tap to lock. If you use custom launcher it will block gesture to switch app and it will not work at all.The dialer experience is too cluttered in my opinion and it lacks feature like call announcement. Although it offers the option to record calls without notifications and enable auto call recording, it also have issues with Bluetooth connectivity. Furthermore, the apps demand excessive permissions, such as the IQOO account app requiring contact permissions despite offering no relevant functionality.Among the frustrating aspects is the Vappstore, one of the most intrusive apps I've encountered. While it allows the disabling of hot app and hot games shortcuts, it inserts unwanted shortcuts into the 'open with' menu, needlessly cluttering the interface. Instead of presenting two options, users are bombarded with five, making simple tasks unnecessarily complicated.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best performance.
review_text: The iQOO Z9 is a phone that is making a splash in the mid-range market. With its great performance, top-notch cameras, and stunning display, it is definitely worth considering if you are looking for a reliable smartphone without spending a lot of money.PerformanceThe iQOO Z9 is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 7200 chipset, which delivers the fastest performance in its class, making it perfect for gaming and heavy-duty tasks. With up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and up to 256GB of storage, you can enjoy seamless multitasking.Camera capabilitiesThe main camera is a 50-megapixel Sony IMX882 sensor with an f/1.8 aperture, accompanied by a 2-megapixel depth sensor. The camera takes sharp photos with accurate colors, and the Night mode delivers impressive results. The 16-megapixel front-facing camera is perfect for selfies and video calls.Display and DesignThe 6.67-inch AMOLED display is a great device with a 120Hz refresh rate, HDR compliance, and 1800 nits of peak brightness. Although its design isn‚Äôt the most premium, it‚Äôs well built and comfortable to hold.Battery LifeThe 5,000mAh battery offers reliable battery life, easily lasting a full day with moderate usage. Fast charging support (44W) means you can charge your battery quickly.SoftwareThe iQOO Z9 runs on Android 14 with Funtouch OS 14, which offers a seamless user experience. You can expect two years of software updates and three years of security updates.VerdictThe iQOO Z9 is an excellent option for those who want a powerful, feature-packed phone without spending a lot of money. With its impressive performance, cameras, and display, it's definitely worth considering.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
All Rounder Smartphone
review_text: The iQOO Z9 5G is a solid option in the sub-Rs 20,000 category, offering robust performance, good camera capabilities, and decent battery life.Performance and Software:-The iQOO Z9 5G is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 7200 chipset, providing smooth performance for daily tasks and gaming. It scored highly on benchmarks, outperforming many competitors in its price range. The phone handles games like Call of Duty and Genshin Impact well without significant overheating. It runs on Android 14 with Funtouch OS 14, though it comes with a fair amount of pre-installed apps, which can be uninstalled.Camera:- The iQOO Z9 5G features a 50MP main camera with OIS, delivering impressive daylight shots with good dynamic range and color reproduction. The lack of an ultra-wide camera is a downside, but the 2MP depth sensor performs adequately for portrait shots. The 16MP front camera provides good selfies with accurate skin tones.Display:- The 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate offers vibrant colors and smooth navigation. However, legibility in bright sunlight could be better. The display adjusts refresh rates intelligently to save battery life.Battery Life:- The 5,000mAh battery provides solid endurance, lasting a full day with moderate to heavy usage. The phone supports 44W fast charging, reaching 50% in about 30 minutes and a full charge in just over an hour.Build and Design:- The phone has a plastic body with a glossy back and a solid build quality. It also features an IP54 rating for limited dust and water resistance, which is rare in this price segment.Cons:- The main drawbacks include the lack of a microSD card slot and the considerable amount of pre-installed apps. Additionally, iQOO only promises two years of software updates, which is less than some competitors.Overall, the iQOO Z9 5G is a well-rounded phone with excellent performance and a good camera, making it a strong contender in the budget 5G smartphone market.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone, justifies the price. One of those Use-and-Discard after 3 years phones.
review_text: I upgraded my phone to this after 3-4 years (Poco X3). So, this is the context upon which most of my review will be based off of.The price I paid and the items I received -1. Price: 20000 (Offer price) - 1000 (ICICI CC Offer) - 1600 (Realme 1 exch) - 1000 (bonus exch off) + 150 (Exch fee) - 300 (6% off on 5000rs amzn voucher purchase via HDFC Smart buy - Millennia CC) = 16,250 INR2. Items Recd: Phone (256GB) + FREE Wired Type-C Earphones (Vivo XE710)Review:The phone feels sturdy in hand, the polycarbonate frame and back are very good in quality. You have your handset with a pre-applied screen guard, transparent TPU case (doesn't fit tightly, there air gap between body and the case at the back so it feels loose), NO Type-C to 3.5mm adapter which is a downer, 44W adapter, Type A to Type C cable and Manuals. We get free wired earphones which are delivered separately, although I could've settled for a Type-C to Type-A adapter better. The earphones are decent - not too sturdy in build quality, flat audio output (lacking base), loudness, I felt, was a bit low too, good for calls.Coming to the phone:I feel the phone is snappy, haven't seen any lags in opening of the apps or anything. Yeah, while scrolling within the apps, there's a few stuttters here and there, but I think that's because of internet speed, causing the newer content to load slow.My major gripe with my unit (I dunno about others) is the VERY IFFY Fingerprint Sensor, it doesn't work at all sometimes for me, usually it does. But with a new phone it feels like a downer.I faced this problem only once, but if you've had it, then do restart your device to get back to narmalcy, when you switch your device to dark mode for the first time, the white text appears to be pink while scrolling. This happened only once and upon restart, got solved.In the battery and charging department I feel that the phone does a good job. I am able to use the phone for a day easily with around 35% remaining at EOD. The battery charges pretty quickly too. During my usage and charging, I didn't feel any heating issues. All this without the battery saver on.The speakers are good but should've been louder. I do feel that they are at good loudness at 200% but don't know if it's a good option to use, keeping in mind the device longevity.Cameras are all decent, no need to use the beautification as even without it, you get some beautification applied. Front and back both do their jobs well, no problems faced there. Images are sharp amd focusing is good.4G+ and 5G get detected quickly, calls are fine and the proximity sensor is good (never failed me). The wifi detection is good as well.Final Verdict:I am a guy who doesn't care about the post covid affect on the price, I check the absolute price and judge. So with that said, I feel that the phone is a really good deal, well balanced and definitely a good recommendation. The processor (DM7200) will ensure that the performance sustains for atleast 3 more years.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
The Perfect midrange phone, comes with a lot of bugs
review_text: Brought this for 11.7k after exchanging Realme 9 SE+Bank offer.First impression after using for 1 day. I'll start with the problems as that's all you care about if you're thinking of buying this.Problems :1) The phone has a lot of bugs.Screen freezes randomlyNotifications bar, sometimes doesn't come down when you try to pull it down. Its Fixed after restarting. But in the last 6 hours , it happened 3 times.The Keyboard doesn't open sometimes .When you click to type something, the keyboard doesn't open.Its fixed if you lock and unlock the phone. But it's a problem regardless.Tried switching between Gboard and other keyboards. Still doesn't fix the issue.The phone comes with a pre setting , where long pressing the power button opens Google assistant instead of powering off. Its not an issue. You can change it in the settings.In my case , i had this problem along with the " notification bar not working" issue. Means I can't shut the phone down. The power off button is in the notifications bar.Initially I thought I had to wait till the power goes off, üòû.My phone froze and i couldn't even force it to shut down.Found online that i had to press the volume down and power button to force restart it.So change the Powerbutton to power off immediately.2) Overheating.Phone has mild Overheating issue.I am not a gamer.After setting up the phone, initially Overheating is expected for sometime.But even after 6 hours of just watching YouTube videos , the phone was a bit too warm to touch. Not too much. But I am sure gamers will complain about the heating.Maybe it will get optimised over night. I will update accordingly3) Icons are too big. Even in the smallest settings I feel it's too big.Its probably a personal problem, as I switched from Realme which gives complete customisation of icons.4) BloatwareI can understand the usual blaotwares like hot apps and hot games which come preloaded. But i didn't expect the Jovi home app (shortcut app for home screen) to be a permanent thing in the phone.The icon for that is permanently fixed on the notification bar. Its placement is where usually settings icon should be and it's annoying.Can't remove it , nor disable the app internally.Most of these problems might get fixed in the first update. Let's see.Pros1)The UI is extremely smooth.The animations are perfect. Smooth as butter.If you want the phone to feel even more snappy, turn off all  animations and it feels as fast as lightning.The fingerprint senser and unlocking is extremely smooth and snappy.2) Screen is great. The colors and brightness makes a great viewing experience.3)The battery lasts a day, Just as advertised. Almost 6 hours of YouTube, an hour of Browsing, 3 hours of Social media, and some 3 hours of Streaming and the battery was 17 percent left  down from a 100.(Power saving mode was on (after 30 percent). refresh rate set to 60).12 hours of moderate use. Enough to last a day. Didn't try gaming yet tho.0 to 100 , Charging takes around 45 minutes.#Overheating during charging is there. But that's common in all fast charging phonesOverall, great choice if you can wait for the software updates to fix the issues.I don't think there is a better choice for budget gamers other than this (below 20000).

title:

Camera cost and batteryüìà
review_text: The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G offers an attractive package, especially for users seeking solid performance at a budget-friendly price. Here‚Äôs a closer look at its key aspects:Design and Display:The Aqua Flow variant looks sleek with its gradient finish, adding a touch of elegance. The phone is lightweight and comfortable to hold, making it easy for one-handed use. Its 6.58-inch Full HD+ display is sharp and vibrant, offering good color reproduction and brightness for media consumption. Though not AMOLED, the display performs well in outdoor lighting conditions and provides smooth scrolling with a 120Hz refresh rate.Performance:Powered by the Dimensity 6300 5G chipset, this device ensures a snappy and fluid user experience. It handles multitasking well, although the 4GB RAM might struggle slightly with heavier apps and games when compared to 6GB or 8GB variants. For regular usage like social media, video streaming, and casual gaming, the phone performs admirably. The inclusion of 5G support is a strong future-proofing move, especially at this price point.Camera:The 50MP Sony AI Camera setup is one of the phone‚Äôs strongest features. It takes good-quality pictures in daylight with sharp details and vivid colors. However, low-light performance could be better, as images tend to get noisy in dim environments. The AI optimizations, such as scene recognition, enhance the photography experience, making it easy to capture decent shots with minimal effort. The front camera is decent for selfies and video calls, though not exceptional.Battery and Charging:The phone packs a 5000mAh battery, which easily lasts a full day of moderate use. The charger in the box is a nice touch, offering fast charging support that gets the phone charged in under two hours. Battery optimization is good, ensuring you won‚Äôt run out of juice during regular day-to-day tasks.Storage and Software:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs ample room for apps, media, and files, and the phone supports microSD expansion if needed. The software experience is clean and customizable with iQOO‚Äôs Funtouch OS, which runs smoothly on Android. The UI is user-friendly, though there are some pre-installed apps that may not be necessary, but they can be uninstalled.Verdict:The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G is a competitive mid-range smartphone with solid performance, 5G support, a reliable camera, and good battery life. If you‚Äôre looking for a budget-friendly 5G phone with a stylish design, it‚Äôs a solid pick, but the 4

Budget friendly great performance, 90hz smoothness, phone under 12k(6gb) with decent Camera
review_text: I am reviewing this after fully used and drop, ip test with pros and cons. If you want a phone with great performance, decent Camara also with latest Android 14 under 12k this phone will be perfect..Best things are it's comes with Android 14 with funtouch os (if you are previously Vivo user you will got this) which is a great experience for me as 1st time user.On these segment its comes with 50 mp Sony IMX sensor üòò with popular modes like slomo, which is really appreciated for budget lovers..It's also supported 2k resolution with no lag..ü§©You will get 6gb ram with auto booster and 128 gb variant under 12k, it's a massive storage on budget..ü§óIp64 with dust resistant, I have compared with other phones on this budget they have ip54 with no dust resistant feature..üòÑThis are the main points that I liked much, also I liked the wifi 5, fingerprint it's really fast with no animation, less bloat apps, ultra game mode etc..üòâLet's see the cons that I've got..üòëü•¥Charging watt should be better at least 20 watts with inbox charger, 10 watt charger comes with it but the phone is supported 25 watt fast charging.. but 5000mah is good for long lasting uses.. charging time 5-80% was 1.15 hrs with inbox charger.Display should be comes with at least type IPS, it's comes with LCD display and decent colour gamut and 90hz gives most of all other phones on these budget. 1080p display will be much appreciated..Design is good but if you have seen the poco c61 design that is comes with new radial cam design, so it's a disappointed because that's a under 7k phone..üòÜAnimation uses cause phone slower than usual..bso I will suggest not to use that..Overall seen, decent Camera and Design, great performance (I will suggest to buy 6gb variant) with 5g variant, full day battery backup (for less gamers), IP64 with dust resistant üòç, latest Android 14 with 2 years of major upgrades and 3 years of security updates, handy weight with silicon cover on box.. Overall good on these budget segment with trust of VIVO.. ü´∂

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Value for money
review_text: I bought the Mocha brown color and believe me, everyone else had trouble believing that it's a budget phone!My delivery experience with exchange:As usual, whenever I want to EXCHANGE a mobile, I have to rely on Amazon instead of FLIP(FRAUD)KART!I think nobody should exchange mobile with Fraudkart because their exchange system is crooked. They have given the responsibility of valuing the old mobile to their delivery boy. Now the delivery boys have become king and always find out unnecessarily small,  artificial defects in the mobile so that your valuation is decreased by 50%, then they will ask for BRIBE openly like Rs.500 or 1000 to assign the higher valuation! I have seen it happen with dozens of my friends and colleagues who were too naive to fall for Fraudkart's schemes.Hence, I always give old mobiles to Amazon in exchange for new ones, AMAZON DELIVERY GUYS NEVER TRIED TO DEFRAUD ME IN THE LAST 10 YEARS. I behave like a responsible customer and declare the genuine condition of the Mobile beforehand such as scratches on screen, body cracks etc. and the delivery guys accept it without any arguments. KUDOS TO AMAZON for such a transparent process!About the Mobile:I have a OnePlus 11 but was too tensed about it especially while getting millions of calls and messages everyday so I decided to buy a secondary mobile which could be abused without any guilt. BTW I just realised that I always had a mobile with AMOLED screen right since the early days when I bought the Galaxy S2 when it was launched! I never ever bought one with a LCD screen ever and this Iqoo Z9 Lite is the first one and I don't hate it as much as I hoped I would.Display quality is far better than cheap LCD mobiles and 90 Hz frequency is an icing on the cake. Since it's a 720p resolution, I can see the pixelated texts if I look closely but that's an exception, normally I don't mind the lower resolution in day to day life. I wish the max brightness was higher but hey, it's a budget mobile so you can't get everything in it!Do note that this mobile HAS ONLY 1 SINGLE MICROPHONE at the bottom, no additional mics for noise cancellation at our end. I am pretty sure I will hear complaints from the call receiver when I am in a crowded place with lots of background noise.The OS is pretty smooth and fast but quite laggy in comparison to a OnePlus Nord or Redmi HyperOS.Conclusion: I could not find a better deal for my requirements so I bought this mobile but others should definitely explore other options if they are going to buy it as their one & only mobile.

review_text: The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G offers an attractive package, especially for users seeking solid performance at a budget-friendly price. Here‚Äôs a closer look at its key aspects:Design and Display:The Aqua Flow variant looks sleek with its gradient finish, adding a touch of elegance. The phone is lightweight and comfortable to hold, making it easy for one-handed use. Its 6.58-inch Full HD+ display is sharp and vibrant, offering good color reproduction and brightness for media consumption. Though not AMOLED, the display performs well in outdoor lighting conditions and provides smooth scrolling with a 120Hz refresh rate.Performance:Powered by the Dimensity 6300 5G chipset, this device ensures a snappy and fluid user experience. It handles multitasking well, although the 4GB RAM might struggle slightly with heavier apps and games when compared to 6GB or 8GB variants. For regular usage like social media, video streaming, and casual gaming, the phone performs admirably. The inclusion of 5G support is a strong future-proofing move, especially at this price point.Camera:The 50MP Sony AI Camera setup is one of the phone‚Äôs strongest features. It takes good-quality pictures in daylight with sharp details and vivid colors. However, low-light performance could be better, as images tend to get noisy in dim environments. The AI optimizations, such as scene recognition, enhance the photography experience, making it easy to capture decent shots with minimal effort. The front camera is decent for selfies and video calls, though not exceptional.Battery and Charging:The phone packs a 5000mAh battery, which easily lasts a full day of moderate use. The charger in the box is a nice touch, offering fast charging support that gets the phone charged in under two hours. Battery optimization is good, ensuring you won‚Äôt run out of juice during regular day-to-day tasks.Storage and Software:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs ample room for apps, media, and files, and the phone supports microSD expansion if needed. The software experience is clean and customizable with iQOO‚Äôs Funtouch OS, which runs smoothly on Android. The UI is user-friendly, though there are some pre-installed apps that may not be necessary, but they can be uninstalled.Verdict:The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G is a competitive mid-range smartphone with solid performance, 5G support, a reliable camera, and good battery life. If you‚Äôre looking for a budget-friendly 5G phone with a stylish design, it‚Äôs a solid pick, but the 4

Budget friendly great performance, 90hz smoothness, phone under 12k(6gb) with decent Camera
review_text: I am reviewing this after fully used and drop, ip test with pros and cons. If you want a phone with great performance, decent Camara also with latest Android 14 under 12k this phone will be perfect..Best things are it's comes with Android 14 with funtouch os (if you are previously Vivo user you will got this) which is a great experience for me as 1st time user.On these segment its comes with 50 mp Sony IMX sensor üòò with popular modes like slomo, which is really appreciated for budget lovers..It's also supported 2k resolution with no lag..ü§©You will get 6gb ram with auto booster and 128 gb variant under 12k, it's a massive storage on budget..ü§óIp64 with dust resistant, I have compared with other phones on this budget they have ip54 with no dust resistant feature..üòÑThis are the main points that I liked much, also I liked the wifi 5, fingerprint it's really fast with no animation, less bloat apps, ultra game mode etc..üòâLet's see the cons that I've got..üòëü•¥Charging watt should be better at least 20 watts with inbox charger, 10 watt charger comes with it but the phone is supported 25 watt fast charging.. but 5000mah is good for long lasting uses.. charging time 5-80% was 1.15 hrs with inbox charger.Display should be comes with at least type IPS, it's comes with LCD display and decent colour gamut and 90hz gives most of all other phones on these budget. 1080p display will be much appreciated..Design is good but if you have seen the poco c61 design that is comes with new radial cam design, so it's a disappointed because that's a under 7k phone..üòÜAnimation uses cause phone slower than usual..bso I will suggest not to use that..Overall seen, decent Camera and Design, great performance (I will suggest to buy 6gb variant) with 5g variant, full day battery backup (for less gamers), IP64 with dust resistant üòç, latest Android 14 with 2 years of major upgrades and 3 years of security updates, handy weight with silicon cover on box.. Overall good on these budget segment with trust of VIVO.. ü´∂

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Value for money
review_text: I bought the Mocha brown color and believe me, everyone else had trouble believing that it's a budget phone!My delivery experience with exchange:As usual, whenever I want to EXCHANGE a mobile, I have to rely on Amazon instead of FLIP(FRAUD)KART!I think nobody should exchange mobile with Fraudkart because their exchange system is crooked. They have given the responsibility of valuing the old mobile to their delivery boy. Now the delivery boys have become king and always find out unnecessarily small,  artificial defects in the mobile so that your valuation is decreased by 50%, then they will ask for BRIBE openly like Rs.500 or 1000 to assign the higher valuation! I have seen it happen with dozens of my friends and colleagues who were too naive to fall for Fraudkart's schemes.Hence, I always give old mobiles to Amazon in exchange for new ones, AMAZON DELIVERY GUYS NEVER TRIED TO DEFRAUD ME IN THE LAST 10 YEARS. I behave like a responsible customer and declare the genuine condition of the Mobile beforehand such as scratches on screen, body cracks etc. and the delivery guys accept it without any arguments. KUDOS TO AMAZON for such a transparent process!About the Mobile:I have a OnePlus 11 but was too tensed about it especially while getting millions of calls and messages everyday so I decided to buy a secondary mobile which could be abused without any guilt. BTW I just realised that I always had a mobile with AMOLED screen right since the early days when I bought the Galaxy S2 when it was launched! I never ever bought one with a LCD screen ever and this Iqoo Z9 Lite is the first one and I don't hate it as much as I hoped I would.Display quality is far better than cheap LCD mobiles and 90 Hz frequency is an icing on the cake. Since it's a 720p resolution, I can see the pixelated texts if I look closely but that's an exception, normally I don't mind the lower resolution in day to day life. I wish the max brightness was higher but hey, it's a budget mobile so you can't get everything in it!Do note that this mobile HAS ONLY 1 SINGLE MICROPHONE at the bottom, no additional mics for noise cancellation at our end. I am pretty sure I will hear complaints from the call receiver when I am in a crowded place with lots of background noise.The OS is pretty smooth and fast but quite laggy in comparison to a OnePlus Nord or Redmi HyperOS.Conclusion: I could not find a better deal for my requirements so I bought this mobile but others should definitely explore other options if they are going to buy it as their one & only mobile.

review_text: The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G offers an attractive package, especially for users seeking solid performance at a budget-friendly price. Here‚Äôs a closer look at its key aspects:Design and Display:The Aqua Flow variant looks sleek with its gradient finish, adding a touch of elegance. The phone is lightweight and comfortable to hold, making it easy for one-handed use. Its 6.58-inch Full HD+ display is sharp and vibrant, offering good color reproduction and brightness for media consumption. Though not AMOLED, the display performs well in outdoor lighting conditions and provides smooth scrolling with a 120Hz refresh rate.Performance:Powered by the Dimensity 6300 5G chipset, this device ensures a snappy and fluid user experience. It handles multitasking well, although the 4GB RAM might struggle slightly with heavier apps and games when compared to 6GB or 8GB variants. For regular usage like social media, video streaming, and casual gaming, the phone performs admirably. The inclusion of 5G support is a strong future-proofing move, especially at this price point.Camera:The 50MP Sony AI Camera setup is one of the phone‚Äôs strongest features. It takes good-quality pictures in daylight with sharp details and vivid colors. However, low-light performance could be better, as images tend to get noisy in dim environments. The AI optimizations, such as scene recognition, enhance the photography experience, making it easy to capture decent shots with minimal effort. The front camera is decent for selfies and video calls, though not exceptional.Battery and Charging:The phone packs a 5000mAh battery, which easily lasts a full day of moderate use. The charger in the box is a nice touch, offering fast charging support that gets the phone charged in under two hours. Battery optimization is good, ensuring you won‚Äôt run out of juice during regular day-to-day tasks.Storage and Software:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs ample room for apps, media, and files, and the phone supports microSD expansion if needed. The software experience is clean and customizable with iQOO‚Äôs Funtouch OS, which runs smoothly on Android. The UI is user-friendly, though there are some pre-installed apps that may not be necessary, but they can be uninstalled.Verdict:The iQOO Z9 Lite 5G is a competitive mid-range smartphone with solid performance, 5G support, a reliable camera, and good battery life. If you‚Äôre looking for a budget-friendly 5G phone with a stylish design, it‚Äôs a solid pick, but the 4

review_text: I am reviewing this after fully used and drop, ip test with pros and cons. Overall good on these budget segment with trust of VIVO.. ü´∂

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Value for money
review_text: I bought the Mocha brown color and believe me, everyone else had trouble believing that it's a budget phone!My delivery experience with exchange:As usual, whenever I want to EXCHANGE a mobile, I have to rely on Amazon instead of FLIP(FRAUD)KART!I think nobody should exchange mobile with Fraudkart because their exchange system is crooked. They have given the responsibility of valuing the old mobile to their delivery boy. Now the delivery boys have become king and always find out unnecessarily small,  artificial defects in the mobile so that your valuation is decreased by 50%, then they will ask for BRIBE openly like Rs.500 or 1000 to assign the higher valuation! I have seen it happen with dozens of my friends and colleagues who were too naive to fall for Fraudkart's schemes.Hence, I always give old mobiles to Amazon in exchange for new ones, AMAZON DELIVERY GUYS NEVER TRIED TO DEFRAUD ME IN THE LAST 10 YEARS. I behave like a responsible customer and declare the genuine condition of the Mobile beforehand such as scratches on screen, body cracks etc. and the delivery guys accept it without any arguments. KUDOS TO AMAZON for such a transparent process!About the Mobile:I have a OnePlus 11 but was too tensed about it especially while getting millions of calls and messages everyday so I decided to buy a secondary mobile which could be abused without any guilt. BTW I just realised that I always had a mobile with AMOLED screen right since the early days when I bought the Galaxy S2 when it was launched! I never ever bought one with a LCD screen ever and this Iqoo Z9 Lite is the first one and I don't hate it as much as I hoped I would.Display quality is far better than cheap LCD mobiles and 90 Hz frequency is an icing on the cake. Since it's a 720p resolution, I can see the pixelated texts if I look closely but that's an exception, normally I don't mind the lower resolution in day to day life. I wish the max brightness was higher but hey, it's a budget mobile so you can't get everything in it!Do note that this mobile HAS ONLY 1 SINGLE MICROPHONE at the bottom, no additional mics for noise cancellation at our end. I am pretty sure I will hear complaints from the call receiver when I am in a crowded place with lots of background noise.The OS is pretty smooth and fast but quite laggy in comparison to a OnePlus Nord or Redmi HyperOS.Conclusion: I could not find a better deal for my requirements so I bought this mobile but others should definitely explore other options if they are going to buy it as their one & only mobile.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Ulitmate model in iQOO
review_text: Product Review: iQOO Z9x 5G (Tornado Green, 6GB RAM, 128GB Storage)I recently upgraded to the iQOO Z9x 5G, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations! Here‚Äôs a breakdown of my experience:Performance:Equipped with the Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 processor and 6GB of RAM, this phone delivers smooth performance across the board. Whether I‚Äôm gaming, multitasking, or streaming videos, everything runs seamlessly without lag. The Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 handles demanding apps with ease, making it a reliable choice for heavy users.Display:The display is stunning! The vibrant colors and sharp resolution make everything look amazing, from photos to videos. The 6.67-inch screen size is perfect for viewing content, and I appreciate the immersive experience it offers, especially for gaming and watching movies.Camera:The camera performance is impressive, especially for the price point. The photos come out sharp and vibrant, even in low light conditions. I‚Äôve been enjoying capturing moments with the various shooting modes available, which add a creative touch to my photography.Design:The Tornado Green color is sleek and eye-catching. The design feels premium, and the matte finish not only looks great but also minimizes fingerprints. It‚Äôs comfortable to hold and fits nicely in my hand, making it easy to use.Battery Life:The battery life is solid, easily lasting me through a full day of heavy use. The fast charging feature is a major plus, allowing me to quickly top up when I‚Äôm in a hurry.Storage:With 128GB of storage, I have plenty of space for apps, photos, and videos. The option to expand storage further with a microSD card is a nice bonus.Overall Impression:The iQOO Z9x 5G is a fantastic smartphone that combines performance, style, and value. It‚Äôs perfect for anyone looking for a reliable device without breaking the bank. I highly recommend it!Rating: 5/5 Stars

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Gets the job done
review_text: First impressions:1. While it has a LCD display. It appears to be decent with not too prominent of a light bleeding.2. Although it's 120hz RR, the display usually operates at 90hz for most system apps when set to Smart, which is rather weird but not a deal breaker, and you can always change it to 120hz in settings.3. There are bloatware but you can uninstall most of them.4. Battery backup is definitely its USP. Having a 6000mah battery can do wonders especially in the long run.5. 44w adapter included. Takes around 1.5 hours to fully Charge.6. Camera is nothing to brag about. It's a decent single shooter. No ultrawide or even a macro cam per say.7. Lastly, performance is definitely on the upper spectrum in the price range. All other phones are offering MTK6100 while it has SD6Gen1 which definitely performs better. And there are some phones which do not even offer 8gb variant.8. Very good stereo speakers for the price range plus would you look at that, a headphone jack.Overall, a very solid phone in the price range.Update: One star deducted - The camera quality is abysmal. There is no optimization done on the camera. Colors are absolutely washed out, image quality is soft and noisy even at daylight.Update after 2+ weeks of usage:1. With light to medium, my mom is able to squeeze 3 days with a single charge which is highly impressive.2. Phone runs smoothly are rather cool even when it charges.3. A capable set of speakers. While they do not sound full and airy, they do get the job done with less distortion.

review_text: This mobile is a beast at affordable price point. Design, built quality, features, performance is amazing. Rest features, performance, etc.. now a days almost every mobile has.. Purchasing I phone every time with upgrade is nothing but throwing the money in Apple's dustbin...! In a nutshell... IQOO mobile is the best alternate/replacement for Apple I phone with affordable price point.Cheers...

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
I'm satisfied at the same time unsatisfied with stereo
review_text: I was in search of a phone having neat basic requirements. My conditions are battery life ,camera and storage. Other features are complementary for me. I think that average phone user need only these functions. Afterall I'm not a gamer.I came to it's a gaming phn .Any way I tried searching new  devices. Iniitially my budget range was 30k but unfortunately I couldn't rely on this.During this period of time I came to know about IQOO and googled the details . I came to know it's the subbrand of Vivo. I was happy.I searched Amazon and fixed IQOO z9x which is budget frndly and having nice basic features.I was impressed with 6k mah battery backup.I chose dark colour . Storage is only 128gb and the camera is fine not too good. Within this prize range, we cannot expect more.I'm satisfied with product. Waiting for Indian release of IQOO 13 on dec 5.After all,  I want to point out some cons of this device.The speakers of this device is compromised.Receiver of our call can hear our voice beautifuly. No issues. But I feel it's not up to mark for us. There is a limitation and unsatisfaction during calling especially in a town area or a crowd even in full volume.Next is actual speaker of this device. It needs improvement because the sound played during YouTube or any other video player is unsatisfactory. When compared to my previous redmi device I feel it's not upto mark.My main unsatisfactory points are related to this device stereo. Others are ok.
