title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Only one word awesome
review_text: I wanted to buy a budget 5g phone for my wife having  following criteria:-1. Superb design2. Good Ram and ROM3. Good camera if not Superb4. Good screen if not best5. No bloatware and stock android6. And finally, Good battery with day day performance as my wife don't play game.I am truly happy to share that this phone has exceeded my expectations in every corner. Actually, I was little skeptical about the screen as it is only HD plus, however to my surprise, it is best HD plus display I have every seen. Not much difference. Camera also exceeded my expectations, though little improvement is required in white exposure. And surprisingly,  it is from indian brand Lava. Long live Lava!! Keep doing great. I am owing samsung but I swear If Lava keeps doing this, my next phone will be from Lava. Everyone in my family and friends praised this. My true words.Few things which was a true surprise as I didn't expect at all in this price segment:-1. Haptics (best means best, even better than premium segment phones)2. Screen color reproduction is sometimes equal to that of Amoled, though not always. But believe me HD plus display will not be a regret.3. awesome Ram management and UFC 2.1 will definitely make your feel of using a premium phones4. Looks - not even 25 to 30k phone will come near to this.Though, some cons are also there-1. Slow charger - takes around 3 hours to charge battery, though battery backup is Superb.2. Video lags in 2k 60 FPS, though work fine in 1080 60 fps. This really requires efforts from Lava as it is possible to improve via update.3. Camera white exposure and portrait mode requires improvements.4. Background stream - in review videos, option of background stream like YouTube is shown, however in reality, I am unable to see this. Please get this done with an update.5. Last but not least - place of fingerprint sensor or power key sometimes feel uncomfortable for new user. Though, not an issue after some days use.If the above issues are possible to resolve, please resolve Lava.No phone can come close to this pure stock android experience in this price range.However, the way you have made a come back in indian market is Superb. All the best my indian company. Keep doing great.

title:

Totally worth it! PAISA VASOOL!!ü´∂üôåüíØ
review_text: 5G speeds in my area are varying from 550mbps to 1+gbps on some nights. The phone works like a breeze. Bought it on sale on Oct 1st, 2023. Tested thoroughly ever since. And no lag. I am playing COD on HD settings. Battery is easily a Day's worth. Heating is minimal if not nothing worth noticing. And stock Android is amazing. Cam quality is yuck (I mean you can make do with it but the file size of each pic is over 15mb and whenever I had to upload some pic to someone I had to first send it to myself from WhatsApp so it doesn't cross the upload limit which is a hassle but overall camera is okayish for the price point) but camera is not what I bought it for. The audio quality is good and auto call recording feature works neatly unlike some apps in Play Store that record only one side. The recordings were crystal clear of both parties when I recorded. Very useful if you need audio proofs in any issue and it does not let other side know that you are recording them which is apt. I have upgraded my Android to 13 and all features are smooth, the dimensity processor is quite good. I was fiddling with buying this phone or Nokia G42 5G that launched at the same time but chose this to support an Indian brand and boy have I been correct. My friend was going through similar thoughts and I suggested him this but he wasn't trusting of Lava and bought Nokia G42 5G, it is not a bad phone but it is not this goooooood!! Dimensity 700 has managed to whoop Snapdragon 480, by a margin. Just go through the Antutu and geekbench charts of both phones also try Cpu-Z to monitor internals and you'll know what I am talking about! This Lava Mobile is total PAISA VASOOL! üòÅüòÑü´∂üíØ‚ô•Ô∏è

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget - conscious coustomer
review_text: The Lava Blaze 5G is an affordable 5G smartphone with notable features for its price range. Here are its pros and cons:Pros5G Connectivity:One of the most affordable 5G smartphones, allowing access to faster internet speeds and improved network performance.Memory and Storage:Equipped with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of UFS 2.2 storage, it offers smooth multitasking and faster data transfer speeds, with ample storage for apps and media.Design:The Glass Green variant has a stylish and premium look, providing an appealing aesthetic.Battery Life:Typically features a large battery (around 5000mAh), providing good battery life that lasts through a day of heavy use.Display:Often comes with a decent display for its price range, offering a good viewing experience for media consumption and everyday use.Price:Offers good value for money, especially considering its 5G capabilities and hardware specifications.Cons:Processor: The chipset might be lower-end (likely a MediaTek Dimensity series), which, while sufficient for everyday tasks, might not perform as well with intensive applications or gaming compared to higher-end models.Camera Quality:The camera setup, while adequate for basic photography, may not offer the same quality and versatility as more expensive smartphones, particularly in low-light conditions.Software Experience:The user interface may include bloatware and might not be as refined or feature-rich as more premium brands. Software updates might also be less frequent.Build Quality:While the design is attractive, the actual build materials may be less durable compared to higher-end devices that use metal or higher-grade materials.No Wireless Charging:Like many budget devices, it lacks wireless charging support, which might be a drawback for some users.Display Quality:The display, while decent, may not offer the high resolution, refresh rate, or brightness found in more premium devices, affecting the overall media consumption experience.The Lava Blaze 5G is an attractive option for budget-conscious consumers seeking 5G connectivity and decent performance. However, it does come with trade-offs in processing power, camera quality, and build materials.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good value for money, but has few flaws
review_text: I ordered this phone on Saturday 11th November and got it within 24 hours, so Amazon's delivery deserves 5 stars.Coming to the positives of the product -The phone is a good value for money.  Getting a 5g phone under Rs. 10000/- is a deal.  The battery life is also amazing, getting me 1.5 days on my usage pattern.  Clean android, I like it, else on my previous phones I would spend a lot of time removing bloatware.  Excellent display clarity, vibrant colours on display. Being clean android, boot time is faster, setup is faster, even factory reset gets over quickly.Very good response time, apps open fast, smooth multi-tasking, and I am not a gamer. Speaker for music playback is loud and clear.The issues with the phone -Software glitch on display.  When I delete a widget, the widget is still seen in the home screen.  if I delete an app, the app icon is still seen on the home screen or app drawer.  If you scroll the app drawer, the deleted app icon follows you.  You need to turn off the screen or start and close another app to sort this issue out.Call volume is not loud, compared to music playback volume.  In noisy places there will be a difficulty in hearing the person on the other end.Camera is not that great, at times pictures will look nice in the gallery, but when you transfer it to a computer you will see grains, over exposure.The vibrator is not very strong and not very audible. At times I am not able to hear it even if the phone is kept on a table.  You can't feel it in your pocket.There is an option, Vibrate on call connect.  When you call someone and when they answer the call the phone is supposed to vibrate.  This feature worked on my old phone, but in this phone, even after this option enabled it does not work.  Another issue is when you use any app that requires the internet connectivity (mobile data) such as the browser or the playstore, the app cannot access the internet for atleast 3-4 seconds.  After you search for some information in the browser or you type a website address, you need to wait for 3 seconds for the browsing to start.  When you open the  playstore, you need to wait for 3-4 seconds for it to show all the apps and even then the loading is incomplete, as you scroll down you will see the page loading slowly.The support from the manufacturer - LAVA on these issues is bad, it has been more than 7 days, after giving them my phone for extracting my log files to check the error and everytime I call the service manager he keeps asking for more time and more time.  Please be aware selling a product is not as important as servicing it or supporting it.  Not a good experience with LAVA.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Unique features
review_text: Camera Pros and ConCon-Under low light conditions the pictures come out overly lit up, resulting in the images loosing saturation.For example a setting Sun still in the sky having a beautiful orange glow comes out bland with a lightish yellow tint. At other times close up pictures in low light has over saturated colours.Pictures even in normal light conditions are some times bland.Zoomed images are good but macro images are not satisfactory.Interestingly the video images are sharper compared to still photos in both Photo and portrait modes.For example the fine prints on a grocery item pack looks blurry when taken as a still image. Same fine prints when shot close up with video looks amazingly crisp!!Video images are not only crisp but also well saturated under bright ligt conditions. However the colour of the images, especially the green looks highly artificial, tried repeatedly.Pros-Amazingly sharp and crystal clear videos even under medium to low light conditions.The phone video camera completely lives up to its claim of FHD images.A phone with a low price tag of around 11K has such high end tech features like 2 k videos and EIS is unbeleivable.2 k Videos- Not too distinct from the Full HD video output, but still brandishing such high end video quality adds more value to the gadzet. The only down side here is the internal memory card provided.  The Micro SD card is not capable of handling 2k pressure, because of which the 2k videos are jumpy and takes all the fun out of an otherwise sharp featured videos. For K quality videos an sd card of class 10 or above should have been provided.EIS- Electronic image stabilisation is a feature mentioned only with the high end SLRs and prof Video cams. Lava Blaze 5 brandishing EIS feature came as a surprise. CurIOSity got the better of me, and so bought this phone. Videos taken in walking motion comes out smooth with no jerks. Thus EIS makes this phone worth buying, especially for those who are avid video enthusiasts. I think this phone is designed by keeping outdoor vloggers in mind. Serves the purpose!Multitasking: Apart from the camera, one feature I have liked the most is its Background streaming feature, which I am sure many high end 30 K plus phone also dont have in them. So you can browse the net, fiddle around with other apps all the while your you tube podcast is playing in the background.At the end missing my old mobile's capacity to wake up with a gentle tap on the screen. Lava Blaze 5 needs to be pressed at the side to make it wake up. Though the phone is sensitive enough to wake up the moment you lift it from its resting place. But this feature works often when not needed or doesn't work when it should. Not being taken as a con however.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Second time purchased this phone. Really Worth of money
review_text: First phone purchased in May 2023, my first Lava phone.After a year of using the Lava Blaze 5G, I needed a reliable budget phone and searched online for options. No other phone found except Indian Brand Lava Blaze 5G under Rs.10000, which led me to purchase it again.Pros:Value for Money: Despite being an older model, it offers exceptional value within its price range.5G Experience: Provides a good 5G experience, which is impressive for a budget phone.Performance: Everything works seamlessly, from everyday tasks to more demanding applications.Cons:Old Android Version: The phone comes with an older version of Android. However, this isn't a deal-breaker as all the latest Android versions are quite similar and the phone's performance remains top-notch.Overall, if you are looking for a budget-friendly phone under ‚Çπ10,000, the Lava Blaze 5G is an excellent choice. It's an older model but still worth every single rupee. Highly recommended!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Good for functional (non-gamer, non-selfieCrazy) usage
review_text: This was the first not-so-great-brand phone that I ever bought, so I waited over six months to post my review.Great phone for the buck, if you are not too picky about extra crisp camera resolutions or if gaming isn't your thing. I would recommend going for the 8Gb and 128Gb model.Been using this phone for over 9 months for primarily business (email/WhatsApp/email/UPI related stuff as well as pdf/document scanning and editing). This phone does a decent job with all that and the battery still lasts over a day, sometimes 2 or 3 days (depending on the intensity of usage)The voice clarity is good, I almost never lost signal on Airtel, even in rural areas or while travelling via road/train. 5G works fine, I rarely use wi-fi and a good mobile data plan connect quite well while on the go. Not sure if this would work the same with online gaming, but this phone isn't designed for that market - lets get honest about that.The camera could have been better, 50 Megapix without the backing optics stunts the camera capabilities especially in long shots and open grounds. The speakers are okay for the price of the product, don't expect Apple/Samsung S series quality sound from this. This is purely functional IMHO, works fine with me.Lava reviews were fairly mixed when I was searching for a low-budget 5G phone in mid-2023, but I took a chance anyway and am quite happy about it.Would certainly recommend this phone if you are a no-nonsense, no-gamingAddict, no-selfieCrazy person and simply looking for an economy level functional phone to last 3-4 years or so.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Decent phone for decent price ....
review_text: My samsung phone (M 31) suddenly stopped working at the end of the month, was in a tight budget so took a chance with Lava ... Can say frankly, I am not at all disappointed... Using it for last one month , working just fine ... Iv loaded so many apps still running smoothly...Pros:Value for money pricingFlagship lookDecent build qualityVibration and ring volume is loud enough90 Hz screen is smooth enoughExtremely good battery back up , mine was drained till 10% after 2 days of vigorous use.3.5 headphone jackOther required features are also good.Cons:No fast charging, it takes near about 2.5 hrs to charge is from 10%-100%. The highest input is 15 watt max . You will get a 10 watt charger along with it.The audio out put with the headphones are low and not that much good.Camera is ok for daily use but not at all 50 MP.my biggest disappointment is the secondary camera, it's 8 MP mentioned but performs really bad in low light conditions.Here is the detailed review of the product. Choose according to your needs. For this price or lower, it's value for money.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
All rounder for the budget
review_text: Top notch for the priceThe first reason people doubt is because of the name LAVA, I also thought the same first, but need to support indian brand,Got it for my father's use - upon using now im jealous that i didn't get one, really impressed üíØ üëçIt has the best 5g speeds you will notice, compared to s23 you will get equal speeds in 5g, With all the 8 5g bands that supports in india.Display: It has hd+ display, If you are using amoled HD+ diaplay you will definitely notice the change but after one day of usage it doesnt even bother you at all.Software: It has android 12 and stock android which is ultimate with zero bloatware, The ui is quiet fast because of the optimization it has no lag whatsoever in the multitasking.- misses little features like extreme customizations ü§≠ but it is sufficientBattery: got a new question - does it discharge, you will feel the same due to 7nm processor and beat software optimization battery backup is ultimateBuilt quality: not less than flagship built, glass back is very good with matte texture, phone is 200g but feels light in hand when holding, edges are good and perfectCamera: doubted the camera but it is beast at this range with enough light it is talking good pictures with heavy aunlight front camera suffers HDR selfies but otherthan every aspect is on par with everyday usePeople generally think with this price range we can go for other brands like redmi or samsung phones, can we trust lava ? these questions .But it is very good alrounder which intake leaps ahead of other options in this price segment, TRUST ME IF THE SAME FEATURES IN SAMSUNG IT WOULD DEFINITELY BE AROUND 16K.As of now there are no bugs in software so i don't update it.got it for 9750[ full payment ] at offer with ICICI CC payment

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Okay for the price. Needs improvement.
review_text: Lava has managed to do what most brands don't do at this price range. It could have been the flagship of budget smartphones. However, there is still a lot to learn in the execution side.Pros:1. Display. Although HD+, it still is one of the best in this price range with 90 Hz refresh rate.2. Bettery Life. An average SOT of 6 hours can be easily drawn even in medium heavy usage.3. Build Quality is just ultimate as one could ask for in a budget smartphone.4. Clean and bloatware free software.Cons:1. Camera. The main camera is just okayish. Rest others are gimmicky. It would have been better if Lava had provided only one main camera with great resolution instead of adding a VGA camera.2. Performance is somewhat a hit and a miss as software seems to lag at some places which makes the usage not that smooth. This can be fixed through software updates.3. Auto-brightness calibration is an issue which I believe exists in almost all Lava smartphones.Overall, a good phone and easily the best for backup/secondary usage purpose.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Poor reception and frequent call drops - unreliable phone
review_text: For me, most important feature of a phone is connectivity and call clarity. Unfortunately, Motorola failed in both the fronts.I have used that brick size Motorola, used Motorola Razor but then moved to Nokia and then to Samsung. Was using various Samsung models for more than a decades and gradually felt that both Samsung quality and customer services dropped drastically. Samsung mastered warranty period!! Phone works precisely until the warranty and then fails!! - precision engineering and MTTF!!Thought old, trusted Motorola might have recovered from their initial failures in smartphone and hence gave this Motorola a try.I am using the same sim card, my locations are the same but now my calls are dropping every now and then. My phone is reported as unreachable or switched-off when it is not! I never had call dropping or signal issue earlier with my Samsungs - be it inside lift or in metro!Moreover, Motorola call clarity is below par.Motorola failed miserably in call connectivity and call clarity.Not all are bad, build quality is slightly better, battery and camera is similar.Also, there are just few service centres. So, repair will be a headache if you need it.Overall, not worth for this unreliable phone.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
It impresses the buyer in all segments
review_text: I am using this Nokia G42 5G phone for the past 4 days and i am happy with its operational outcome. Battery is impressive and comes for a day and half on normal usage. I am using a Airtel Sim which is a 5G ready sim card and the service is not up to the mark as the network juggles between 5G and 4G networks for every 10 minutes. But i am not blaming Nokia for it as it is the network issue of Airtel people and it might improve in coming days.What disappointed me is the camera settings. I thought i will get a 8 and 13MP camera settings along with the 50MP option. But only 50MP camera setting is available on the phone and the images clicked from this phone are Okay. But it does the work for a normal user. And it is irritating when the camera says photo processing is in progress when i need to take continuous quick shots. Furthermore, if the watermark option is enabled, the phone displays that device name and date, but doesn't have the option to display the time of taking the picture and that's a downside as there is no such option in the settings. Night mode captures pictures excellently in dark environments.As i am not a gamer i did not test for the game operations on this phone, yet!YouTube videos are impressive and even i am able to watch 4K videos on this phone. The content on the phone screen is also visible in direct sunlight and so again it went ahead of my expectations.Slight heating is being observed while charging. But not during YouTube video streaming of an hour or so.Charging of the phone is fast, as it charges 30% of phone in just half an hour and takes almost 1 hour 30 minutes to reach from 29% to 100%.It is working fine on my Suzuki Car Infotainment System. As i went for a factory reset of the touchscreen and then my Nokia device started to connect without any trouble.And the single speaker of this phone is also audible and as its placement is at the bottom of the device, the Ringtone sound is loud enough when it rings.I reside in the core of Hyderabad city and the calls are crystal clear as i am using Airtel 5G plus network. Only single sim card slot along with SD Card slot and if you want, you can use that SD Card slot as another sim tray to insert a 4G sim. I guess two 5G sim cards will not work and only 1 5G network will work on this phone.Anyhow, it all depends on the network operator and my Airtel 5G plus network is inconsistent and drops to 4G for every 10 minutes. So, i lodged an immediate online complaint to Airtel people via email and they gave me a time frame of 15 days and assured to provide me a consistent 5G network solution by then....hope so! But still the 4G speed is also good and i can access maps and upload videos and photos quickly to cloud when i am in my house terrace or second floor. After 4 months of this device use, when my phone is on 5G i can experience fast and unlimited downloads. But when it is on 4G it goes through the regular data limit. The Airtel network guys have worked well and have optimized the network to the core at my house and office. But at the rest of the places, only 4G network works and is displayed on the phone and is filled with data download restrictions.Also the power brick supplied has no NOKIA brand name on it, but it does the charging work as per our expectation and mind you, it doesn't have a wireless charging as it is a budget friendly phone.On February 6th, 2024 my device received a Android 14 update and so it received 1OS upgrade  out of 2 as promised.......nice!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best 5G phone in this price range
review_text: Nokia has always been my fav including the windows phone series. Writing the review after using it for one month. It's just awesome. Brand speaks of the quality. Only drawback is there are no software updates. But Android 13 works just fine and it's is value for money. The touch and feel is amazing.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A Mixed Bag..!!
review_text: After using for a day...!!Build quality: A typical Nokia product. In hand feel is good. The back panel looks so much good. Looks awesome.Display: It's doesn't look like a 720p display at all. The overall experience with a 90hz refresh rate is smooth and punchy. But content watching like videos on YouTube may feel little dull.Camera: The 50mp back camera is like 50/50. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's average. I haven't tested the 2mp cameras. 8mp front camera is below average. Camera app has some cool features. Use GCam for a good result. Picture quality will be improved drastically especially the front camera.Speaker: The single bottom firing speaker is loud and has good level of vocal details. But misses the bass. Overall average. It has a feature call boost volume which will increase the volume upto 10%. The earpiece is top quality. Wired earphone output is good. I've used Nokia earphones and quality is good. Also used Noise tws and got a decent output, no issues here.Software: Clean Android 13 with some pre installed app which is uninstallable.Overall a good phone in this price range. 5G bands only n28 and n78 available. Airtel 5G is working fine, don't know about Jio. Compass sensor is missing. I've also attached some shots taken with Nokia G42 5G. Charging the battery will take 1hr45mins from 20% to 100%.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Stellar Budget 5G Phone - Nokia G42 5G in So Purple!
review_text: I recently downgraded from Huwaei P30 pro and got my hands on the Nokia G42 5G in the stunning "So Purple" color variant, and I must say, it's an absolute gem! This budget-friendly smartphone has impressed me in more ways than one, and I'm thrilled to share my positive experience.**1. 5G Connectivity:**The inclusion of the Snapdragon 480 Plus 5G chipset ensures lightning-fast connectivity, making everyday tasks smoother and more efficient. Streaming, downloading, and browsing are a breeze with this device.**2. Impressive Camera Setup:**The 50MP Triple Rear AI Camera is a pleasant surprise on a phone in this price range. It captures vibrant and detailed photos with ease. The AI enhancements add a touch of professionalism to every shot, making even amateur photographers like me look good!**3. Generous RAM and Storage:**The 11GB RAM configuration (6GB RAM + 5GB RAM Extension) is more than sufficient for multitasking, and the 128GB storage provides ample space for all your apps, photos, and videos. No more worrying about running out of space!**4. Stellar Battery Life:**The 5000mAh battery is a workhorse. It easily lasts a full day of heavy usage, and if you're a moderate user, you might even stretch it to two days. Plus, the device supports fast charging, which means you're back up to full power in no time.**5. Android OS Upgrades:**Nokia's promise of 2 years of Android OS upgrades is a significant selling point. It ensures that your phone stays up to date with the latest features and security enhancements, providing peace of mind.**6. Stylish Design:**Let's not forget the aesthetic appeal of the "So Purple" color variant. It's a head-turner and adds a touch of personality to the phone. Nokia has nailed it in terms of design.**7. Reliable Brand:**Nokia has a long-standing reputation for producing durable and reliable phones, and the Nokia G42 5G is no exception. It feels robust in hand and gives you confidence in its longevity.In conclusion, the Nokia G42 5G in So Purple is a fantastic budget 5G smartphone that delivers on multiple fronts. Whether you're a tech enthusiast or simply looking for a reliable device for everyday use, this phone offers incredible value for money. With its 5G capabilities, impressive camera, ample storage, and extended Android OS support, it's a winning choice. Plus, the So Purple color variant adds a touch of flair to your mobile experience. Highly recommended!

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
[Edit 19-Oct-2024:] Android not updating issue seems to be resolved
review_text: Model: Nokia G42 5G TA-1586 DS 6/128EDIT (19-Oct-2024):------------------------Finally, after multiple emails and chats with HMD support/ Nokia Care, received the 00WW_2_350 build update via OTA for my device. Now that HMD has fixed some OTA related bug at their end, hopefully all future OTA updates will be received smoothly as and when they are released.Bumping up the stars to 4 as the OTA update issue seems to have been resolved.Aside from that the phone is pretty stable & reliable and meets my performance requirements.---------------------------------------------------One star because of the experience in dealing with Amazon customer care, specialist support, Nokia customer care and technical support and Amazon Home services.The phone on first power-on after unboxing had October 2023 as the OS version. Then it got updated to the December 2023 security patch.All further checks for update just show that the "System is already up to date" and no other updates are available. Due to this, its still.stuck at Android 13 with December 2023 security patch. This is despite the latest available OS update as per the Nokia website is June 2024 security patch.Tried many troubleshooting steps like clearing the storage and cache of some system apps and finally factory resetting the phone; but no change in the situation.Called Nokia customer care and technical support; looks like they know customers have reported this issue previously but they are not openly disclosing what the actual problem is and are asking me to visit the service center.Asked Amazon customer care for replacement, but there is no useful support from Amazon and they are washing their hands off saying the policy available for this phone is only brand service center replacement within 7 days. If Amazon is to issue refund or replacement, then I need to get a denial letter from the service center.Called Nokia customer care again and they are adamant that I visit the service center andThis issue of a simple OTA update (that should "just work" out of the box) for a freshly unboxed phone on the first day itself should be eligible for a replacement from Amazon.If I visit the Nokia service centre, they might have the tools to manually flash the latest OS rom image. But who knows this issue will occur again or not ?This phone is supposed to get monthly security updates. So if the OTA updates are not working, are we to visit the service center every time to let them flash the newest updates ?

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars

review_text: Its not very thin - hence slightly heavier.The latest Android UI (or maybe its this phone's UI / theme) is bit non intuitive for me (for example - the close all button for apps appears after scrolling all open apps horizontally - which is problematic.I am facing problems in microphone quality in recording videos - there is lot of noise - only in this phone (other android phones I have work fine). I think this might have to do that they have some AI sound optimization in default camera's sound recording - which perhaps is buggy. Or maybe its the hardware.The camera quality is very good for this price range. Though I think - there is again some AI/other optimization  in images which reduces naturalness of the photos in certain situations.Basically they should have provided more control over whether we want the audio/video enhancer.The phone is otherwise very fast - faster than perhaps some other models in this range.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Processor and Battery: Device's Prowess, Screen and Design are not.
review_text: Used this phone for over a month now, here are pros and cons:Pros1. Decent Battery, with minimal use 3 days backup, moderate use 2 days backup, heavy use 1 Day backup.2. Process handling, It can handle games like COD mobile and Genshin Impact and warms up, doesn't heat.Cons1. Aesthetics feel awful, the back is purple, it looks good, really. But the side is colored grey/silver and feels out of place. Yes I had to include this2. The screen is weird, you can not get a single tampered glass to fit on it perfectly. they do not adhere to the edges of the screen and this is definitely a problem with the screen, not tampered glass.3. Update made the fingerprint sensor misbehave so I had to restart the phone and register fingerprint again for it to work again.4. Camera quality with dim light, nothing to brag about, even my Nokia 5.1 plus from 5 years ago took far decent photos than this "50 MP AI cam". In VERY bright light I can say yep, its really good.5. UI is extremely restrictive, I wonder if that's just with one UI or all Android 13 devices. You can not customize much.6. Installs bloatware when you first connect to the internet even though it was mentioned somewhere that you only get stock android, or I probably mixed a few things idk?7. Side mounted fingerprint sensor is annoying. Its placement makes it harder to avoid unlocking the device when you are trying to lift it up or shove it in your pocket.8. Its too big, doesn't fit in most pockets, due to large screen size, UI looks pretty ugly. Specially due to the large margins for each icon/ element in Android 13 it looks awfully hideous. On that note, I must mention that it even fell once out of my pocket, 2.5 feet height may be? I had tampered on, no damage on anything though. I was using a wired headphone that got stuck somewhere and funnily, instead of the headphones falling down, it was the phone that leapt out.9. The camera at one side raises it from that side so it is wobbly when sitting on a plane surface.10. Things not mentioned are just average as you get in any 8-10K phone.Conclusion: This phone has a LOT of design flaws, they tried but failed. I would say it is priced OK given the CPU which I really liked and the battery life which is awesome as well. You can get a better phone at the same price, its just that, being Nokia, it is probably more durable than the others at the same price. So if you are looking for a phone that you can throw in frustration (not too hard), play high end games (not too high end, and not keep a lot of them at the same time), don't care about the camera or photo quality, need long lasting battery and are ready to pay a price which this device is unworthy for, then go for it. Otherwise there are decent alternatives available with only one concern with them, built quality.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
As promised.
review_text: First of all, I was terrified to buy this smart phone seeing everybody's review on amazon that totally breaks Nokia's reputation.Nothing was good enough and I had already fixed my mind to buy this phone. Everybody was commenting unnecessarily without technical details.The Phone I received was manufactured in July 2024 and came to me. It wasn't tampered which I could see for myself with the void seal. It's just good.Now for the heating issue. It is a phone that supports Fast Charging. It did heat up for me during the very first charge but in the subsequent charging cycles. It didn't heat much only at certain points about 70% even then, it reduced its heat when I took the phone off of the charger when it's fully charged.For the software side of things, everything is good. Stock Android, the main key point I bought this phone. It's just perfect.The Virtual RAM is so good that I never clear my recent apps. It's just works snappily.Only thing is, Security update was at January 2024. But as per Nokia's policy it should have given me the update for July 2024/May 2024. Another phone at home which is also Nokia receives timely montly security updates.I guess it's possibly because, I received at the end of the month and the update cycle for this is pushed to the next month. Will update if it's the case as I guessed.The Speakers are a blast with Ozo Audio both in Media and Phone calls.If you see, reviews that say heating, not working, refund my money, etc. Just ignore it and place your trust blindly on Nokia.P.S. for the above kind of reviews, I think amazon should mainly remove the "refund my money" or allow them to post it and reply, Please contact the Device Manufacturer's service center. If reviews are manually reviewed instead of machine made.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
What a phone!
review_text: I have been using the phone for the last three months and I must say I am impressed! I bought this phone as a standby phone and within two months it has now become my main phone.I went in with very little expectations - Stock Android, good battery life and and the Nokia build quality. Not only does the phone meet these expectations it exceeds them on every count.The battery actually lasts for over 2 days and the stock Android is a great performer making all apps work faster than the bloatware hampered workings of the other phones And, not forget a decent camera quality. Especially the potraits are stunning and detailed with no pixalation.I still can't believe that it costed only 12,500! So to summarise, if you are looking for an Android workhorse that has dependable (long) battery life,stock Android with no bloatware and excellent build quality all under 15,000 bucks, this one's the phone for you!

Battery is quite good, almost 2 daysCons:1. Inbuilt Netflix does not get updated, required to uninstall and then install and then it works2. Very long time for booting3. The sound during booting is very low quality4. Camera not that good, but it's OK, can't expect more at this price5. Touch sensitivity is poor, it lags sometimes6. Sometimes the screen does not respond to touch7. Finally, the most important bug - Purchases this phone in July, on first setup, saw it was Android 13 with Oct 2023 security patch. Updated via OTA for Dec 2023 patch. After that, no OTA updates are coming though Nokia website talks about Android 14 being pushed since January 2024 and many people are having in this phone July 2024 security patches. Talked with CC but they say only option is to wait and continue clicking Software update option. Also there is no way to update the software through sideloading or ADB or fastboot or Recovery....this is really absurdAmazon should do someting about this, either technical help or replacement

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
All rounder!
review_text: If you're in the market for a phone that excels in both performance and photography, this model is a compelling choice. As an ACE Dominator-Masters player, I can confidently say that this phone offers a stable gaming experience with minimal lag. It handles heavy gaming well, with only occasional lag when the server conditions are poor. The touch response is impressive, making it a solid option for competitive play.The camera quality is surprisingly good, capturing clear and vibrant photos, which is perfect for heavy camera usage. Social media enthusiasts will also appreciate its performance in this area.However, there are a few drawbacks. The phone tends to get quite warm, especially when using the 120Hz refresh rate and full brightness. While this is manageable and doesn't affect the overall experience too much, it‚Äôs something to be aware of. Additionally, the UI stability seems to have taken a hit after the recent update, making the phone feel less enjoyable to use compared to before.Overall, this phone is a strong contender for those who need a device that performs well in gaming, photography, and social media, despite a few minor drawbacks.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Very practical device and a worthy purchase at this price range!
review_text: This phone is for you if you are looking for a sturdy, smart and practical phone with a neat user experience. The phone surely feels premium in hand and looks distinct from other devices.UI is amazing. No bloatware, clean design and lot of emphasis on practicality and user friendliness.Another department where phone scores very high is it's battery. It easily last for 2 days if you are an average user.The only area where phone underperforms is the camera. Despite good specs , the image quality is snot consistent. Colours are often saturated (even after the latest update) and the edge detection in potrait mode is still a struggle. Hopefully Nothing team will roll out more updates to improve and stablize the camera of the phone.Overall, a great product at this price point.

title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Extremely Dissatisfied with Amazon's Service and Product Quality
review_text: Dear Amazon Customer Service,I am writing to express my extreme disappointment with the service I have received regarding my recent purchase of the Nothing 2A phone. Despite assurances from your mobile inspection team that my concerns would be addressed promptly, I have encountered nothing but frustration and unfulfilled promises.I purchased the Nothing 2A phone expecting a certain standard of quality, particularly in its camera capabilities. Upon realizing the camera did not meet my expectations, I promptly initiated a return request. Despite the initial confirmation from your team, there has been an alarming lack of follow-through on Amazon's part.For over 6-7 days, I patiently waited for a call to arrange the return pick-up, only to receive none. Your application, which I attempted to use for customer service, failed to connect me, highlighting serious deficiencies in its functionality. It took a staggering 10 days of persistent effort via your website before I was finally able to speak with someone.To my disbelief, the response I received was that Amazon could no longer assist with a return or replacement. This level of incompetence and indifference is simply unacceptable from a company of Amazon's stature.My experience with Amazon's handling of this matter has been nothing short of a nightmare. I have been left with a defective product and no recourse for resolution. As a loyal customer who has relied on Amazon for years, this experience has shattered my trust and left me questioning whether I can continue to support your platform.I urge Amazon to seriously reconsider its policies and procedures for handling customer complaints and returns. There needs to be accountability for the promises made to customers and a genuine effort to rectify situations when they fail to meet expectations.In conclusion, I demand a full refund for the Nothing 2A phone and a formal apology for the way this matter has been mishandled. If Amazon hopes to retain my trust and loyalty as a customer, swift action is needed to address these concerns.Sincerely,Sowmya

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Very nice phone but no charger
review_text: The phone is really good. I have received many compliments from people about this phone. The user experience is also very good. I like the symmetrical bezels around the screen, makes it look really premium, the screen is sharp and adequately bright, the interface is really smooth, I wouldn't say it's fast but it gets the job done, I'm coming from a OP 5T, so this phone with its 120HZ screen does look faster than my old phone, I do know it's limitations and I'm okay with the compramises made to make it a well rounded package at an affordable price. I would have given 5/5 stars, but no company is perfect. -1 star for not having a charger in the box, I had to spend an additional 2k for a compatible 45w charger on Amazon. I would have been more than happy to pay that additional amount for the phone if they had included a compatible Nothing charger in the box. Now I'm using a good quality Amazon basics charger, Nothing should start including a compatible charger in the box, or let the customer pick if they want a charger bundled in the box. Just like how they pick the storage space they want on the phone, charge the customer an additional 1k or 1.5k for the charger to be included in the box, so customer who actually need a charger would still have the option to get a phone with its compatible charger from the company instead of scouring through the internet for hours to find a reliable charger with good reviews that is compatible with the phone, just an unwanted tension/hassle in my opinion.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A flagship performer without the flagship price.
review_text: Easily one of the best purchases that I have made and well worth its price.Pros:- SD 8 Gen 2 is fast and very power efficient. The performance is indistinguishable in day to day usage when compared to SD 8 Gen 3 on a OnePlus 12 with UFS 4.0. Even though the 12R has a UFS 3.1 storage, you are unlikely to notice any difference whatsoever without running benchmarks or checking the specifications. In real life day to day usage, I have not found any difference and I am a power user who uses a lot of applications and use the phone over 8 Hours a day.- The vapour chamber handles the cooling very well which keeps the device at excellent temperature even when playing games for an extended duration. It almost never goes over 38c.- The display has the same features as the OnePlus 12 (the resolution is relatively lower but it's not noticeable to the naked eye without magnification) and this is one of the best displays that you will come across. The HDR performance is also some of the best I have seen and it is a completely different experience. This can also be seen in the HDR shots taken with cameras. I'd suggest going to a OnePlus experience center and searching for 12K HDR videos on YouTube to get a better idea. Note that the 4,500 nits mentioned is only the HDR brightness at a small white portion of the display under sunlight. This is NOT the max brightness of the full display. But it is bright enough to use under direct sunlight.- Battery life is very impressive with over 8 hours of SOT and the 100W included charger fully charges it in about 35 mins.- Also love that the display can be used even when your hands are wet unlike most other smartphones- The bezels are extremely slim and the chin is smaller than the one on the OnePlus 12. I do wish it was equal all around though.Rather than cons, I'll just mention what it lacks.- Wireless charging- Telephoto cameraThat's pretty much it. If you are looking for a smooth and reliable device with solid performance, battery life, fast charging, decent cameras and display experience, I would easily recommend this. Sure the cameras may not be as good as an iPhone 15 (81k) or a Pixel 8 (83k) but they also cost around 80% more than the OnePlus 12R.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Fantastic Phone After a Week of Use!
review_text: I‚Äôve been using the OnePlus 12R (Iron Gray, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB Storage) for a week now, and it‚Äôs been an amazing experience so far!Design & Feel:The Iron Gray color looks really sleek, and the phone feels great in the hand. It‚Äôs light, and slim, and the metal finish gives it a premium feel. I‚Äôve gotten a few compliments on how good it looks!Performance:This phone is super fast. I‚Äôve been using it for gaming, browsing, and even some work, and it handles everything like a pro. No lag, no stuttering ‚Äî everything runs so smoothly. The 8 GB RAM really shows its power when multitasking.Display:The AMOLED screen is beautiful! Watching videos and scrolling through social media is a real treat. The colors are bright and vibrant, and the smooth 120Hz refresh rate makes everything feel so responsive.Battery Life:The battery easily lasts me the whole day stiil I have around 20-25% left, even with heavy use. I also love how fast it charges ‚Äî the SUPERVOOC charging gets me back to 100% in about 25-30 minutes, which is super convenient. But I guess, better to use slow charger day to day to increase battery life and use the SUPERVOOC only when you need it urgently.Camera:I was skeptic about 12R vs Realme GT 6T vs Pixel 8A. After a thorough review and physical check, the dynamic range is better in 12R. Pixel is also a great camera but has a small battery backup compared to 12R. I can vouch that 12R will not disappoint you with its overall performance. I‚Äôve taken some really sharp and detailed photos, and the portrait mode is a lot of fun. Even in low light, the pictures come out pretty good.Software:I love how clean and simple the OxygenOS is. It‚Äôs easy to navigate and doesn‚Äôt come with a lot of pre-installed apps I don‚Äôt need. Everything just works smoothly, and I‚Äôve had no issues so far.After 7 days, I‚Äôm really happy with the OnePlus 12R. It feels like a flagship phone at the price. Definitely a great choice if you‚Äôre looking for a reliable camera, battery backup, feature-packed, good-looking phone!

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Pretty fantastic considering the price
review_text: This phone is pretty amazing have had an amazing battery life (4+ hrs on 50% battery), charges quickly (30 mins, rapid charging), great display (full resolution not the basic one), great network bands (5G) and rock solid performance (Geekbench: 2K single, 5K multi). The main camera lens is good but the rest of the lenses; I would say average and sometimes annoying in artificial lights - a little light and it doesn't do even a decent job, front camera is okay. But, considering the price (I paid 35k INR, 8gb+256gb) I don't think there can be anything better than this. Maybe S23 is a better option if you want a better camera around this range but maybe 5-6k higher than this if you want 256gb. I didn't want 16GB ram on this as I don't think I need it and I don't think anyone does for now. I have used an iPhone 15 128gb earlier this year. Maybe my standards for camera are high. But, let's be honest; value is great for the price. Go for it, safe bet for 2 years. I might switch after 1-2 years. Oh yeah, doesn't heat; only slightly that too while charging; again it is a 100W charger. Butter smooth scrolling as it supports LTPO & fingerprint scanner is quick too. 4 stars cause camera might disappoint you. I suggest you to consider this, if under 35K INR and that too 256+8!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Pathetic product and service!!!!
review_text: My word of advice.. stay away from buying phones on Amazon!!!I was recently delivered a defective one plus 12R that won't even turn on and Amazon has entirely shirked their responsibility. They washed their hands off claiming it's a One plus issue, and I need to deal this directly with the manufacturer. They won't let you return/replace it or take any action for that matter. Apparently, it's clearly mentioned in their policy that Amazon is not responsible for defective products even if it arrives Dead. Beware of this interesting clause guys!!!!If you‚Äôre unlucky enough to get a faulty device, brace yourself for a nightmare. Be prepared to be put on hold for hours and hours, transferred through never ending loops of mind games, bad attitudes and utmost unprofessional behaviour of the Amazon staff.. ranging from the agents to technicians to leadership team. This ridiculous drama will drag on for days, driving you to the brink of insanity - forcing you to either give up or become one of them... Insane! I chose the former and now find myself with a non-working phone, a loss of 45k INR, and just a sliver of sanity left!To be honest, I‚Äôve always bought all my phones and gadgets from Amazon. However, I feel compelled to write this not just because of a one-off bad experience, but because I‚Äôve realized that this is a widespread issue. Countless others have faced this nightmare, particularly during a "SALE".Do yourself a favor: don‚Äôt waste your money here. Go to a showroom!Good luck guys!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
OSM ONEPLUS 12R.  OSM PERFOMANCE!!!
review_text: I got the delivery on time with the original Box and Seal and the product. Now about the OnePlus 12R it's a silent-killer phone in speed, weight and feel in hand a good Value for money. It's fingerprint reader amazingly fast response. The functionality is superb with a massive 3.2Ghz clock speed Snapdragon 8Gen2. The feel of OnePlus 12R is premium and luxury in hand. My final verdicts are:CAMERA : Above average. Portrait mode too good. Night mode is ok. Dynamic and wide angle can be more good in future update as I hope.CHARGING & BATTERY: Like Nord series this also have 5500mAh and comes easily 1 and half for me under 5G for 7 hrs or mild gaming. There is no idle discharge also. 100% charging happens in just 12 to 13 minutes with Ultra Fast 100w charger thanks to OnePlus they give it in the box only.DISPLAY: Its LTPO4 Amoled and immersive feel of color and subject be movie watching or gaming the Display of OnePlus 12R will attract you more and more.BUILD & BODY: Looks sturdy üí™ and it is durable also the way it looks with Waterproof and dust proof you don't need to bother for splashes of rain water etc. Moreover OnePlus is giving one Backcase in box also.RAM: I loved the ram management of OnePlus 12R it's not heating or lagging at all, even during 60fps gaming or multitasking or even video editing also. Only on charging only it heats but overall during the gaming it's not heating that much. Ram expansion feature makes the mobile more battery efficient.NETWORK: Till date I have not faced any call drops or Wifi Break in middle. Even wirless bluetooth earbuds calling also too good and stereophonic.SOUND & HAPTICS: Dual Stereo Speakers and Dolby sound makes the music on the go nice and loud and mild bass and crisp clear. The HAPTICS of OnePlus 12R is truly impressive with its O Engine feature. The typing is a boon on it with fluid speed and every word auto-correction feature that enables a fast typing as well as 99% accuracy.At the end I can easily say that it's a premium smartphone as per the price, with its fully loaded AI features with a new 2.26Gb update, it is well justified. Every phone has a CONS & PROS but about OnePlus 12R it's Cons are less for example - it can be IP67 rest I am not finding any cons as per budget I have paid.Highly recommended. Buy it use it and you will not regret it... you will be happy happy only. Thanks for spending time and reading my genuine as per usage review.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good midrange phone.
review_text: I bought this phone at 19k, and for this money this is a good phone. Ticks all the right boxes, has all the required things like charger, cable, case and screenguard in the box unlike some other companies. Gray back is shimmery, looks cool. Phone is lightweight despite big battery. Charging speed is lightning quick and battery runs long enough. OS is smooth, got 3-4 updates just after setting up. Camera is fine too, no complains. Casual games run smooth, haven't tried any heavy game which I anyway don't play.Two observations though:1. Battery sticks at 100% for a very long time, which is strange and not accurate. But overall battery backup is good. See the screenshot.2. It's good it supports HDR on Netflix and Prime etc, and has a toggle for make the screen bright when playing HDR content. But it doesn't work at all. If your screen is dim it remains dim. You have to manually push the light level to the max. In general auto light sensor keeps the screen a bit dim for my liking, and unlike my Samsung Galaxy S20, it doesn't remember if I have increased the level, it still keep diming the screen to preset level. In my Samsung, the auto level changes the light including manual inputs so I don't have to fiddle with it very often.Upart from these two niggles, phone is good. Don't exact too much from the camera though. It's average.

review_text: Game phone üì±I am writing this after 1 week of my purchase I feel that In this price range other company giving only good processor which gives little more benchmark score than sd 782g but for other things you will not buy one more mobile . So this phone is a best phone for all aspects.1- Best performance for gaming I have tested with bgmi , class of clan , call of duty, Mobile legends etc .2- Above average camera which will give you good image in day light condition because it have premium sony sensor.3- You can get high quality stability in video also due to its OIS feature so it is good for bloggers and it supports slow motion in 240 fps .4- It is giving me 10-12 hour battery backup with normal use but when it comes to gaming it gives 5-7 hour but it is not a deal breaker because in those 5 hours you will get best gaming experience and in only 30 mint you can charge 100 % this mobile with its 80 w fast charger.5- It have its brand value with red cable card , 5 g stable network connectivity, Vo lte , wifi , nfc , bluetooth , ir blaster , Dolby Atmos6- It will gives you premium level haptics due to its O-haptic motor .7- Premium quality amoled display which will give you best viewing experience with 120 fps but feels little dull in direct sun light due to 950 nits peak brightness.8- One thing is missing i.e 3.5 mm jack but in my case I have bluetooth ear bud so it's okay for me.9- OnePlus gives best after sell service , one example is free display change if you will get green line issue but in my case I have not experienced that .10- It will give you quick software update for 3 years and 2 major update.I think this is enough to go with this phone cuz in 19 k budget you will not get a better deal than this.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Decent OnePlus phone under 30k Segment
review_text: Have been using the phone for over a week now.Positives:1. Snapdragon 782 processor is quite good. There is no lag whatsoever even on opening multiple apps and using for a long time.2. Battery life is decent. It is definitely not a gaming mobile.3. 5G services are accessible in most locations(in Hyderabad) wherever there is network.4. Both front and rear cameras are decent. You can click good shots in Night mode as well. Photos taken in various modes viz., Macro, Extra HD, Night, Pro, Potrait are attached.5. 80W fast charging is electric! I was able to charge my mobile from 23% to 100% in 17-18 mins and from 4% to 100% in 22-23 mins.6. Audio and video quality is great. Get some good earphones and you will experience the theatre effect with Dolby sound.7. No heating issue of any kind even after continuous usage/a long phone call.8. 12 GB RAM is great. You can now multitask and open apps simultaneously.Negatives:1. Battery drains fast. Should have been built to last longer. Like I said, definitely not a gamer's mobile. However, phone will last for a day even with heavy usage.2. Flagship 50MP Sony camera is a disappointment. Definitely not what an amateur photographer would expect. The moment you zoom in, image gets blurred and pixelated. Expected a much better camera from a mid premium mobile at priced at 30k3. Most of the features were toned down from other premium versions of OnePlus. However, one would expect some premium features when spending almost 30k.4. Back cover and screen guard are useless. Expected OnePlus to provide decent good quality default screen guard and phone cases. Please do buy both separately.5. Audio/Video seems to just stop and then play on using YouTube. Might have to update the app and check if it is an issue with the device.6. Absence of a 3.5mm audio jack is a big drawback for wired earphone users.Update 1 : Have received the first update to Oxygen 13.1 within 2-3 days of purchase wherein video quality of camera and few other features were improved. Also, the video lag issue is now resolved.Update 2: Received second software update on 23 Aug 2023 which is aimed at improving front/rear camera picture quality and optimizing the battery of the mobile when it is at rest.Update 3: Received another software upgrade in early October aimed at enhancing Network connectivity and stabilization.Update 4: Received Android 14 software upgrade on Jan 12 2024. Device is now stable.Overall a decent buy under 30k segment. Expected better features from a premium smartphone but certainly not a big disappointment. Overall 4 stars. I would recommend this mobile to others.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Highly recommended. Performance guaranteed phone.
review_text: Go for it blindly. I've used Samsung, Realme, Xiaomi, Micromax, Nokia, Vivo and Sony Xperia in past but no one comes close to OnePlus in the smoothness and user interference. Completely in awe with this phone.Pros:-1. Camera is superb,image produce natural colour. At this price point only a few Realme phones with Sony sensor come close. otherwise Poco,Oppo, Xiaomi produce filtered and sharpened images.2. Performance is smooth. It doesn't lag even once. For day to day task you can opt blindly. Good for gaming & multitasking.3. Display is bright enough to use outdoor even in direct sunlight. Video clarity is superb.4. Sound is clear & loud. Call is loud enough that you can hear without placing phone on your ear5. Battery takes around 25-30 min to charge from 0% to 100%. It last 1.5 days easily with moderate use. I've watched 2 movies on OTT in single charge and still 50% battery remaining.6. No bloatware, no unwanted app preloaded.Cons:-1. Phone heats a little during charge, but cool down instantly when you unplug the charger.2. Applock doesn't lock setting.3. Phone is lightweight and slippery. Place back cover with good grip.4. Made with plastic, feels gentle.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Overpriced, but offers good value in this range
review_text: The OnePlus Nord CE 3 (ONCE3) took its time convincing me of earning the successor's role from my Xiaomi Note 7 Pro.Honestly, this doesn't feel like much of an upgrade from the Note 7 Pro that's over 4 years old now. Sure the storage size and RAM are higher, the SoC is more current generation and has an in-display finger print sensor. I'd waited for a good successor to the Note 7 Pro for years and I had to finally compromise with this phone sacrificing a headphone jack that I miss on a daily basis.Pictures from this phone and my erstwhile RN7pro deliver comparable quality shots. The difference is mostly in post processing and response but in quality, there's barely a 4 years' refinement. Even in good daylight shots from the primary camera, the images look poorly captured, sharpened with no resemblance to the textures as perceived in reality and the 50 MP image does very little to enhance visual quality.I don't want to repetitively make this comparison because it's a niche audience it'll apply to, but the 12MP to 48MP pixel binned images that the RN7Pro offered 4 years ago is a lot more impressive TODAY than the ONCE3's 50MP and its economical 12.3MP standard framing.The ONCE3's reasonably good Camera reviews, Snapdragon chipset for GCAM, presence of an IR blaster and in-display fingerprint sensor, the charging support with an included 80W fast charger and expandable storage are the reasons why I chose this phone. The current gen Redmi Note 13 series failed to make sense, was overpriced and I didn't want to encourage that trend.Since buying and using the ONCE3, the things I liked about the phone are the design, the in-hand feel, the haptic feedback quality, the display quality and the stereo speakers' quality.Things I found disappointing in this phone apart from the mediocre performing Camera are mostly of the Oxygen OS. Though there aren't any bloatware, these things really made for a poor impression:The fonts aren't really enough for someone like me who wants a no-nonsense feeling presentation.The Photos/Gallery app doesn't have something as basic as a slideshow featureNo File Management system other than that of Google Files.The fingerprint reader takes a few tries to recognize and is almost uncomfortably positioned low on the screen that reaching it takes a long thumb or switching grip.Xiaomi has a sunlight mode where even if the phone is set to manual brightness control, it switches to high-visibility mode when blasted with bright sunlight. The ONCE3 has no such choice.No proprietary media player.Themes collection is rather poor and the wallpapers are inadequate too. Even though the app offers many fonts, none of them are suited for a clean looking interface. It's as though their intended target audience is anime watching teenagers.Finally, despite using 60Hz refresh rate, always-on display off and 2G network most of the time with WIFI on all the time, the battery backup is nothing phenomenal for a 5000mAh device. My 4 year old Note 7 Pro with a 4000mAh delivers almost the same kind of SoT with similar configuration.Overall, it's not a bitter disappointment, but I find it quite lack-luster for a 2024 phone in this price-range. If I were to be reasonable, the phone is barely worth 16,000 INR. Take the brand, the display and the charger away, the phone is barely worth 12.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Looks wise Good but
review_text: This is my first one plus and brought with lots of expectation . In the box there it comes , Main Device, user manual, welcome letter, Red cable club card, One plus sticker, sim ejector pin, One free TPU same color case with one plus logo at the back and the 80watt charging adapter with red type c cable.  The deisgn of this nord 3 series  is also d√©j√† vu .  However after use of few days , first of all i noticed - - The phone has pure plastic built with glossy polycarbonate glass back . Though it captures no finger print .- Hybrid sim tray with either dual sim or one sim and MSD card- Comes with IR blaster to use this phone as remote.- Top and bottom Dual speaker with dolby atmos sound . Bottom speaker gives you bass effect of the music while top acts like twitter.  Overall sound quality is quite loud and sweet .- Has NFC payment support which is quite attractive part . You can now make wireless payment via Google pay from your credit card virtually . No need to carry card at wallet.- Samsung 6.7inch Amoled display with punch hole camera design and indisplay finger print sensor.- 5000 mah battery with 80 watt superVocc first charge . Battery draining rate is also very less at standard use . Makes full Charge in just 35 minutes.- Snapdragon processor is also capable of goog gaming without any frame drop and lag . The Ram is virtuality expandable upto extra 8GB- During gaming , its large vapor cooling chamber keeps the phone temperature optimal and shows allmost less heating issue. The whole smartphone body has 12 temperature sensor .- It has UFS 3.1 storage capacity . It comes with 23 Gb system equipped storage.***BUT ///- Has very average camera with allmost poor processing . It has flagship sony sensor which has been used in oneplus 11 too  but one plus team was very lazy to make it more optimzed for this device . So always d√©j√† vu dont give you good experience.- Oneplus is known for good camera smartphone but picture quality of this Nord CE 3 looks like the smartphones under 10000 . Colors of the pictures looks like washed out with less detail- night mode pictures does not makes so much of difference than the photos taken in normal mode . Colors, lights and exposures both stay allmost same- video quality is good but can be improved more . It has OIS image stabiliization which works only at 1080p 60 fps- 2x loseless zoom is a good feature .- Selfie camera is quite good  and takes bright picture . Has screen flash option . selfie camera shoots full hd video . Has pano and night mode option too .- being a mid level flagship phone missing Potrait video mode and pro video mode .- Macro camera is quite ok .* This phone strictly uses google dialer, so no more silent call record . And there are no one plus dialer .* Has no out of the box optimization , junk cleaning and antivirus software.* No alert slider* No 3.5mm jackSo i think one plus should give a immediate update to fix the camera optimization issue for this great hardware . Otherwise this is a very good balanced phone for every task . I brought at 24,999 , this is the quite ok price rather than it's MRP.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
"OnePlus Nord CE 3 Review: A Balanced Mid-Range Marvel with Impressive Performance and Value"
review_text: Design and Display:The Nord CE 3 features a sleek and modern design with a slim profile, making it comfortable to hold and use. The 6.7-inch AMOLED display is a standout feature, offering vibrant colors and deep blacks, with a smooth 120Hz refresh rate that enhances the overall visual experience.Performance:Powered by a capable Snapdragon 782G processor and 8GB of RAM, the Nord CE 3 handles multitasking and demanding apps with ease. Whether you're gaming or switching between apps, the phone performs reliably without significant slowdowns.Camera:The triple-camera setup includes a 50MP main sensor, an 8MP ultra-wide lens, and a 2MP macro lens. The camera system delivers sharp and detailed photos in various lighting conditions. The night mode works well for low-light photography, though it's not as refined as flagship models.Battery Life:Equipped with a 5000mAh battery, the Nord CE 3 offers impressive battery life that comfortably lasts a full day of heavy use. The 80W fast charging feature ensures that you can quickly recharge and get back to using your phone with minimal downtime.Software:Running on OxygenOS, which is based on Android 13, the Nord CE 3 provides a clean and user-friendly interface. It includes useful customization options and a smooth, responsive experience with minimal bloatware.Overall:The OnePlus Nord CE 3 is a well-rounded smartphone that delivers excellent performance, a high-quality display, and solid battery life at a competitive price point. It‚Äôs a great choice for users looking for a stylish and capable device without the premium price tag of flagship models.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Solid battery + performance, average camera, poor build
review_text: Bought this phone for my wife and she's been using it for 3-4 days now. She has upgraded from the OnePlus 7, where as I use the OnePlus 9Pro.While setting up the phone for her and during basic usage of WhatsApp or Instagram, there's hardly any difference to the naked eye between this Nord 3 CE and other flagships. The display is solid, good colours. The fingerprint and face unlock are super fast. The haptic feedback while typing and navigation is very responsive. Oxygen OS 13 is stable and well optimised. Makes the experience of using this phone very smooth.Battery performance is excellent too. Goes from 10-80% in 25 mins. And a full 100% lasts 30-40 hours depending on usage.Camera is okay. Meant for those who have simple and basic usage. Video - OIS is average.The only thing I didn't like is the back cover. Feels very delicate. It's like a thin silicone-plastic layer, that's it. OnePlus should have used better material for the back to make the phone more sturdy. My mom has an old OnePlus Nord 2 CE Lite. Even that has a more sturdy back cover.Verdict: At 25k with back discount, this phone is phenomenal for the average user (priority is calls with everyday social media usage and browsing on Chrome). Performance, display, battery, OS are all pretty solid.But if you are a content creator who wishes to record high quality videos for making reels or YouTube videos, or your work needs you to continusly have your video on for Zoom meetings, then maybe, this phone is not for you. You'll need to consider investing in a better phone above the 35-40k price range.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
A great phone with an average camera
review_text: Been using this for over a month now so I've tested everything and here is my review:What's good:1. Performance: The Snapdragon 782 performs as expected, with no lag doing any normal task, smooth multitasking, and doesn't heat up doing any of it.2. Gaming: I don't play many games, especially the heavy ones, but I tried some and it was able to give decent frame rates on high settings, but occasionally there were some stutters on games. which also reduced when I turned high-performance mode(but that heats the phone more and obviously uses more battery). the phone isn't being marketed as a gaming phone and if you want one there are phones with more gaming-centered features in the price range.3. Display: The display is great, thin, and even bezel all around. with no flickering issues, smooth 120hz (requires high setting, auto select often uses 90hz instead of 120hz). Good colours and personally the max brightness is enough for me, but if you regularly use your phone under strong sunlight you might like a phone with 1300 nits or more, but most phones like nothing phone 1 in this price range have the same max brightness as nord ce 34. Software: No ads or bloatware out of the box is great, Oxygen OS (color os) is fine and has decent features but One UI is better (the full One UI that you get on Samsung phones that cost 30000 or more)5. Connectivity: No issues with 4G or 5G connectivity and speed, wifi calling works but not on airplane mode (for those who want it). Wifi and Bluetooth also work well. The only thing missing is VoNR support, hopefully, it will be added with Android 14.6. haptics: It has great haptics, the vibration on typing and in games is similar to what you see in flagship phones so that is great to see.What's not good:1. Camera: The camera is average in quality.Has all the features you need but overall quality is not up to the mark for a phone that costs this much.The issues are all software-based since it has a good camera sensor, so hopefully it'll get better, but for now, you can try GCam for better results (needs to be downloaded and installed from the internet so be careful)2. Battery: 80W charging is super fast, takes 20-25 minutes to charge the phone from 20-90. But the backup is not very good. I get 6-8 hours of screen-on-time depending on how much 5G I use and what I do. But on my usage I was able to get as much on a phone with 4000mah battery as well.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
One plus forever
review_text: After using the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G for a while, I‚Äôm quite impressed with what it offers at its price point. The 6.72-inch display with a 120Hz refresh rate makes the screen incredibly smooth, especially while scrolling and playing games. The colors are vivid, and watching videos or browsing feels quite immersive.The performance is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 chipset, which has been decent for everyday tasks like browsing, using social media, and light gaming. Multitasking is seamless thanks to the 8GB RAM, and the phone handles most apps without lag. However, for more intense gaming or heavy usage, it can show some limitations compared to higher-end models.One of the highlights for me is the 108MP main camera. It captures photos with impressive detail, especially in well-lit conditions. The colors are sharp, and it‚Äôs great for casual photography. Low-light performance, though, could be better, as the images sometimes appear grainy. The 16MP front camera works well for selfies, delivering clear and bright images.Battery life is another strong point. The 5000mAh battery easily lasts me a full day with moderate use, and the 67W SUPERVOOC fast charging is incredibly quick‚ÄîI can get from 0 to 80% in around 30 minutes, which is a lifesaver when I‚Äôm in a hurry.In terms of design, the phone feels sturdy but lightweight, and the matte finish on the back is sleek without being too slippery. The only downside for me is that the phone lacks certain flagship features like water resistance or wireless charging, but at this price, it‚Äôs understandable.Overall, I‚Äôd say the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G offers solid performance, a vibrant display, and excellent battery life for everyday users. It‚Äôs a great value for the price if you're looking for a mid-range 5G phone with reliable features.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Wonderful mobile
review_text: I am writting this review after using the phone for more than a year. My satisfaction level is quite high for this phone. The built of mobile is so good. Look wise it is quite trendy. Performance is excellent. Quality of camera is very good. It comes with a super chager. Charging time of the mobile is very less. Back up is nice. After all it's a crafted mobile. It's worth every penny you spent .  I have only small issues regarding the sound quality. When connected to bluetooth the sound is very low even at maximum volume.  I specifically want to mention about it's water resistance quality. 'Marvellous' is what I would like to mention about it's resistivity towards ingress of water. My mobile fell down in water and remained under water for nearly 6 hours. When recovered, I was surprised to see the mobile still working nicely. All parameters were fine. Only SIMs were out of order due to water ingress in the SIM slot. I dried it up with a air blower, inserted the SIM and they started working fine. There was no water ingress to any other parts of the mobile. The net connectivity was working fine.  This was a pleasant surprise to me. I have decided to buy only One plus for any future purchase. I highly recommend this. Thank you One Plus.

Initially, it would last two days, but now I‚Äôm struggling to get through even a single day. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this phone‚Äîit just doesn‚Äôt offer the performance or quality you‚Äôd expect for the price.

OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G: A Stylish and Capable Mid-Ranger
review_text: The OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G in Pastel Lime is a standout device in the mid-range segment, offering a blend of style, performance, and value. With its eye-catching pastel lime color and sleek design, this phone is as visually appealing as it is functional.Equipped with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, the Nord CE 3 Lite 5G ensures smooth multitasking and ample space for apps, media, and files. The Snapdragon 695 chipset provides reliable performance for everyday tasks and moderate gaming. The 6.72-inch LCD display, though not AMOLED, delivers vibrant colors and decent brightness, making it suitable for media consumption.The camera setup, featuring a 108MP primary sensor, captures impressive photos with good detail and color accuracy in well-lit conditions, though low-light performance is average. The 5000mAh battery ensures all-day usage, and the 67W fast charging support means you can quickly top up when needed.Running on OxygenOS, the software experience is clean and user-friendly, with useful customizations and minimal bloatware. The inclusion of 5G support ensures future-proof connectivity.Overall, the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G is a solid choice for those seeking a stylish and capable smartphone without breaking the bank.

The sensor‚Äôs placement on the front is convenient and intuitive.In summary, the OnePlus Nord CE 3 5G is a fantastic all-rounder. It boasts a stylish appearance, is exceptionally easy to use, offers reliable battery life, and features a responsive fingerprint sensor. If you‚Äôre looking for a 5G phone that delivers on both looks and performance, the Nord CE 3 is an excellent choice.
