review_text: After using the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G for a while, I‚Äôm quite impressed with what it offers at its price point. The 6.72-inch display with a 120Hz refresh rate makes the screen incredibly smooth, especially while scrolling and playing games. The colors are vivid, and watching videos or browsing feels quite immersive.The performance is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 chipset, which has been decent for everyday tasks like browsing, using social media, and light gaming. Multitasking is seamless thanks to the 8GB RAM, and the phone handles most apps without lag. However, for more intense gaming or heavy usage, it can show some limitations compared to higher-end models.One of the highlights for me is the 108MP main camera. It captures photos with impressive detail, especially in well-lit conditions. The colors are sharp, and it‚Äôs great for casual photography. Low-light performance, though, could be better, as the images sometimes appear grainy. The 16MP front camera works well for selfies, delivering clear and bright images.Battery life is another strong point. The 5000mAh battery easily lasts me a full day with moderate use, and the 67W SUPERVOOC fast charging is incredibly quick‚ÄîI can get from 0 to 80% in around 30 minutes, which is a lifesaver when I‚Äôm in a hurry.In terms of design, the phone feels sturdy but lightweight, and the matte finish on the back is sleek without being too slippery. The only downside for me is that the phone lacks certain flagship features like water resistance or wireless charging, but at this price, it‚Äôs understandable.Overall, I‚Äôd say the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G offers solid performance, a vibrant display, and excellent battery life for everyday users. It‚Äôs a great value for the price if you're looking for a mid-range 5G phone with reliable features.

product_name: OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G (Chromatic Gray, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Wonderful mobile
review_text: I am writting this review after using the phone for more than a year. My satisfaction level is quite high for this phone. The built of mobile is so good. Look wise it is quite trendy. Performance is excellent. Quality of camera is very good. It comes with a super chager. Charging time of the mobile is very less. Back up is nice. After all it's a crafted mobile. It's worth every penny you spent .  I have only small issues regarding the sound quality. When connected to bluetooth the sound is very low even at maximum volume.  I specifically want to mention about it's water resistance quality. 'Marvellous' is what I would like to mention about it's resistivity towards ingress of water. My mobile fell down in water and remained under water for nearly 6 hours. When recovered, I was surprised to see the mobile still working nicely. All parameters were fine. Only SIMs were out of order due to water ingress in the SIM slot. I dried it up with a air blower, inserted the SIM and they started working fine. There was no water ingress to any other parts of the mobile. The net connectivity was working fine.  This was a pleasant surprise to me. I have decided to buy only One plus for any future purchase. I highly recommend this. Thank you One Plus.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Overpriced and Underperforming
review_text: I‚Äôve been using the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite, and honestly, I‚Äôm not satisfied with it, especially considering the price. It feels like you‚Äôre paying an extra ‚Çπ2000 just for the OnePlus brand, when you could get a similar phone from Realme for much less.The camera is quite disappointing, especially for indoor shots, and the video quality in low light is very poor. The processor is underwhelming‚Äîit often feels laggy, especially during multitasking, which is frustrating for a phone in this price range. After just six months, it‚Äôs started taking 3-4 seconds to unlock when I press the power button, which is concerning.To make matters worse, the battery has degraded quickly. Initially, it would last two days, but now I‚Äôm struggling to get through even a single day. Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this phone‚Äîit just doesn‚Äôt offer the performance or quality you‚Äôd expect for the price.

OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G: A Stylish and Capable Mid-Ranger
review_text: The OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G in Pastel Lime is a standout device in the mid-range segment, offering a blend of style, performance, and value. With its eye-catching pastel lime color and sleek design, this phone is as visually appealing as it is functional.Equipped with 8GB of RAM and 128GB of storage, the Nord CE 3 Lite 5G ensures smooth multitasking and ample space for apps, media, and files. The Snapdragon 695 chipset provides reliable performance for everyday tasks and moderate gaming. The 6.72-inch LCD display, though not AMOLED, delivers vibrant colors and decent brightness, making it suitable for media consumption.The camera setup, featuring a 108MP primary sensor, captures impressive photos with good detail and color accuracy in well-lit conditions, though low-light performance is average. The 5000mAh battery ensures all-day usage, and the 67W fast charging support means you can quickly top up when needed.Running on OxygenOS, the software experience is clean and user-friendly, with useful customizations and minimal bloatware. The inclusion of 5G support ensures future-proof connectivity.Overall, the OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G is a solid choice for those seeking a stylish and capable smartphone without breaking the bank.

OnePlus Nord CE 3 5G - A Perfect Blend of Style and Performance
review_text: The OnePlus Nord CE 3 5G is a device that doesn‚Äôt disappoint. It seamlessly combines style with functionality and provides an excellent user experience across the board.Appearance (5/5): The appearance of the Nord CE 3 is sleek and elegant. The slim design, the choice of materials, and the placement of the camera module all scream premium. It‚Äôs a phone that you‚Äôll be proud to show off.Ease of Use (4.5/5): OnePlus continues its tradition of providing a clean, user-friendly interface. OxygenOS is intuitive, responsive, and customizable. Navigating through apps and settings is a breeze, making it ideal for both tech-savvy users and those new to smartphones.Battery Life (4/5): The battery life on the Nord CE 3 is commendable. It easily gets me through a full day of moderate to heavy usage. While it may not be the best in its category, it‚Äôs reliable, and the Warp Charge feature ensures a quick top-up when needed.Fingerprint Sensor (4.5/5): The fingerprint sensor on this device is fast and accurate. It provides added security while making unlocking the phone a breeze. The sensor‚Äôs placement on the front is convenient and intuitive.In summary, the OnePlus Nord CE 3 5G is a fantastic all-rounder. It boasts a stylish appearance, is exceptionally easy to use, offers reliable battery life, and features a responsive fingerprint sensor. If you‚Äôre looking for a 5G phone that delivers on both looks and performance, the Nord CE 3 is an excellent choice.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Very good battery backup and super fast charging
review_text: Great budget phone from OnePlus. All-round performance and very user friendly.Pros: Great battery backup. Lasts more than a day easily with heavy use.Super fast charging with 100 watt adaptor. Very cool.Nice camera. Good quality picture.Display is also very good.Cons: The processor can be updated. (But works well and in this price segment it's ok ).The low light photogry is not that good. (Just ok).Overall it is a very good purchase at this price range.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Medium usage level phone for daily usage
review_text: Reviewing after 20days of usage.Good performece won't say this phone is best but okay for normal usage not for gaming or super heavy user purpose. Display is decent thumbs up for it.Camera is mediocre, battery run for whole day, good thing is it super charged with 100W charger from 20-100% in 30minutephone is not heating as other are saying, althought it's normal for smartphone to get heated while charging so it happens with this one.played Pubg fro 4-7hours non stop at HD settings it worked smoothly. Their is high performance mode and 120hz settings so not to worry we can turn it on for heavy usage like gaming but it will consume more battery.Screen is is visible bright in outdoors against sunlight..Phone will take around 20gb of storage for system.my current occupied storage is 44gb with apps out of 128gb.Phone UI is good not best, good thing is their is no bloaware their are some apps which we can disable easily.with 20days of calling, gaming, heavy video watching i m satisfied with the product..no issue for now.Even I dropped mistakenly this one it's fine with the cover nothing bad happened.I m 1st time one plus user very happy, I also bought 1year extended warranty from official one plus website...so I have 2yrs manufacture warranty at extra Rs.599.phone body is plastic nd fits good in big hands, small hand people will face problem holding the device.Final suggestion yes go for it if you are normal usage watching videos, running different apps for various task, calling also decent but speaker is not too loud on call but that's acceptable.Price could have been lower around 18k or 20k something.Bought at 24.5k.. of which 22k is price and 2.5k GST.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
It's the best in this category!
review_text: I've been using this phone for about a week now and I feel that it's super awesome. Let's talk about the pros and cons :Pros1. The display is pretty bright and amazing. It can play HDR videos upto 1440p in YouTube and you can set your device to brighten up while playing HDR videos in the setting.2. The UI is very smooth. It has a lot of features too!3. The cameras are awesome! They click such amazing photos and shoot amazing videos. It clicks natural photos. There are modes like timelapse,slow-mo,etc too. It has OIS, which only records at 1080p 60fps. There is a mode in the video section named 'ultra steady' by which you can use OIS.4. The performance of the phone is amazing and is well optimised!5. The built is quality is nice too!6. The charging is fabulous! It has a 100 watt charger in the box which can full charge your phone in 25 minutes when smart rapid charging is on. The battery backup is just amazing. This phone gives a whopping 1.5-2 days of battery backup.7. There is a feature that you might not know, you can adjust the intensity of brightness of the torch by pressing and holding the torch symbol, just like iphones.8. The speakers are loud AF! After updating there is this mode where you could ultra boost volume upto 300% which is crazy! And it's very-very loud.Cons1. It can't play 2160p in HDR.2. It doesn't support OIS on 4k 30fps and the OIS video has very slight unnoticeable jitterness.3. The animation is kinda slow but smooth for me, so I changed it in developer options.4. The frame and back is made up of plastic.The phone is pretty awesome and the cons don't bother me üòÑ.I'm a tech enthusiast so you can trust on me!

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
The Exchange Scam By Amazon
review_text: I have no complaint with phone it is Quite Decent Phone but Only lacks in 2nd Camera Functionality the Ultra wide angle camera in below average not expected by OnePlusThe Selfie camera is decent but can me improved.NOW THE EXCHANGE SERVICE SCAMThe delivery service has been terrible. I ordered my phone on October 3rd, and it was supposed to arrive the next day. I even took a leave from work, but it still didn't arrive. This happened for several days, and despite 7-8 complaints, I suffered a loss of 2-3k for missing work.As for the exchange service, my phone had a minor back panel issue and a dented frame, but the delivery guy falsely claimed the display was damaged. He drastically lowered the value of my phone from ‚Çπ5150 to ‚Çπ1700, which is absurd for a phone with 6GB RAM and a decent G95 chipset. After negotiating, I agreed to pay ‚Çπ3450 to get my phone back. The delivery guy asked me to pay the remaining exchange amount on his personal number, which raised my suspicions. I suspect he took my payment and sold my phone at a higher price. I didn't raise an issue since I just wanted my phone as soon as possible because i have a urgent work in Gurgaon.

Had no issues with Jio 5G, Bluetooth, WiFi, calling etc.Speakers are powerful to watch TMKOC, Crime Patrol, Shorts, Reels etc.I did face some gitters & hiccups on videos playback on YouTube with 1080p after August Security Patch that i updated on 8/15. title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Buy this phone only if you are on a tight budget of around Rs25000.
review_text: The phone's display is not upto the mark at least when compared with displays of Xiaomi phones with Dolby vision and 1.5k resolution.Cameras capture natural photos in daylight. 50+8 MP rear is ok. 16 mp front is decent too.Battery of 5500 mAh lasts for more than 6 hrs. 100 Watt charger that comes in the box, charges the phone from 0 to 100% in 31 minutes.  If you don't play games and are not a binge watcher, the battery can last longer and you won't have to charge frequently although it charges pretty fast.Storage of ufs 3.1 256 GB is good and because it has a hybrid simcard, we can put a memory card of upto 1 TB along with 1 sim card.Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 doesn't perform its best. The phone has hung a few times in the past and I had to restart the device once. Moderate gaming can be done easily.2160p videos stutter and do not play smoothly on YouTube.3.5 mm Headphone jack is missing.So, the only good thing about this phone is its 100W fast charging feature.Animations aren't smooth.Phone is light weight and easy to hold.You can buy phones like the Redmi Note 13 pro plus or Motorola Edge 50 pro if you can stretch the budget around above Rs 30000.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
After a week of usage.
review_text: Genuine Feedback on this phone after a week of using it.Pro :1. Phone has attractive design and colour.2. Android 14 experience is good.3. Camera is decent, depth pictures are also nornally fine.4. Sound quality is very good. Stereo works well on it.5. 256 GB + SD card option is a good option.6. Battery back up is very nice, in normal usage it went for 2 days straight without charging and took just 25 minutes approx to get full from 10%.Cons :1. Phone's back panel is pure plastic, something on which OnePlus really compromised considering the hefty price of 25999/- for middle user as this clearly gives very annoying experience after taking the phone in hand.2. Again OnePlus straight away compromised on this phone despite of high price is "Alert Slider" which is a flagship feature of OnePlus but they managed to take a cornor from it which is really a bad impact on me because I prefer only OnePlus over iPhone being a Android preferring person.3. Since I was a OP5t user and now using 7T (8/256) since Oct 2020, I can clearly experience processor difference in this phone as SD gen 7 system is something which is not as fast as SD 855+ which I m using and still my 7T is king over all these phones.4. While being connected to wifi, the normal calling is interrupting because of not clear voice going to the receiver. Had to switch off wifi and call again. (3 times experienced)5. Weight is little bit high of this phone (my 7T with cover Is lighter them this phone alone)6. Though bought it for the same price but after using it, I think the phone's price is high. The highest price should be anywhere between 20k to 22k.Verdict :Since in Android zone, I have only used OnePlus brand after switching from IOS in 2015 so not sure about other brands. But if you're keen to speed and perfection, try OnePlus other phones or else if you're a middle user then go for.Thanks

Charge drains quickly. But it's still negligible8. It heats up during charging9. Heats up with 3to 5 minutes Torch on10. No LED notification lights11. Boot up time is more. It takes approx 25 sec12. title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
OnePlus super mobile
review_text: I recently purchased the OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite, and it has truly exceeded my expectations, deserving a solid 5-star rating. Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown of why this phone is an excellent choice:Design and Build Quality: The OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite boasts a sleek, modern design with a premium feel. The materials used are top-notch, giving it a solid and durable build. Its slim profile and lightweight nature make it comfortable to hold and use for extended periods.Display: The phone features a stunning AMOLED display with vibrant colors and sharp resolution. Whether watching videos, playing games, or browsing the web, the visuals are crisp and clear. The high refresh rate adds to the smoothness of the experience, making every interaction buttery smooth.Performance: Powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 SoC, the OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite handles everything with ease. From multitasking to running graphic-intensive games, it performs without a hitch. While the processor might not be the latest, it still delivers reliable performance for daily use.Camera: The camera setup is impressive, especially the 50MP main sensor, which captures detailed and vibrant photos even in low light. The wide-angle lens adds versatility, allowing for creative shots. The video recording quality is also top-notch, with stable and clear footage. However, low-light photography could use some improvement.Battery Life: Battery life is outstanding, easily lasting a full day with moderate to heavy use. The 5,500mAh battery ensures you won‚Äôt run out of juice during the day. The fast charging feature is a lifesaver, allowing you to quickly top up the battery when needed.Additional Features: The phone has an official IP54 certification for protection against water splashes and dust. The design, inspired by minimalist tones and patterns, gives it a premium look. The 3.5mm audio jack is a bonus for wired earphone users.In conclusion, the OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite is an excellent smartphone in its price segment. Its design, display, performance, and battery life make it a worthy contender. While it could benefit from a newer processor and improved low-light camera performance, it still offers great value for money. For daily usage, the Nord CE 4 Lite will not disappoint.

Low light performance fantastic . But there are issues in moderately lit environment. Images attached for reference .Video quality is nice .Good battery life .Nice speaker sound quality .Microphone is sensitive .Charging is very fast .Good performance for games which are not resource hungry.Phone is quick for day to day usage .No heating issue .Cons :Display is very badtouch sensitive not as expected you need to touch 2 or 3 times for an action on the screen5500 battery is not as expected will have to keep wifi or data in off so to save battery till evening , My old 4000 mah in samsung was better battery performance than this 1+

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Visually striking but with poor GPU performance
review_text: Never buy a phone with Snapdragon 695 if you like to consume 4K video content.The processor of the Nord CE4 Lite 5G phone doesn't support 4 K video playback or recording and doesn't even support 4 K HDR on YouTube.I tried to play MAD MAX FURY ROAD (4K) using a VLC media player, and the video started lagging several times. The same video I played smoothly on my other phone, XIAOMI 11 LITE NE 5G. No issue at all.If you can ignore these cons, the phone is GREAT in terms of battery backup, visual appearance due to its AMOLED screen, refresh rate that you can change at will, and butter-like smoothness in navigating and using apps. Regarding bloatware, yes, they were aplenty but they are easily removable.Camera quality is also good if not very satisfactory considering the price. Since I am not a gamer, so, I can't tell you about gaming performance but based on its inbuilt processor's capabilities, I guess it can pretty much handle less GPU-intensive games like Call of Duty.About charging performance, let me tell you that at the time of switching on the phone and installing a few updates, the battery was around 50%. So, I charged it with its given charger, and within 16 minutes, the battery was fully charged. Therefore, I feel that the slow charging claim of this phone is theoretical and misleading.Beware that there has been huge marketing about the Nord CE 4 Lite 5G phone, calling it an excellent performer. Excellence depends on the user experience, not speculation.I am convinced that if you ignore the phone's processor, the rest of its features are good if you buy it under Rs15000. That's the only justifiable price I set for this phone based on my experience.

Camera is not very important for my mother as she rarely clicks pictures and if she will then the camera is good enough. Why I bought this phone over others is simply because it‚Äôs a one plus so brand value is much better than realme, oppo, vivo and others in the segment plus they have provided pre-applied screen guard, 80 watt adapter which alone would cost RS2500 and free oneplus Z2 bullet wireless earphones. All in all I believe it‚Äôs a good package and best for my mother‚Äôs regular usage. People looking for heavy gaming, top notch camera quality, and heavy usage should look elsewhere. Be willing to spend at least 40-50k. Samsung S23 or iphone 15 even iphone 13-14 will be good. I am an iphone 15 pro max user and can say all of the above with confidence.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Budget Beast!!!
review_text: To be honest, I was a bit skeptical in buying this product after seeing the mixed opinions on Amazon. However, I decided to place an order after watching few videos from reliable YouTubers. I was using a high end phone from Honor for the last 4 years and I decided to opt in for an affordable phone after the battery gave up on my earlier device.I must tell you that this is an amazing phone at this price point. You can throw any app and this device will handle it beautifully. I am not a gamer but tried playing few heavy games just to check if there's any lag or so and did not encounter any issues. Multitasking is breezy thanks to the RAM management. The biggest highlight is the amazing battery backup which goes on and on and on.. I would definitely recommend this phone to people who would be using the device for their day to day tasks. If you are looking at extensive gaming, you might want to check other reviews as I wouldn't be the right person to comment on the same.Please do not go by the negative reviews posted here as many people expect too many things from a budget phone. If you want a good phone that can handle all your basic requirements at an affordable price tag, I would highly recommend you this phone. Please ensure that you invest few hundreds on a good quality tempered glass and back cover as these things are not provided in the box. I hope this review would help few people in making a purchase decision.

While it has some limitations, such as average low-light camera performance and occasional lag with demanding apps, it remains a strong contender in the budget smartphone market.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Budget Beast!!!
review_text: To be honest, I was a bit skeptical in buying this product after seeing the mixed opinions on Amazon. However, I decided to place an order after watching few videos from reliable YouTubers. I was using a high end phone from Honor for the last 4 years and I decided to opt in for an affordable phone after the battery gave up on my earlier device.I must tell you that this is an amazing phone at this price point. You can throw any app and this device will handle it beautifully. I am not a gamer but tried playing few heavy games just to check if there's any lag or so and did not encounter any issues. Multitasking is breezy thanks to the RAM management. The biggest highlight is the amazing battery backup which goes on and on and on.. I would definitely recommend this phone to people who would be using the device for their day to day tasks. If you are looking at extensive gaming, you might want to check other reviews as I wouldn't be the right person to comment on the same.Please do not go by the negative reviews posted here as many people expect too many things from a budget phone. If you want a good phone that can handle all your basic requirements at an affordable price tag, I would highly recommend you this phone. Please ensure that you invest few hundreds on a good quality tempered glass and back cover as these things are not provided in the box. I hope this review would help few people in making a purchase decision.

While it has some limitations, such as average low-light camera performance and occasional lag with demanding apps, it remains a strong contender in the budget smartphone market.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Impressive design and economical pricing
review_text: Poco M6 Pro 5G (8GB/256GB) is an impressively cost effective phone using an Octacore 2.2 GHz Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor. Usage journey is summarised below for other users to optimise it for higher performance, battery efficiency & nil bloatware experience.Its a clear equivalent of Redmi 12 5G except NFC.  I saw many users write about it having ads and bloatware, issues with battery drain, etc.  These issues can be resolved to a great extent as I did.As soon as it was put on the network, it downloaded Xiaomi HyperOS1.0.1.0 UMWINXM, ANDROID 14.  The update was 4.4GB, took some time but the OS is as smooth as MIUI 14/ Android 13.Battery drain can be simply reduced by using the Battery saver mode.  Further, you require to fine tune on background apps and disable ads, remove recommendations to reduce irritation.  Camera is decent.  Processor performance is good, no lagging.  However, the famous quickball has been removed.  For those interested to still want it on the device, the apk has to be installed additionally. For me, I like that wonderful feature as it was a life saver in older Poco/ Redmi/ Mi phones when the Menu/ Home/ Back navigation panel failed.  With Quickball, my Redmi 3s is still working perfectly since last 7.5+ years.  So, I did load the quickball version 15.0.1.0.1 and being tested.POCO phones are always the beta for 'go to market' followed by the equivalent redmi versions.  I have been using POCO (F1, C3, M3) user for many years, are truely worth the money, good hardware.Many came with a 6000mAh battery but this one has 5000mAh battery.  The charger is fast (22.5W) but I prefer to slow charge the battery at night with a 5V/ 0.7A or 1A charger to improve the battery life, reduce the risk of battery bulging. It also reduces the risk of load on charger circuit due to lower charging current and no heat-up (Li-ion does not like heat, hence slow charging is safest), so battery and peripheral components remains safe and long lasting. The box came with its own transparent back-cover but I preferred a thicker back cover.Has a single Loudspeaker, hence lower audio volume.  But the Screen is bright, even 30% is good for normal use.The most important feature of Xiaomi is the backup and restore, making the new phone have the exact look of your old Xiaomi phone in less than 5 minutes, some apps may not get backed-up.Finally, Amazon delivery was on time.  Its just 4 days of testing and as of know I am satisfied.Update after a week of use- Though the download speed is good, the phone does not show 5G (JIO SIM) on its display (it shows 4G+). This is an important part to resolve, probably a patch may be necessary if at all this is a bug, since the service provider detects it as a 5G phone but the phone itself shows 4G+.  Requesting Xiaomi to validate my finding and close this accordingly.When the same SIM is put in another phone (Samsung/ IPhone), it shows 5G clearly. So this is an issue to be resolved by XIAOMI to prove that it is genuinely a 5G phone.No heating issue noticed after a week of use now.UPDATE 2:We can force the network setting to 5G through developer options as 'NR' in Set preferred network type.  But the battery drains drastically, hence avoid that.  So the phone is obviously 5G when network setting is forced.  Obviously all may not want to touch developer mode, so best to leave it as 5G/LTE in normal network settings.  If XIAOMI patches to augment the setting as NR only in addition to common settings, it can show up 5G on the display, but at the cost of high battery consumption.UPDATE 3 (16 April 2024):The legendary Xiaomi Quickball (apk version 15.0.1.0.1) has been tested and found to be working satisfactorily.  Post hardening of HyperOS, the phone is almost AD free.  Google loaded its own 'Messages' apk which will take control of the inbuilt  default 'Messaging' app  I have kept the Messaging app as default for messages as I dont want to use messages app of google for privacy control.  Battery being 5000mAH, is found to be lasting for 2 days with mobile data 'ON'.  A 6000mAH battery would have been better as found on many earlier POCO phones.  Quality of hardware is very good and performing.  With the new HyperOS 1.0.2.0 loaded, 2 years of formal updates makes it a an economical phone with good features.  Reminding all that ads-free performance can only be achieved after hardening through developer mode.  I havent used memory boost function, I dont think I will require it with a 8GB (uses LPDDR5) memory.  Only if needed, I will configure it.  I have also installed a 128 GB memory card, which virtually reduces internal memory usage.UPDATE 4 (18 April 2024):A bug is identified on HyperOS.  When Wifi calling is ON and Wifi is connected with a stable network, outgoing calls cannot be made.  Incoming calls also do not get through.  I have tested this multiple times.  Xiaomi has to immediately act and fix this bug.  Upon putting WiFi calling OFF, the phone resumes normally.  This problem did not exist on earlier MIUI used by me.Except this new bug identified and therefore stopping Wifi calling (actually stopping wifi calling has improved the battery life, so I dont mind not having this feature as JIO network does not have issues in our area and around), POCO M6 Pro 5G is a decent value for money.  Most positives, smaller negatives for a phone in 11-12k range.  Surely, Xiaomi should action it with a patch immediately.UPDATE 5.. Only for MIUI phone users, wont work for other phones (18 May 2024):When POCO M6 Pro is fully configured, take its backup using Additional Settings--> Backup and restore.  A backup file is generated in MIUI folder under AllBackup--> Backups--> Filename with backup date.  Simply copy that file and move it to your old Mi/ Redmi/ POCO phone (min. Android 10) in exacly the same folder.  Then restore that file.  While it will replicate the phone, you will get the benefit of the new look Control Centre.  The old MIUI Control Centre will be replaced by the new HyperOS Control Centre with no change to Android Version or security patch.  I liked this look and have retained the new HyperOS Control Center in my old POCO C3, which is a backup of the new phone (in case of exercising Disaster Recovery option). Its like the old Car in a new shell.  Havent had any issue on that since last 15 days of using the HyperOS Control Centre in the old POCO C3.  Others can enjoy too.UPDATE 6.. For 6 GB/ 128 GB Version (31 July 2024):I have also bought the 6 GB/ 128 GB variant.  Having hardened the HyperOS, this phone is almost a stock android like with nil bloatware.  The usage time has increased since the memory utilisation has reduced and with it, the battery lasts slightly longer as compared to the 8 GB/ 256 GB variant.  You would notice that Xiaomi has released the Poco M6 plus and Redmi 13 5g variant last month using the same processor by little overclocking (they call it accelarated or AE) to 2.3 GHz instead of 2.2 GHz,  adding a 120 Hz display and 108 MP camera, etc with 35% higher price for 6GB/ 128GB.  Well, I am contented with the M6Pro 5g's price to performance since frying the CPU may reduce its life.Regards..... AD

title:

Good product! Under 10k it's great! Not the best but top among the rest
review_text: I purchased it for my mum, the product is classy as I purchased the grey coloured one.Battery backup, stability all are good!Fingerprint sensor all works fine!According to the price it is a value for money!One thing you must consider while buying poco is that later on after 2.5yrs of age, the devices gets system issues,My personal phone is poco m3 now it's 3 yrs old, sometimes when I use it intensly till charge gets zero, the devices didn't charge when plugged, it takes charge after 12-15 hrs untill the CPU gets cool.So my advice never use poco mobiles untill zero % battery charge!Another drawback is that poco cameras , unlike Vivo, poco cameras are good in initial days (for the 1st yr) later it is worse! My poco m3 camera(48MP) is very bad to take photos now after 3 yrs. But my old Vivo(13MP) 7yr old phone still captures better photos.

title:

Company claims 1300 nits but I don't think it is more than 800 nits.BatteryIs very average, 30 mins of gaming and nearly 15% battery drops. The company claims it to be 5000 mah, but I'm sure it is not more than 4000 mah. It drops very quickly.Chargingis pretty good and faster. 30 mins of charging gives 30% battery life. But due to very low battery quality, you might need to charge it twice a day.The phone is lighter than majority of phones, and look wise it is more attractive.CameraIs the best part I liked the most. Any other phones don't have such camera quality at this price segment.Ram Rom performance is v.good and storage of 128gb is enough. With 6 gb Ram. This phone is ditto copy of Redmi 12, but that is at ‚Çπ12500, only difference is the branding. I suggest you to buy this one Poco m6 pro, which is way cheaper.Sound Quality is decent at this price. Rest all the features performs really well and I bought this at a discount @ ‚Çπ9999.I'm happy with this product for the price I paid.If you can afford ‚Çπ3000 than this range, then definitely go for some other options, because poco has boasted this product a lot. title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Who should buy or avoid it?
review_text: The POCO X6 5G is a mid-range smartphone that aims to deliver a flagship experience on a budget. Here's a breakdown of its pros and cons:Pros:Impressive Display: The 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and 1.5K resolution provides smooth scrolling and vibrant visuals, making it a standout feature in this price segment.Powerful Performance: The Snapdragon 7s Gen 2 chipset, coupled with 12GB RAM, handles everyday tasks, multitasking, and even gaming with ease.Ample Storage: The 512GB storage option ensures you have plenty of space for apps, photos, and videos.Long-lasting Battery: The 5100mAh battery offers excellent longevity, easily lasting a full day on moderate usage.Fast Charging: The included 67W charger juices up the battery rapidly, reaching a significant charge in just minutes.Feature-rich: The phone includes stereo speakers, an IR blaster, a 3.5mm headphone jack, and expandable storage via microSD.Software Experience: MIUI 14 based on Android 13 offers a feature-rich and customizable software experience.Cons:Camera Performance: While the 64MP main camera with OIS takes decent photos in good lighting, low-light performance could be better. The ultrawide and macro cameras are average.Build Quality: The plastic build, while not a dealbreaker, feels less premium than glass or metal alternatives.Bloatware: MIUI 14 comes with some pre-installed apps that some users might find unnecessary.Software Updates: POCO's track record with software updates isn't the best, so long-term support might be a concern.Overall:The POCO X6 5G offers exceptional value for its price, boasting a stunning display, powerful performance, and long-lasting battery life. While the camera and build quality could be improved, its strengths far outweigh its weaknesses, making it an excellent choice for budget-conscious consumers looking for a high-performing and feature-rich smartphone.Who should buy it?Those who prioritize display quality and performance.Users who need a long-lasting battery with fast charging.Anyone looking for a feature-packed phone on a budget.Who should avoid it?Photography enthusiasts who demand top-notch low-light camera performance.Users who prefer a more premium build material.Those who dislike heavily customized Android skins and prefer a cleaner software experience.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best & Beast in the segment
review_text: The POCO X6 5G (Mirror Black, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB Storage) is a standout mid-range smartphone. It features a sleek, premium design with a 6.67-inch Full HD+ AMOLED display, offering vibrant colors and smooth 120Hz refresh rates. Powered by the Snapdragon 778G, it handles multitasking and gaming effortlessly. The 64 MP primary camera performs well in good lighting but struggles slightly in low-light conditions. Its 5,000 mAh battery ensures all-day usage, and 67W fast charging is a bonus. Overall, the POCO X6 5G is an excellent choice for those seeking performance, style, and 5G connectivity at an affordable price.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Pretty good phone for the price
review_text: The performance is very good, it can emulate Pok√©mon X with very minimal stutters and CODM runs quite well too judging by the few games that I‚Äôve played. It‚Äôs not very heavy so it‚Äôs not too unwieldy but it‚Äôs size does cause issues as it‚Äôs too large to use one handed, it‚Äôll take some time to get used to since my last phone was a tiny iPhone 6.I don‚Äôt particularly care about photo quality so I don‚Äôt have much to say but I think the camera is quite good, definitely good enough for stuff like sending homework to friends and whatnot.The phone on Miui 14 did not heat up a lot while emulating Pokemon X but after upgrading to HyperOS it has started heating up enough to make my hands a little sweaty after an hour of playing and I‚Äôve also noticed more stutters and fps drops, not just in game but also in daily tasks like accessing the Notification Centre and the widgets area. So wouldn‚Äôt recommend upgrading to HyperOS rn as it seems to be poorly optimised, this is why I‚Äôm removing a star from the review.The battery life is good enough to not cause any issues in day to day use, the fast charging is quite, well, fast, it can charge up from 20 to 100 in less than an hour. The headphone jack is quite convenient to have since I don‚Äôt have to use a dongle to connect my headphones to the phone but it‚Äôs placement is rather annoying as it causes the upper part of the phone to become a little heavier.The phone did arrive with a LOT of bloatware tho, I‚Äôd recommend removing everything unnecessary using a software called Universal Android Debloater which is available on GitHub, but only do this after researching what is safe is remove and what isn‚Äôt as it‚Äôs easy to brick the phone by carelessly removing apps using UAD.TLDR : It‚Äôs a good phone in terms of emulation performance and battery life, on Miui 14 I did not notice any major performance issues or excessive heating but in HyperOS that changed and performance has decreased a little and the phone has started heating up faster.

Theya are justified the price.Battery also fine, I could understand the 120 refresh rate and 1.5k consumption is high so no issues.Build l, Stereo speakers, Headphone jack out, charging speeds all good.So they should bring back HDR capabilities otherwise... they already know about the market and competitors.

review_text: This phone has very good hw specifications for its price . but the provided charger is 67W which over heats phone to uncomfortable level to even hold it .  there is no option to disable fast charging on this phone . so I had to purchase a 20W charger to charge this phone without it getting overheated . another problem is that this phone is full of bloatware and personalization services and adds buried in every app . buy a moto g55 or g45 to get stock android  for same price .  given second choice i would have got a moto for same price  even though it has lcd and a slightly weaker processor . I wish poco gives a normal charger for budget phones , with poco phones exploding in internet i don't know why they give such high wattage overheating charger with this phone . overall good hardware, smooth software , full of bloatware  .

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone
review_text: I have been using various mobiles from apple 14 plus to samsung s22 ultra, I needed a spare phone which can perform well so I decided to go with Poco X6, my reviews for the sameProsExcellent battery backup, though fast charger takes 40 -50 mins to charge fully.The phone is very smooth to use, and i haven't had any heating issue.The 5g connectivity and wifi connectivity is solid and no drop till now (using airtel and jio sim)The performance works very fast for your basic usage.Camera is just above average, the main 64MP is good at daylight.ConsCamera could have been better, there is a night mode but yet no justification done, it's okay for the price range but that could have helped to get an edge over the competitors.Not for gamers, though it can handle games, we can clearly see a throttle and lag while playing higher end graphical games.Phones comes with MIUI interface but can be updated immediately to Hyper OS.It has only IP54 rating, so keep it carefully from hard water splashes.Final verdict : An excellent choice at this price range comapred to Vivo and Oppo for office use, networking and daily use.Will update after a months usage.

And they don't give any option to change fingerprint icon.7) charging speed: only one thing that i liked about poco x6 is charing speed it took 40-45 minutes from 0-100.8) Heating issue: yes poco x6 has heating issue.( And if you want my opinion on poco X6 so it is a decent phone but iam regretting to purchase it.)Funny fact it took me 2 min to complete poco x6 review and poco x6 drop 5 percentage battery really irritating .üò´üò´

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Good product
review_text: The Poco X6 Neo is a powerhouse that impresses with its blend of performance, design, and affordability. As an avid tech enthusiast, I've had the pleasure of putting this device through its paces, and it certainly exceeded my expectations.Firstly, let's talk about performance. The device is equipped with a Snapdragon processor, ensuring seamless multitasking and smooth gaming experiences. Coupled with ample RAM, it handles even the most demanding tasks with ease, without any noticeable lag.Design-wise, the Poco X6 Neo shines with its sleek and modern aesthetics. The stunning 6.67-inch AMOLED display delivers vibrant colors and deep blacks, perfect for binge-watching movies or playing games. The slim profile and ergonomic design make it comfortable to hold for extended periods.One of the standout features of the Poco X6 Neo is its camera setup. With a versatile quad-camera array, including a high-resolution main sensor and ultra-wide lens, it captures stunning photos in various lighting conditions. The AI-powered features further enhance the photography experience, delivering professional-looking shots with minimal effort.In conclusion, the Poco X6 Neo offers incredible value for money, packing top-notch features into an affordable package. Whether you're a gaming enthusiast, photography buff, or just someone looking for a reliable smartphone, this device ticks all the boxes. Highly¬†recommended!

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Great entry level phone
review_text: Honestly,I could have done a review on,when I bought.So I just decided to use and wait for few months to make informed and non biased response on this phone's usage, performance, quality, delivery, software etcAnd I am happy say,The phone is truly best one on entry level so far (maybe I am overhyping it but from samsung galaxy j7 prime (2016) to Realme 12x 5G (2024) is massive jump in user experience.The phone has good quality build, pair it with stock phone cover that comes with, it is enough if you are not accidentally dropping it , even then the phone willing not get easily damaged  like few high end phones .I like the whole phone appearance of it,even the design are great.but weight seems to be bit of issue in long usage. Battery life it depends on your usage patterns but I recommend you not go for 120hz 5g with max brightness as it will drain fast with slot uf active process in background,use 60hz or Adaptive refresh and 5g with 50% brightnessCharging is the fun part,I truly love how every phones are having fast charging even wireless charging as normal,it's so satisfying and fast now a days to quick your phone to 100 from 0 and which lask prolly a week as mid level usage makes phone last 2 days .Sound quality is ok I could say,it could been better but adding or improving in that tiny space is hard and I can understand that.I could say it's great value for money device for those who want phones under 15k .

I contacted Amazon. First, they appointed a technician for a home visit. He asked for the job pin on the call, which I denied. Then, a lady assured me that after two days, it would be replaced or returned, but nothing happened. Then again, I contacted Amazon, and they refused to replace or return it. Worst phone, worst service.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great choice under 20000 , excellent choice under 17000
review_text: Got this phone a week ago , and everything seems to be going smoothly so far . The phone is a great overall package with good cameras , powerful processor and a great multimedia expirence . For the price of under 17000 , there were no real life cons . The phone had a complete unboxing experience with a 67 watt charger , usb A-C cable , case , manual and the device itself . Although not a big issue but the cons that I faced in the device and found out by YouTube reviews are :1) camera stability - the phone supports 4k 30 fps video recording from the main camera and 1080p 30 fps from selfie camera . But while recording the stability of the phone is not great , specially when making videos while walking . The screen feels shaky and you'd have to be still or keep the phone in a stable surface to get best videos . Although it's not a huge issue and the unstability itself is minor , but for people who make videos often it could be irritating . I believe this might be fixed with software update , but still as of now it's an issue2) 4k video playback - while playing 4k videos , the videos are not playing smoothly , there are few jitters here and there but it's not a huge issue and may be fixed with software update as I feel the processor is capable of supporting smooth 4k playback .3) HDR color shifting - this is a problem that realme users have been facing for a long time in different devices , when playing a video the colours seem to shift a little when switching to HDR format . Although the colours are still great but it could be an issue for some . This issue. Could definitely be fixed by software update as the screen is capable of giving accurate colours in non HDR format , which means it's a software bug . Although we should also consider that it's been there for a while in a lot of realme devices , so it might not be fixed afterall .4) screen flickering - not something that I noticed myself yet , but an issue mentioned in a few youtube reviews I watched . The device does not has as good of an eye protection quality as other phones . The screen flickering isn't something that can be seen directly from a person's eye but could affect user experience in long terms . Due to screen flickering , the user's eyes could get tired quicker than usual which  could be a problem for long time users , specially those who use mobile in low light conditions like in night . I am not sure about this issue being fixed , as it could be an hardware problem .These were all the cons that I could detect and all of these are very minor issues that can be fixed with software update or could be worked around . The only reason I'm mentioning these is to keep the review as accurate as possible . As a student , I use the phone for casual gaming , multimedia and general usage . I feel like the mobile does an amazing job . It has great gaming specks for the price with support of  60 fps on bgmi and has HDR support (not on Netflix) the 5g connectivity is good and the downloading and streaming speeds are very good . A fast charging experience with 0 to 100 percent charge in under 45 minutes . It also has ufs 3.1 storage for better storage performance . Comes out of the box with Android 14 which is great with the promise of 2 years of major software updates and 3 years of security updates , which means you'd be able to experience a smooth and new experience for atleast 2 to 3 years .All these points make it a great choice for the price and unless you have a specific need from the device like high gaming performance then maybe check other deals out . But for me this phone is a 9 out of 10 overall package .

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent Value for Money with Impressive Performance!
review_text: I've been using the realme NARZO 70 Pro 5G for a few weeks now, and I must say, it's an impressive device for its price range.Pros:Performance: The MediaTek Dimensity 7050 5G chipset delivers smooth and fast performance. I haven't noticed any lag, even while playing demanding games or multitasking with several apps open.Display: The AMOLED display is vibrant with deep blacks and punchy colors. Animations look fluid.Battery Life: The 5000mAh battery easily lasts a full day with heavy usage. The 67W fast charging is a game-changer, taking the battery from 0 to 100% in just about 50 minutes.Camera: The primary camera takes sharp and detailed photos, especially in good lighting conditions. The night mode is also surprisingly effective. The front camera captures clear selfies.5G Connectivity: I tested the 5G connectivity, and it works flawlessly, offering fast internet speeds and low latency.Cons:Build Quality: While the phone looks sleek, the glass back is fragile and needs to be under cover all the time-hiding the beauty. It does feel as premium. A good case is a must to keep it protected.Bloatware: There are a few pre-installed apps that I don't find useful, but most can be uninstalled or disabled.Conclusion: The realme NARZO 70 Pro 5G offers excellent performance, a stunning display, and reliable 5G connectivity at an affordable price. It's a great option for anyone looking for a feature-packed smartphone without breaking the bank. Highly recommended!

review_text: Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G: Budget-Friendly PowerhouseThe Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G strikes a balance between affordability and features. It boasts a smooth 120Hz display, a long-lasting 5000mAh battery with speedy 67W fast charging, and the latest Android 14 software. Plus, it throws in a unique party trick: Air Gestures for touchless control.Highlights:1. Sharp and Smooth Display: Enjoy a vivid and responsive 120Hz display, perfect for and scrolling.2. Rain or Shine: The innovative Rainwater Smart Touch lets you use the phone even with wet hands or a damp screen.3. Daylight Photography: Capture clear photos with the 50MP SONY IMX890 OIS main camera in bright conditions.4. Fast Charging Champion: Power up quickly with 67W fast charging and never miss a beat.5. Classic Convenience: Keep your wired headphones plugged in with the 3.5mm jack, and control smart devices using the IR emitter.Room for Improvement:1. Low-Light Woes: Photos can suffer from noise and lack detail in low-light environments.2. Missing Features: Stream enthusiasts might miss HDR support on platforms like Netflix.3. Slippery Grip: The design might feel a little too smooth for some users.4. Air Gestures Need Work: This feature is a neat idea but needs refinement for consistent performance.The Verdict:The Narzo 70 Pro 5G is a solid mid-range option for budget-conscious users who prioritize display quality, battery life, and a unique touchless control feature. However, low-light camera performance and potential software glitches with the UI lag are downsides to consider which can be optimised through software update. If the Air Gestures are a deal-breaker, this phone might be the best fit. title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great choice under 20000 , excellent choice under 17000
review_text: Got this phone a week ago , and everything seems to be going smoothly so far . The phone is a great overall package with good cameras , powerful processor and a great multimedia expirence . For the price of under 17000 , there were no real life cons . The phone had a complete unboxing experience with a 67 watt charger , usb A-C cable , case , manual and the device itself . Although not a big issue but the cons that I faced in the device and found out by YouTube reviews are :1) camera stability - the phone supports 4k 30 fps video recording from the main camera and 1080p 30 fps from selfie camera . But while recording the stability of the phone is not great , specially when making videos while walking . The screen feels shaky and you'd have to be still or keep the phone in a stable surface to get best videos . Although it's not a huge issue and the unstability itself is minor , but for people who make videos often it could be irritating . I believe this might be fixed with software update , but still as of now it's an issue2) 4k video playback - while playing 4k videos , the videos are not playing smoothly , there are few jitters here and there but it's not a huge issue and may be fixed with software update as I feel the processor is capable of supporting smooth 4k playback .3) HDR color shifting - this is a problem that realme users have been facing for a long time in different devices , when playing a video the colours seem to shift a little when switching to HDR format . Although the colours are still great but it could be an issue for some . This issue. Could definitely be fixed by software update as the screen is capable of giving accurate colours in non HDR format , which means it's a software bug . Although we should also consider that it's been there for a while in a lot of realme devices , so it might not be fixed afterall .4) screen flickering - not something that I noticed myself yet , but an issue mentioned in a few youtube reviews I watched . The device does not has as good of an eye protection quality as other phones . The screen flickering isn't something that can be seen directly from a person's eye but could affect user experience in long terms . Due to screen flickering , the user's eyes could get tired quicker than usual which  could be a problem for long time users , specially those who use mobile in low light conditions like in night . I am not sure about this issue being fixed , as it could be an hardware problem .These were all the cons that I could detect and all of these are very minor issues that can be fixed with software update or could be worked around . The only reason I'm mentioning these is to keep the review as accurate as possible . As a student , I use the phone for casual gaming , multimedia and general usage . I feel like the mobile does an amazing job . It has great gaming specks for the price with support of  60 fps on bgmi and has HDR support (not on Netflix) the 5g connectivity is good and the downloading and streaming speeds are very good . A fast charging experience with 0 to 100 percent charge in under 45 minutes . It also has ufs 3.1 storage for better storage performance . Comes out of the box with Android 14 which is great with the promise of 2 years of major software updates and 3 years of security updates , which means you'd be able to experience a smooth and new experience for atleast 2 to 3 years .All these points make it a great choice for the price and unless you have a specific need from the device like high gaming performance then maybe check other deals out . But for me this phone is a 9 out of 10 overall package .

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent Value for Money with Impressive Performance!
review_text: I've been using the realme NARZO 70 Pro 5G for a few weeks now, and I must say, it's an impressive device for its price range.Pros:Performance: The MediaTek Dimensity 7050 5G chipset delivers smooth and fast performance. I haven't noticed any lag, even while playing demanding games or multitasking with several apps open.Display: The AMOLED display is vibrant with deep blacks and punchy colors. Animations look fluid.Battery Life: The 5000mAh battery easily lasts a full day with heavy usage. The 67W fast charging is a game-changer, taking the battery from 0 to 100% in just about 50 minutes.Camera: The primary camera takes sharp and detailed photos, especially in good lighting conditions. The night mode is also surprisingly effective. The front camera captures clear selfies.5G Connectivity: I tested the 5G connectivity, and it works flawlessly, offering fast internet speeds and low latency.Cons:Build Quality: While the phone looks sleek, the glass back is fragile and needs to be under cover all the time-hiding the beauty. It does feel as premium. A good case is a must to keep it protected.Bloatware: There are a few pre-installed apps that I don't find useful, but most can be uninstalled or disabled.Conclusion: The realme NARZO 70 Pro 5G offers excellent performance, a stunning display, and reliable 5G connectivity at an affordable price. It's a great option for anyone looking for a feature-packed smartphone without breaking the bank. Highly recommended!

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars

review_text: Camera perfomance is not good as expected. Low light perfomance is great. Camera doesn't give a detailed photo even in high resolution. Doesn't seem like 50mp even realme 2pro (16+2)mp camera gives a detailed picture. Photo of nearer object are great. Macro photo worst , totally waste 8 mp camera. Selfie camera very worst. 4k 30  fps only supports can't record a high resolution video smoothly.Struck occur on playing you tube 2160 p videos.Display is good. Super brightness. On the peak brightness in day time it gives pale colour image. Text are clear peak brightness good for basic use.Smooth perfomance.Heating problem arises slightly. Not much.Battery is good. Lasting for a day for a moderate use.Speaker are good Dolby support streo speakers. Not louder during phone call on speaker. But worthy..Design super.Network connectivity is awesome got 75+ mbps in my area.Gets slight warm during sometime.I don't know about gaming performance.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G: Budget-Friendly Powerhouse (‡§ï‡§Æ ‡§¨‡§ú‡§ü ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®)
review_text: Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G: Budget-Friendly PowerhouseThe Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G strikes a balance between affordability and features. It boasts a smooth 120Hz display, a long-lasting 5000mAh battery with speedy 67W fast charging, and the latest Android 14 software. Plus, it throws in a unique party trick: Air Gestures for touchless control.Highlights:1. Sharp and Smooth Display: Enjoy a vivid and responsive 120Hz display, perfect for and scrolling.2. Rain or Shine: The innovative Rainwater Smart Touch lets you use the phone even with wet hands or a damp screen.3. Daylight Photography: Capture clear photos with the 50MP SONY IMX890 OIS main camera in bright conditions.4. Fast Charging Champion: Power up quickly with 67W fast charging and never miss a beat.5. Classic Convenience: Keep your wired headphones plugged in with the 3.5mm jack, and control smart devices using the IR emitter.Room for Improvement:1. Low-Light Woes: Photos can suffer from noise and lack detail in low-light environments.2. Missing Features: Stream enthusiasts might miss HDR support on platforms like Netflix.3. Slippery Grip: The design might feel a little too smooth for some users.4. Air Gestures Need Work: This feature is a neat idea but needs refinement for consistent performance.The Verdict:The Narzo 70 Pro 5G is a solid mid-range option for budget-conscious users who prioritize display quality, battery life, and a unique touchless control feature. However, low-light camera performance and potential software glitches with the UI lag are downsides to consider which can be optimised through software update. If the Air Gestures are a deal-breaker, this phone might be the best fit. For those seeking a well-rounded performer at a competitive price, the Narzo 70 Pro 5G offers a compelling package.Realme Narzo 7G Pro 5G: ‡§ï‡§Æ ‡§¨‡§ú‡§ü ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§Æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞ review_text: Guys, if you're looking for a camera phone, just go for it nd don't ask questions... title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Nice Phone in this range
review_text: The Realme Narzo 70 Pro 5G stands out as a solid mid-range smartphone, especially for users looking for 5G capabilities without breaking the bank. Its strengths in display, performance, and battery life make it an attractive choice. However, potential buyers should weigh the cons, especially concerning camera performance and software experience. title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Superb.
review_text: Camera-9/10Without any doubt I can say that this phone has the best camera at the price range of 20k even better than iqoo z9 but selfie with night mode can be improved, otherwise the camera is perfect.Display-10/10The display is also excellent with 120 hz, Rain water touch and DCI-P3. The HDR content run smooth in my device but rarely it skips some frame. The display protection can be better like moto g64 which is cheaper than this offers gorilla glass 3 and poco x6 at the same price offers gorilla glass victus.Design 10/10 the design of this phone is very similar to that of iPhone. It feels premium in hands also is 195 gm but it doesn't feel like that.Performance - 9/10The performance of this device is also good in daily usage. But if you want a gaming phone under 20k then you should look for Iqoo z9. 1 have played games like cod, free fire and bgmi in this phone all runs smoothly even after 1 hr of constant gaming.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Realme Narzo 70 pro
review_text: The phone i bought on Amazon is really amazing and delivery of phone was really great I got my device on same day.The camera section of the phone is really good and the overall experience was great.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Overall Best Smartphone
review_text: Have been using this since a month, and everything is working so smoothly, the display touch is incredible, camera is detailed and after update its has more better quality, Ois is not working properly, weight is good because of glass back but it gives premium feeling, little bit of heating issue during Gaming but not too much, and phone doesn't hang even while using multiple apps, overall best in this price range.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Awesome Purchase below 17K
review_text: Using from last 07 days and below are the observations of the device1. It is an awesome phone in terms of storage, speed & camera (rear)2. Light in weight and High in specification3. Heavy Customization in this price range4. Charging Speed is simply superb - 31% to 77% in 20 Min - 67wt Charger5. Front Camera is also good but AI intervention is leading some unwanted effects.6. Rear Camera (Hi Resolution - Mode) with Flash is outstanding7. Video Recording - Dual Video Recording & 4K video recording are main key facts.8. Brightness is also its USP9. Color management is simply awesome10. Video on Youtube with wifi is just next level.11. Background remover is inbuilt feature of this phone and trust me it is also a killer feature with 99.99% of perfectionPurchased the same device for one of my friends as well.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Looks design performance
review_text: Some time Facing touch issue on lock screen ,otherwise phone is good ,amoled display is average  not as expected, performance is good ,larger display for movies , fast charging in 1hr 80% , for continuous usage have to charge 2 times a day otherwise regular normal usage it's perfect for lastlong a day, camera performance not at that hype but it's pretty good when u take a steady photos

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Battery is a Huge Disappointment
review_text: This phone is good enough in most cases. Pictures are quite decent in this price segment. Phone will be usable for the next 4 years easily if its battery survives. So the biggest disappointment is the battery life. Just using the phone normally with no gaming or photography drains the battery quickly. If you're outside and use your phone then you can expect around 5 hours of screen on time which is annoying as heck. The phone lost 1% battery while just writing this review. Realme has to do something about it in the updates or I will not recommend this phone to anyone.

title:

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Most Detailed Review of the Realme Narzo 70x 5G you should read
review_text: The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a new entry in the competitive mid-range smartphone market. Known for delivering good value for money, Realme‚Äôs Narzo series often balances features and affordability well. With a focus on performance, display quality, and connectivity, the Narzo 70x 5G aims to attract users looking for a capable device without breaking the bank. In this review, we will delve into its key aspects, including design, display, performance, camera quality, battery life, and connectivity.**Design and Build Quality**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G comes in a striking Forest Green color that gives it a premium look. The design is modern and sleek, with a clean finish that is visually appealing. The device features a plastic back and frame, which is standard for its price range, but it is well-built and feels sturdy in hand. The phone is lightweight and ergonomically designed, making it comfortable for prolonged use.The front of the phone is dominated by a 6.5-inch display with slim bezels, and the rear houses a triple camera setup housed within a rectangular module. While the design is not particularly groundbreaking, it is functional and attractive for a mid-range device.**Display**One of the standout features of the Narzo 70x 5G is its 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display. This high refresh rate ensures smoother animations, improved responsiveness, and an overall more fluid visual experience. For users who enjoy gaming or frequently scroll through content, this feature can significantly enhance usability.The display itself is a 6.5-inch IPS LCD panel with Full HD+ resolution. It offers vibrant colors and decent brightness levels, making it suitable for most indoor and outdoor conditions. While it may not match the brightness and contrast ratIOS of high-end OLED panels, it is more than adequate for daily tasks, media consumption, and casual gaming.**Performance**Under the hood, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This 6nm processor is designed to handle 5G connectivity and deliver a smooth performance for mid-range devices. Coupled with 8GB of RAM, the phone manages multitasking with ease, and app launches are swift.In everyday use, the Narzo 70x 5G performs well, handling tasks such as web browsing, social media, and video streaming without significant hiccups. For gaming, the device is capable of running popular titles at medium to high settings, though demanding games might require reduced graphics settings for optimal performance.The inclusion of 128GB of internal storage provides ample space for apps, media, and files. For users who need more storage, the Narzo 70x also supports expandable storage via a microSD card slot, which adds flexibility for managing large files.**Camera Performance**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G features a triple camera setup on the rear, consisting of a 50MP primary sensor, a 2MP macro lens, and a 2MP depth sensor. The main 50MP camera performs well in various lighting conditions, capturing sharp and detailed images. The AI enhancements help in optimizing colors and improving photo quality, making the camera versatile for different shooting scenarIOS.The macro lens is useful for close-up shots, though it can sometimes struggle with focus and detail in low light. The depth sensor aids in creating bokeh effects for portrait shots, and while it works effectively, the results may not be as refined as those from higher-end devices.On the front, the Narzo 70x 5G sports a 16MP selfie camera that delivers good quality selfies. The camera app includes various modes and filters to enhance the user experience, and it performs admirably for social media and video calls.**Battery Life**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is equipped with a 5000mAh battery, which is a generous capacity for a mid-range phone. Combined with the efficient Dimensity 6100+ processor and the 120Hz display, the battery life is commendable. Users can expect a full day of moderate to heavy use, including web browsing, media consumption, and occasional gaming.The phone also comes with a 45W fast charger in the box, which is a significant advantage. The fast charging feature allows the device to quickly regain power, minimizing downtime and ensuring that users can get back to using their phone without extended waits.**Connectivity and Software**As the name suggests, the Narzo 70x 5G supports 5G connectivity, providing future-proofing for users looking to take advantage of the latest network technology. The device also includes other connectivity options such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.1, and GPS.On the software front, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G runs on Realme UI, based on Android. The interface is user-friendly and includes various customization options, enhancing the overall user experience. However, the phone does come with some pre-installed bloatware, which may not be necessary for all users.**Positive Aspects**1. **High Refresh Rate Display**: The 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display enhances the overall visual experience, providing fluid animations and smoother interactions.2. **Solid Performance**: The Dimensity 6100+ chipset, combined with 8GB of RAM, ensures smooth performance for everyday tasks and moderate gaming.3. **Good Battery Life**: The 5000mAh battery, along with 45W fast charging, offers long-lasting usage and quick recharging.4. **Expandable Storage**: The option to expand storage via microSD adds flexibility for managing files and media.5. **Attractive Design**: The Forest Green color and sleek design give the phone a premium feel, despite its plastic construction.**Negative Aspects**1. **Average Display Quality**: While the 120Hz refresh rate is a highlight, the display‚Äôs overall quality is typical for an IPS LCD and may not match the vibrant contrast of OLED screens.2. **Camera Performance**: While the 50MP main camera is competent, the additional sensors (macro and depth) may not provide significant improvements and can struggle in low light conditions.3. **Bloatware**: The pre-installed apps on Realme UI might not be useful for all users and can clutter the interface.4. **Plastic Build**: The use of plastic for the back and frame, while common in this price range, might not feel as premium as glass or metal alternatives.**Conclusion**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a well-rounded smartphone that offers a range of features catering to the mid-range market segment. Its 120Hz display, solid performance, and good battery life make it a competitive option. However, some limitations in display quality, camera performance, and bloatware should be considered. For users seeking a balance of performance and value, the Narzo 70x 5G is a strong contender, though it may not meet the needs of those looking for a high-end experience.

review_text: This phone delivers solid performance for its price range. The overall performance is smooth, though there can be occasional lags. Thankfully, there are no heating issues, even with heavy use.The camera quality is decent, but I did expect a bit more in terms of rear camera clarity. However, the front camera features are fantastic, perfect for selfies.Appearance-wise, I got the forest green color, and it looks stunning! It‚Äôs sleek, modern, and definitely stands out.One downside is the air gestures. They simply don't work. While the phone offers a few gesture-based features, none of them function as expected.The battery life is impressive. It easily lasts a full day, even with around 6-7 hours of continuous use. The phone's size is also spot on‚Äîcomfortable to hold and carry around.Overall, for its price, this phone is one of the best budget options available, despite a few minor flaws.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good looking phone
review_text: Bought this phone yesterday. And thought I'd write a review to help others make a wise decision regarding the phones in the current market.Looks: 5/5The phone is slim and feels really good in the hands. Loved the camera bulge as well.Accessories: 5/5Comes with a screen cover, a phone cover and a 45 w adapter, something you won't get with a Samsung phone. Saved me around 2,000 rupees in accessories alone.Battery and Charger: 4/5The battery is good, seems to last long, however the charging speed is awful for a 45 w charger. My Samsung used to charge at a better speed with a 18 w charger. I highly doubt that this phone charges at 45 w. Felt like 18w charging speed in my honest opinion. I'm not happy with the charging speed.Touch: 3/5When I'm typing, I can feel the touch isn't great. Have to press on a key twice or thrice sometimes. But then I had a similar experience with my friend's mid range Redmi as well. These budget phones don't have a great touch quality. Samsung provides better touch in this price range.Finger print sensor: 4/5It doesn't open at once as soon as u touch the side button. You have to PRESS the button on order for the finger print sensor to work. Something that I didn't face an issue with when I had Samsung M15Camera: 4/5The rear camera takes good pics keeping this price range in mind. The front camera comes with an in built beauty mode that brightens faces. For this price range I'd say the camera does a good job.Performance: 5/5I haven't faced any lags yet on my 8 GB ram version. I'd suggest to go for 8 GB ram for smooth functions. Anything lower than this will create problems.Voice quality: 4/5I felt like my Samsung M15 had better voice quality than this phone, but still it does an alright job.Display: 4/5Comes with an lcd screen, not amoled which might not be great, but still it does a decent job. At least the risk of developing green lines in LCD screen is low.Bloatware: 5/5Comes with in built Glance app and other useless apps. But on the bright side you can easily uninstall these bloatwares. I disabled my Glance app as well and now not facing any issues with Bloatwares. REMEMBER, other phones in this range do not come with an option to disable the Glance app and some other bloatwares.Overall: I got this phone at 13.5k, and with 8 GB of ram this phone hasn't disappointed me yet. I'd say this phone is the best option in this price range. Go for it if u listen to me. Samsung phones will cost u 2,000 extra as they don't come with any accessories.

Value for Money with Some Impressive Features
review_text: I recently bought the Realme 70x 5G during the Great Indian Sale, and after using it for a while, I must say I‚Äôm quite impressed! The phone comes with a fantastic FHD+ display, which makes watching videos and browsing a great experience. One of the best parts is that it includes a charger in the box, and the fast charging feature is really efficient ‚Äì it charges 50% in just about 35 minutes.There are some pre-installed apps (bloatware), but they can be easily removed, so it‚Äôs not a big issue. The gesture mode is a bit of a hit-and-miss, but overall, the phone has many features that don‚Äôt get much publicity. For example, you can increase the phone‚Äôs RAM in the settings, which is a neat feature, and there‚Äôs a cool iPhone-like toggle near the camera.As for the camera, it‚Äôs decent ‚Äì nothing spectacular, but it gets the job done. Overall, this phone is packed with value for its price. Let's see how it works in the future
