title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Most Detailed Review of the Realme Narzo 70x 5G you should read
review_text: The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a new entry in the competitive mid-range smartphone market. Known for delivering good value for money, Realme‚Äôs Narzo series often balances features and affordability well. With a focus on performance, display quality, and connectivity, the Narzo 70x 5G aims to attract users looking for a capable device without breaking the bank. In this review, we will delve into its key aspects, including design, display, performance, camera quality, battery life, and connectivity.**Design and Build Quality**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G comes in a striking Forest Green color that gives it a premium look. The design is modern and sleek, with a clean finish that is visually appealing. The device features a plastic back and frame, which is standard for its price range, but it is well-built and feels sturdy in hand. The phone is lightweight and ergonomically designed, making it comfortable for prolonged use.The front of the phone is dominated by a 6.5-inch display with slim bezels, and the rear houses a triple camera setup housed within a rectangular module. While the design is not particularly groundbreaking, it is functional and attractive for a mid-range device.**Display**One of the standout features of the Narzo 70x 5G is its 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display. This high refresh rate ensures smoother animations, improved responsiveness, and an overall more fluid visual experience. For users who enjoy gaming or frequently scroll through content, this feature can significantly enhance usability.The display itself is a 6.5-inch IPS LCD panel with Full HD+ resolution. It offers vibrant colors and decent brightness levels, making it suitable for most indoor and outdoor conditions. While it may not match the brightness and contrast ratIOS of high-end OLED panels, it is more than adequate for daily tasks, media consumption, and casual gaming.**Performance**Under the hood, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This 6nm processor is designed to handle 5G connectivity and deliver a smooth performance for mid-range devices. Coupled with 8GB of RAM, the phone manages multitasking with ease, and app launches are swift.In everyday use, the Narzo 70x 5G performs well, handling tasks such as web browsing, social media, and video streaming without significant hiccups. For gaming, the device is capable of running popular titles at medium to high settings, though demanding games might require reduced graphics settings for optimal performance.The inclusion of 128GB of internal storage provides ample space for apps, media, and files. For users who need more storage, the Narzo 70x also supports expandable storage via a microSD card slot, which adds flexibility for managing large files.**Camera Performance**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G features a triple camera setup on the rear, consisting of a 50MP primary sensor, a 2MP macro lens, and a 2MP depth sensor. The main 50MP camera performs well in various lighting conditions, capturing sharp and detailed images. The AI enhancements help in optimizing colors and improving photo quality, making the camera versatile for different shooting scenarIOS.The macro lens is useful for close-up shots, though it can sometimes struggle with focus and detail in low light. The depth sensor aids in creating bokeh effects for portrait shots, and while it works effectively, the results may not be as refined as those from higher-end devices.On the front, the Narzo 70x 5G sports a 16MP selfie camera that delivers good quality selfies. The camera app includes various modes and filters to enhance the user experience, and it performs admirably for social media and video calls.**Battery Life**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is equipped with a 5000mAh battery, which is a generous capacity for a mid-range phone. Combined with the efficient Dimensity 6100+ processor and the 120Hz display, the battery life is commendable. Users can expect a full day of moderate to heavy use, including web browsing, media consumption, and occasional gaming.The phone also comes with a 45W fast charger in the box, which is a significant advantage. The fast charging feature allows the device to quickly regain power, minimizing downtime and ensuring that users can get back to using their phone without extended waits.**Connectivity and Software**As the name suggests, the Narzo 70x 5G supports 5G connectivity, providing future-proofing for users looking to take advantage of the latest network technology. The device also includes other connectivity options such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.1, and GPS.On the software front, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G runs on Realme UI, based on Android. The interface is user-friendly and includes various customization options, enhancing the overall user experience. However, the phone does come with some pre-installed bloatware, which may not be necessary for all users.**Positive Aspects**1. **High Refresh Rate Display**: The 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display enhances the overall visual experience, providing fluid animations and smoother interactions.2. **Solid Performance**: The Dimensity 6100+ chipset, combined with 8GB of RAM, ensures smooth performance for everyday tasks and moderate gaming.3. **Good Battery Life**: The 5000mAh battery, along with 45W fast charging, offers long-lasting usage and quick recharging.4. **Expandable Storage**: The option to expand storage via microSD adds flexibility for managing files and media.5. **Attractive Design**: The Forest Green color and sleek design give the phone a premium feel, despite its plastic construction.**Negative Aspects**1. **Average Display Quality**: While the 120Hz refresh rate is a highlight, the display‚Äôs overall quality is typical for an IPS LCD and may not match the vibrant contrast of OLED screens.2. **Camera Performance**: While the 50MP main camera is competent, the additional sensors (macro and depth) may not provide significant improvements and can struggle in low light conditions.3. **Bloatware**: The pre-installed apps on Realme UI might not be useful for all users and can clutter the interface.4. **Plastic Build**: The use of plastic for the back and frame, while common in this price range, might not feel as premium as glass or metal alternatives.**Conclusion**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a well-rounded smartphone that offers a range of features catering to the mid-range market segment. Its 120Hz display, solid performance, and good battery life make it a competitive option. However, some limitations in display quality, camera performance, and bloatware should be considered. For users seeking a balance of performance and value, the Narzo 70x 5G is a strong contender, though it may not meet the needs of those looking for a high-end experience.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good looking phone
review_text: Bought this phone yesterday. And thought I'd write a review to help others make a wise decision regarding the phones in the current market.Looks: 5/5The phone is slim and feels really good in the hands. Loved the camera bulge as well.Accessories: 5/5Comes with a screen cover, a phone cover and a 45 w adapter, something you won't get with a Samsung phone. Saved me around 2,000 rupees in accessories alone.Battery and Charger: 4/5The battery is good, seems to last long, however the charging speed is awful for a 45 w charger. My Samsung used to charge at a better speed with a 18 w charger. I highly doubt that this phone charges at 45 w. Felt like 18w charging speed in my honest opinion. I'm not happy with the charging speed.Touch: 3/5When I'm typing, I can feel the touch isn't great. Have to press on a key twice or thrice sometimes. But then I had a similar experience with my friend's mid range Redmi as well. These budget phones don't have a great touch quality. Samsung provides better touch in this price range.Finger print sensor: 4/5It doesn't open at once as soon as u touch the side button. You have to PRESS the button on order for the finger print sensor to work. Something that I didn't face an issue with when I had Samsung M15Camera: 4/5The rear camera takes good pics keeping this price range in mind. The front camera comes with an in built beauty mode that brightens faces. For this price range I'd say the camera does a good job.Performance: 5/5I haven't faced any lags yet on my 8 GB ram version. I'd suggest to go for 8 GB ram for smooth functions. Anything lower than this will create problems.Voice quality: 4/5I felt like my Samsung M15 had better voice quality than this phone, but still it does an alright job.Display: 4/5Comes with an lcd screen, not amoled which might not be great, but still it does a decent job. At least the risk of developing green lines in LCD screen is low.Bloatware: 5/5Comes with in built Glance app and other useless apps. But on the bright side you can easily uninstall these bloatwares. I disabled my Glance app as well and now not facing any issues with Bloatwares. REMEMBER, other phones in this range do not come with an option to disable the Glance app and some other bloatwares.Overall: I got this phone at 13.5k, and with 8 GB of ram this phone hasn't disappointed me yet. I'd say this phone is the best option in this price range. Go for it if u listen to me. Samsung phones will cost u 2,000 extra as they don't come with any accessories.

Value for Money with Some Impressive Features
review_text: I recently bought the Realme 70x 5G during the Great Indian Sale, and after using it for a while, I must say I‚Äôm quite impressed! The phone comes with a fantastic FHD+ display, which makes watching videos and browsing a great experience. One of the best parts is that it includes a charger in the box, and the fast charging feature is really efficient ‚Äì it charges 50% in just about 35 minutes.There are some pre-installed apps (bloatware), but they can be easily removed, so it‚Äôs not a big issue. The gesture mode is a bit of a hit-and-miss, but overall, the phone has many features that don‚Äôt get much publicity. For example, you can increase the phone‚Äôs RAM in the settings, which is a neat feature, and there‚Äôs a cool iPhone-like toggle near the camera.As for the camera, it‚Äôs decent ‚Äì nothing spectacular, but it gets the job done. Overall, this phone is packed with value for its price. Let's see how it works in the future

product_name: Realme NARZO 70x 5G (Ice Blue, 6GB RAM,128GB Storage)|120Hz Ultra Smooth Display|Dimensity 6100+ 6nm 5G|50MP AI Camera
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Most Detailed Review of the Realme Narzo 70x 5G you should read
review_text: The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a new entry in the competitive mid-range smartphone market. Known for delivering good value for money, Realme‚Äôs Narzo series often balances features and affordability well. With a focus on performance, display quality, and connectivity, the Narzo 70x 5G aims to attract users looking for a capable device without breaking the bank. In this review, we will delve into its key aspects, including design, display, performance, camera quality, battery life, and connectivity.**Design and Build Quality**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G comes in a striking Forest Green color that gives it a premium look. The design is modern and sleek, with a clean finish that is visually appealing. The device features a plastic back and frame, which is standard for its price range, but it is well-built and feels sturdy in hand. The phone is lightweight and ergonomically designed, making it comfortable for prolonged use.The front of the phone is dominated by a 6.5-inch display with slim bezels, and the rear houses a triple camera setup housed within a rectangular module. While the design is not particularly groundbreaking, it is functional and attractive for a mid-range device.**Display**One of the standout features of the Narzo 70x 5G is its 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display. This high refresh rate ensures smoother animations, improved responsiveness, and an overall more fluid visual experience. For users who enjoy gaming or frequently scroll through content, this feature can significantly enhance usability.The display itself is a 6.5-inch IPS LCD panel with Full HD+ resolution. It offers vibrant colors and decent brightness levels, making it suitable for most indoor and outdoor conditions. While it may not match the brightness and contrast ratIOS of high-end OLED panels, it is more than adequate for daily tasks, media consumption, and casual gaming.**Performance**Under the hood, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ chipset. This 6nm processor is designed to handle 5G connectivity and deliver a smooth performance for mid-range devices. Coupled with 8GB of RAM, the phone manages multitasking with ease, and app launches are swift.In everyday use, the Narzo 70x 5G performs well, handling tasks such as web browsing, social media, and video streaming without significant hiccups. For gaming, the device is capable of running popular titles at medium to high settings, though demanding games might require reduced graphics settings for optimal performance.The inclusion of 128GB of internal storage provides ample space for apps, media, and files. For users who need more storage, the Narzo 70x also supports expandable storage via a microSD card slot, which adds flexibility for managing large files.**Camera Performance**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G features a triple camera setup on the rear, consisting of a 50MP primary sensor, a 2MP macro lens, and a 2MP depth sensor. The main 50MP camera performs well in various lighting conditions, capturing sharp and detailed images. The AI enhancements help in optimizing colors and improving photo quality, making the camera versatile for different shooting scenarIOS.The macro lens is useful for close-up shots, though it can sometimes struggle with focus and detail in low light. The depth sensor aids in creating bokeh effects for portrait shots, and while it works effectively, the results may not be as refined as those from higher-end devices.On the front, the Narzo 70x 5G sports a 16MP selfie camera that delivers good quality selfies. The camera app includes various modes and filters to enhance the user experience, and it performs admirably for social media and video calls.**Battery Life**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is equipped with a 5000mAh battery, which is a generous capacity for a mid-range phone. Combined with the efficient Dimensity 6100+ processor and the 120Hz display, the battery life is commendable. Users can expect a full day of moderate to heavy use, including web browsing, media consumption, and occasional gaming.The phone also comes with a 45W fast charger in the box, which is a significant advantage. The fast charging feature allows the device to quickly regain power, minimizing downtime and ensuring that users can get back to using their phone without extended waits.**Connectivity and Software**As the name suggests, the Narzo 70x 5G supports 5G connectivity, providing future-proofing for users looking to take advantage of the latest network technology. The device also includes other connectivity options such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 5.1, and GPS.On the software front, the Realme Narzo 70x 5G runs on Realme UI, based on Android. The interface is user-friendly and includes various customization options, enhancing the overall user experience. However, the phone does come with some pre-installed bloatware, which may not be necessary for all users.**Positive Aspects**1. **High Refresh Rate Display**: The 120Hz Ultra Smooth Display enhances the overall visual experience, providing fluid animations and smoother interactions.2. **Solid Performance**: The Dimensity 6100+ chipset, combined with 8GB of RAM, ensures smooth performance for everyday tasks and moderate gaming.3. **Good Battery Life**: The 5000mAh battery, along with 45W fast charging, offers long-lasting usage and quick recharging.4. **Expandable Storage**: The option to expand storage via microSD adds flexibility for managing files and media.5. **Attractive Design**: The Forest Green color and sleek design give the phone a premium feel, despite its plastic construction.**Negative Aspects**1. **Average Display Quality**: While the 120Hz refresh rate is a highlight, the display‚Äôs overall quality is typical for an IPS LCD and may not match the vibrant contrast of OLED screens.2. **Camera Performance**: While the 50MP main camera is competent, the additional sensors (macro and depth) may not provide significant improvements and can struggle in low light conditions.3. **Bloatware**: The pre-installed apps on Realme UI might not be useful for all users and can clutter the interface.4. **Plastic Build**: The use of plastic for the back and frame, while common in this price range, might not feel as premium as glass or metal alternatives.**Conclusion**The Realme Narzo 70x 5G is a well-rounded smartphone that offers a range of features catering to the mid-range market segment. Its 120Hz display, solid performance, and good battery life make it a competitive option. However, some limitations in display quality, camera performance, and bloatware should be considered. For users seeking a balance of performance and value, the Narzo 70x 5G is a strong contender, though it may not meet the needs of those looking for a high-end experience.

product_name: Realme NARZO 70x 5G (Ice Blue, 6GB RAM,128GB Storage)|120Hz Ultra Smooth Display|Dimensity 6100+ 6nm 5G|50MP AI Camera
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good choice for 12k
review_text: This phone delivers solid performance for its price range. The overall performance is smooth, though there can be occasional lags. Thankfully, there are no heating issues, even with heavy use.The camera quality is decent, but I did expect a bit more in terms of rear camera clarity. However, the front camera features are fantastic, perfect for selfies.Appearance-wise, I got the forest green color, and it looks stunning! It‚Äôs sleek, modern, and definitely stands out.One downside is the air gestures. They simply don't work. While the phone offers a few gesture-based features, none of them function as expected.The battery life is impressive. It easily lasts a full day, even with around 6-7 hours of continuous use. The phone's size is also spot on‚Äîcomfortable to hold and carry around.Overall, for its price, this phone is one of the best budget options available, despite a few minor flaws.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Camera is average .
review_text: Bought this around June 1st . Charging is good , battery backup is good , user interface is good . No heating issues so far. Camera is average, the photos I took are good but when I want to take photos in my room where light is not too much , that's where the camera sucks , front camera sucks too, not many features on camera video recording is also bad. product_name: Realme NARZO 70x 5G (Ice Blue, 6GB RAM,128GB Storage)|120Hz Ultra Smooth Display|Dimensity 6100+ 6nm 5G|50MP AI Camera
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good looking phone
review_text: Bought this phone yesterday. And thought I'd write a review to help others make a wise decision regarding the phones in the current market.Looks: 5/5The phone is slim and feels really good in the hands. Loved the camera bulge as well.Accessories: 5/5Comes with a screen cover, a phone cover and a 45 w adapter, something you won't get with a Samsung phone. Saved me around 2,000 rupees in accessories alone.Battery and Charger: 4/5The battery is good, seems to last long, however the charging speed is awful for a 45 w charger. My Samsung used to charge at a better speed with a 18 w charger. I highly doubt that this phone charges at 45 w. Felt like 18w charging speed in my honest opinion. I'm not happy with the charging speed.Touch: 3/5When I'm typing, I can feel the touch isn't great. Have to press on a key twice or thrice sometimes. But then I had a similar experience with my friend's mid range Redmi as well. These budget phones don't have a great touch quality. Samsung provides better touch in this price range.Finger print sensor: 4/5It doesn't open at once as soon as u touch the side button. You have to PRESS the button on order for the finger print sensor to work. Something that I didn't face an issue with when I had Samsung M15Camera: 4/5The rear camera takes good pics keeping this price range in mind. The front camera comes with an in built beauty mode that brightens faces. For this price range I'd say the camera does a good job.Performance: 5/5I haven't faced any lags yet on my 8 GB ram version. I'd suggest to go for 8 GB ram for smooth functions. Anything lower than this will create problems.Voice quality: 4/5I felt like my Samsung M15 had better voice quality than this phone, but still it does an alright job.Display: 4/5Comes with an lcd screen, not amoled which might not be great, but still it does a decent job. At least the risk of developing green lines in LCD screen is low.Bloatware: 5/5Comes with in built Glance app and other useless apps. But on the bright side you can easily uninstall these bloatwares. I disabled my Glance app as well and now not facing any issues with Bloatwares. REMEMBER, other phones in this range do not come with an option to disable the Glance app and some other bloatwares.Overall: I got this phone at 13.5k, and with 8 GB of ram this phone hasn't disappointed me yet. I'd say this phone is the best option in this price range. Go for it if u listen to me. Samsung phones will cost u 2,000 extra as they don't come with any accessories.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money with Some Impressive Features
review_text: I recently bought the Realme 70x 5G during the Great Indian Sale, and after using it for a while, I must say I‚Äôm quite impressed! The phone comes with a fantastic FHD+ display, which makes watching videos and browsing a great experience. One of the best parts is that it includes a charger in the box, and the fast charging feature is really efficient ‚Äì it charges 50% in just about 35 minutes.There are some pre-installed apps (bloatware), but they can be easily removed, so it‚Äôs not a big issue. The gesture mode is a bit of a hit-and-miss, but overall, the phone has many features that don‚Äôt get much publicity. For example, you can increase the phone‚Äôs RAM in the settings, which is a neat feature, and there‚Äôs a cool iPhone-like toggle near the camera.As for the camera, it‚Äôs decent ‚Äì nothing spectacular, but it gets the job done. Overall, this phone is packed with value for its price. Let's see how it works in the future

Most budgeted phone with best features
review_text: The Realme Narzo N65 5G is an impressive smartphone that offers exceptional value for its price. Its sleek design and vibrant display make for an engaging user experience, while the 5G capability ensures fast and reliable connectivity.The performance is noteworthy, thanks to its powerful processor and ample RAM, which handle multitasking and gaming with ease. The camera setup delivers stunning photos, especially in well-lit conditions, capturing details and colors beautifully.Battery life is another strong point, lasting all day even with heavy usage. The device also features fast charging, minimizing downtime. Overall, the Realme Narzo N65 5G stands out as a solid choice for anyone looking for a feature-rich smartphone without breaking the bank. Highly recommended!

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone at a reasonable price.
review_text: I was in search of a mobile phone for my parents and was initially hesitant to purchase this one, as I had no prior experience with the Narzo series. Despite my concerns, I decided to go ahead with the purchase because the price was reasonable, and the specifications seemed promising.After using the phone for a few days, I am pleased with my decision. The mobile not only looks sleek but is also comfortable to hold. It comes with the latest Android version, and the display quality is surprisingly good for a phone in this price range. The battery life is decent, lasting comfortably throughout the day with regular usage. The performance is smooth, with no noticeable lag while switching between apps or browsing. My parents also found it easy to use, which is a big plus.Overall, it's been a positive buying experience, and if you're looking for a reliable phone in the ‚Çπ10,000-‚Çπ11,000 range, I would definitely recommend giving this one a try. I'll be sure to update my review after a few months of usage to see how it holds up in the long run.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars

review_text: Good looking, Good sound,Comes with enough 128gb memory,No hanging issue, Good purchase @10248 in great Indian festival, Good camera quality,Brightness is the main issue as brightness is not like other mobile devices, Regarding heating issue it's get heating while charging, Charger is provided 15w so it takes more time to charge as it's not a fast charging phone pl.note, Else Okay product.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great Performance & Camera for Everyday use
review_text: I needed a phone with good camera, good performance and strong 5G network connectivity within a small budget for my 19yo who is in college now.Not intended for Gaming so a lower RAM was ok.After going through several reviews this seemed to be a good phone that checked all the boxes. Incidentally had a Realme 1 for exchange and got good value for that as well.Package arrived in perfect shape and the delivery person was patient and courteous.Phone setup was smooth and have been using for 2 months now.Build quality 5/5 - phone feels premium like it is from a segment above. love the matte green colour and finishDisplay 4/5 quality is good for the price and its great phone for everyday use.5G Network connectivity 5/5 - top-notchPerformance 5/5 - fantastic for general tasks and doesnt lagAndroid 14 OS - 5/5 - out of the box android 14 - can expect two more version updatesBattery 5/5 - very efficient and easily lasts for two days for my usage.Icing on the cake was additional 6 months complimentary warranty from RealmeWill definitely recommend for someone looking for no-nonsense built-to-last budget phone for everyday use.Purchased from the seller Darshita Aashiyana. Thanks Amazon

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Must buy product under 15000
review_text: After one month usage writing this review:1) Classic premium look.2) Camera is superb.3) The battery life is also good. As I am not much using phone, once the battery is charged, it works for at least 2 days which is really good thing.4) Processor is fine.5) Display and brightness is good.6) Speaker is quite loud which is a plus point.7) Many new features are added compared to Realme 2 (my previous phone).8) Overall very good performance.9) I got it @10900/ after all the discount and credit card cashback, i.e. I got almost 1600/- less (actual price was 12499).10) Just I found drawback is that it has no mira casting and fingerprint lock are given.Overall I will recommend this phone to all friends. Just go for it.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A decent purchase if buyed under 11k
review_text: There is a lot to talk . Keep this in mind that I purchased this phone only and only for normal use and casual gaming , normal photos . Let's come to first point the actual holding experience and design .However I was uncertain about that round camera shape , it always looked awkward to me but guess what ? It's not bad in a day or two your eyes will see get used to this new normal don't worry about that however the design is boxy and it's totally subjective to user I liked it .Let's come to display part , here comes the catch company never told you that it is a 720p display in branding etc only brags about 120 hz display and trust me it lacks that sharpness so be carefull about that even most phones around this range is now providing only hd/hd+ display so give it a though.Camera performance - didn't tested in low light but camera is just very normal, skin tone is actually good but don't expect anything like 22-25k phones , so they are just decent.Weight - I am constantly using a 30k+ phone compared to that it is good and feels light , watched a movie while traveling and it feels good but one thing is this I don't know that light things feels cheap üôÇ .Bloatware - god that same thing I am tired of seeing in budget phones . There are literally a lot and ruins the experience.Heating - normal heating on casual tasks and gaming but it's not like oh I can't hold It anymore but yeah it heats, not that much but I don't think will be the deal breaker .

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Great Performance & Camera for Everyday use
review_text: I needed a phone with good camera, good performance and strong 5G network connectivity within a small budget for my 19yo who is in college now.Not intended for Gaming so a lower RAM was ok.After going through several reviews this seemed to be a good phone that checked all the boxes. Incidentally had a Realme 1 for exchange and got good value for that as well.Package arrived in perfect shape and the delivery person was patient and courteous.Phone setup was smooth and have been using for 2 months now.Build quality 5/5 - phone feels premium like it is from a segment above. love the matte green colour and finishDisplay 4/5 quality is good for the price and its great phone for everyday use.5G Network connectivity 5/5 - top-notchPerformance 5/5 - fantastic for general tasks and doesnt lagAndroid 14 OS - 5/5 - out of the box android 14 - can expect two more version updatesBattery 5/5 - very efficient and easily lasts for two days for my usage.Icing on the cake was additional 6 months complimentary warranty from RealmeWill definitely recommend for someone looking for no-nonsense built-to-last budget phone for everyday use.Purchased from the seller Darshita Aashiyana. Thanks Amazon

It's not bad in a day or two your eyes will see get used to this new normal don't worry about that however the design is boxy and it's totally subjective to user I liked it .Let's come to display part , here comes the catch company never told you that it is a 720p display in branding etc only brags about 120 hz display and trust me it lacks that sharpness so be carefull about that even most phones around this range is now providing only hd/hd+ display so give it a though.Camera performance - didn't tested in low light but camera is just very normal, skin tone is actually good but don't expect anything like 22-25k phones , so they are just decent.Weight - I am constantly using a 30k+ phone compared to that it is good and feels light , watched a movie while traveling and it feels good but one thing is this I don't know that light things feels cheap üôÇ .Bloatware - god that same thing I am tired of seeing in budget phones . title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money With Good Features but had a minor issue
review_text: I recently purchased the Redmi Note 13 5G, and overall, I am quite satisfied with the product, especially considering its price point. For a budget-friendly smartphone, it offers a reasonable level of performance. The 5G connectivity works well, and multitasking is quite smooth for day-to-day use. The display is crisp and vibrant, making watching videos and browsing a pleasant experience. The camera quality is decent for its price‚Äîboth the front and rear cameras deliver good shots in well-lit conditions.However, I did encounter a minor issue. After using the phone for about a week, it hung once, and I had to force restart it. Thankfully, it hasn‚Äôt happened again, but it‚Äôs something worth noting.Overall, for the price, this phone offers great value. Just be aware of the occasional glitch, but it shouldn't be a dealbreaker for most users.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone but Amazon experience was a HUGE let down
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

review_text: I ordered this phone for my daughter who is a student , basically for study related online classes. However good for capturing outdoor photography. I think with some camera updates, the quality should improvise.No memory issue related issues so far.Overall , a great value for money. This phone is good for all those who are in budget range (under 15k) and need a phone that looks premium, have good screen size & good battery.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money With Good Features but had a minor issue
review_text: I recently purchased the Redmi Note 13 5G, and overall, I am quite satisfied with the product, especially considering its price point. For a budget-friendly smartphone, it offers a reasonable level of performance. The 5G connectivity works well, and multitasking is quite smooth for day-to-day use. The display is crisp and vibrant, making watching videos and browsing a pleasant experience. The camera quality is decent for its price‚Äîboth the front and rear cameras deliver good shots in well-lit conditions.However, I did encounter a minor issue. After using the phone for about a week, it hung once, and I had to force restart it. Thankfully, it hasn‚Äôt happened again, but it‚Äôs something worth noting.Overall, for the price, this phone offers great value. Just be aware of the occasional glitch, but it shouldn't be a dealbreaker for most users.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone but Amazon experience was a HUGE let down
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

It is slower than  my earlier Redmi Y2 phone(6 years old) Camera is bad, as the autofocus doesn't respond properly. Macro photos are also not good, as the camera stability is not good. phone weight is higher due to built, which is not adding any benefit. Display is sharp n good but need to maximize it 100% under sunlight. Audio speaker is very directional, I need to adjust the holding conditions to hear from the earpiece. Please use it as a basic 5G smart phone with decent storage in average price. With loads of apps running on it, the phone doesn't lag. I like Mi phones due to their stable software and built quality but don't buy this one by watching Nora.. üòÑ

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money With Good Features but had a minor issue
review_text: I recently purchased the Redmi Note 13 5G, and overall, I am quite satisfied with the product, especially considering its price point. For a budget-friendly smartphone, it offers a reasonable level of performance. The 5G connectivity works well, and multitasking is quite smooth for day-to-day use. The display is crisp and vibrant, making watching videos and browsing a pleasant experience. The camera quality is decent for its price‚Äîboth the front and rear cameras deliver good shots in well-lit conditions.However, I did encounter a minor issue. After using the phone for about a week, it hung once, and I had to force restart it. Thankfully, it hasn‚Äôt happened again, but it‚Äôs something worth noting.Overall, for the price, this phone offers great value. Just be aware of the occasional glitch, but it shouldn't be a dealbreaker for most users.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone but Amazon experience was a HUGE let down
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

review_text: I am writing this review after 2 months of usage. This is an average phone at this price tag. It is slower than  my earlier Redmi Y2 phone(6 years old) Camera is bad, as the autofocus doesn't respond properly. Macro photos are also not good, as the camera stability is not good. phone weight is higher due to built, which is not adding any benefit. Display is sharp n good but need to maximize it 100% under sunlight. Audio speaker is very directional, I need to adjust the holding conditions to hear from the earpiece. Please use it as a basic 5G smart phone with decent storage in average price. With loads of apps running on it, the phone doesn't lag. I like Mi phones due to their stable software and built quality but don't buy this one by watching Nora.. üòÑ

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money With Good Features but had a minor issue
review_text: I recently purchased the Redmi Note 13 5G, and overall, I am quite satisfied with the product, especially considering its price point. For a budget-friendly smartphone, it offers a reasonable level of performance. The 5G connectivity works well, and multitasking is quite smooth for day-to-day use. The display is crisp and vibrant, making watching videos and browsing a pleasant experience. The camera quality is decent for its price‚Äîboth the front and rear cameras deliver good shots in well-lit conditions.However, I did encounter a minor issue. After using the phone for about a week, it hung once, and I had to force restart it. Thankfully, it hasn‚Äôt happened again, but it‚Äôs something worth noting.Overall, for the price, this phone offers great value. Just be aware of the occasional glitch, but it shouldn't be a dealbreaker for most users.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone but Amazon experience was a HUGE let down
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

It is slower than  my earlier Redmi Y2 phone(6 years old) Camera is bad, as the autofocus doesn't respond properly. Macro photos are also not good, as the camera stability is not good. phone weight is higher due to built, which is not adding any benefit. Display is sharp n good but need to maximize it 100% under sunlight. Audio speaker is very directional, I need to adjust the holding conditions to hear from the earpiece. Please use it as a basic 5G smart phone with decent storage in average price. With loads of apps running on it, the phone doesn't lag. I like Mi phones due to their stable software and built quality but don't buy this one by watching Nora.. üòÑ

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for Money With Good Features but had a minor issue
review_text: I recently purchased the Redmi Note 13 5G, and overall, I am quite satisfied with the product, especially considering its price point. For a budget-friendly smartphone, it offers a reasonable level of performance. The 5G connectivity works well, and multitasking is quite smooth for day-to-day use. The display is crisp and vibrant, making watching videos and browsing a pleasant experience. The camera quality is decent for its price‚Äîboth the front and rear cameras deliver good shots in well-lit conditions.However, I did encounter a minor issue. After using the phone for about a week, it hung once, and I had to force restart it. Thankfully, it hasn‚Äôt happened again, but it‚Äôs something worth noting.Overall, for the price, this phone offers great value. Just be aware of the occasional glitch, but it shouldn't be a dealbreaker for most users.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone but Amazon experience was a HUGE let down
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

It is slower than  my earlier Redmi Y2 phone(6 years old) Camera is bad, as the autofocus doesn't respond properly. Macro photos are also not good, as the camera stability is not good. phone weight is higher due to built, which is not adding any benefit. Display is sharp n good but need to maximize it 100% under sunlight. Audio speaker is very directional, I need to adjust the holding conditions to hear from the earpiece. Please use it as a basic 5G smart phone with decent storage in average price. With loads of apps running on it, the phone doesn't lag. I like Mi phones due to their stable software and built quality but don't buy this one by watching Nora.. üòÑ

The product is good. Haven't used it much to share how it works but so far so good. The package was well cushioned and the delivery was impeccable. The delivery executive was polite and professional.While buying the phone, I chose to exchange my old Xiaomi Note 8 (5 year old) and the site showed the exchange value as 3800 (199 exchange charge extra). When the phone was assessed at the spot, owing to a small dent on the side, the exchange value was knocked down by 60%!! Mind you, the screen had no scratches or dead pixels, both front and back glass was intact, the phone was working but my, oh my.This is pure mis-selling since they need to phone to be ABSOLUTELY new to give you just 40% of the buy price.Update 1: Been using the phone for a few days and there are a few hits and misses.Hits:The resolution is goodNo heating issues with the batteryBattery life is goodCharge time is goodMisses:Despite a 120Hz refresh rate, the screen is laggy and sticks (video attached)The touch is sticky and results in unexpected lags/pinchesDespite pocket mode activated, the phone screen comes on resulting in unexpected button pressesA few apps like Amazon, Phonepe take a while to load, unlockThe camera is average with washed out coloursWill add more later.Update 2: Touch issues are really bad with double tap, mis-tap happening one too many times. Another issue I noticed was that the ringtone can‚Äôt be changed. Looks more like a software glitch.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best budget phone with decent features..
review_text: Replaced my 5 yrs old Redmi Note 7 pro (6+128gb) with 4+128 version of 13c 5G. The Redmi note 7 pro had costed me 14k and I got 2.8k under exchange plus another 300 as cashback so this 13c costed me effectively 5.9k only. And I Must say for this given price, the phone has not disappointed at all thus far. UI Experience is same and as good as my earlier phone (which I was habitual of), thus was a smooth experience to transition to the new device. Screen quality is super awesome, Camera is just okaish (Below par for a 50MP lens - but you can't ask for an iphone pro max quality at this price), battery is lasting more than 1.5-2 days on a full charge and normal usage as I am not into gaming or other heavy usage. The only con is it takes a good duration of time to charge up. I am using an 18w charger (recommended higher limit) and it takes about 3-4 hrs at min to charge it fully. (Users tend to make a mistake by using higher than recommended chargers in order to charge fast and thus end up damaging their Phones ICs). The charger provided along with the box is standard 10w charger which is useless and I am not using anyways. On the storage, I feel128 gb is more than enough as it was same in my old phone and after using it for 5 years I could use only 90gb of it. For the RAM, again I felt 4 gb should be more than enough as previous 6gb version always showed idle RAM capacity of 3.5-4 GB. And using it till now have not felt any lag or so in normal operations. No heating issues as such. Sound quality is fine. If you are a normal/conservative smartphone user, this is the Best phone you will find under this budget. Even if it lasts another 4-5 years, :) , it would be a complete Paisa vasool. Let's hope it does last that long. And this is also to set an example in an era where people are going crazy/gungho about phones exceeding 1.5lacs with blah blah features, that, if used properly, even a 6k smartphone can serve you equally well ;)

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Decent Budget Phone, But 4 GB RAM Falls Short for Heavy Users
review_text: **Pros:**- Affordable price for the specs and features offered.- Ideal for lighter users, like parents, who don't use their phones heavily.- Front camera quality is surprisingly better than the rear camera.- Phone size and design match the description provided.**Cons:**- 4 GB of RAM feels insufficient for multitasking and heavier usage.- Installed 60 apps; frequently used 20-25 apps, and occasionally used 10-15, but still experienced issues with app refreshing when switching between them.- Lost progress in apps like Chrome, Prime Video, and Telegram due to background refresh.- The 6 GB variant would have been a better choice, though slightly over budget.- The phone feels large in hand, which might not be comfortable for everyone.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget Friendly
review_text: Performance:Powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G chipset, the phone offers adequate performance for casual use, browsing, social media, and moderate gaming. While it‚Äôs not a flagship-level processor, it handles daily tasks smoothly, especially with 4GB of RAM. However, for heavy multitasking or intensive gaming, users might experience some lag.Storage:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs plenty of room for apps, photos, videos, and other media. This amount of storage is generous for a phone at this price point, especially with the option to expand it via a microSD card.5G Connectivity:The inclusion of 5G is a standout feature, future-proofing the device for faster mobile internet speeds, making it a great option for those looking for an affordable entry into the 5G ecosystem.Battery & Charging:Although the battery details aren‚Äôt mentioned here, Redmi phones typically feature solid battery life. You can expect a full day‚Äôs use on a single charge, especially with power-efficient 5G chips like the Dimensity 6100+.Overall:The Redmi 13C 5G is a good choice for budget-conscious consumers who want 5G connectivity, a smooth 90Hz display, and ample storage. Its performance is decent for everyday use, though heavy users may feel limited by the 4GB RAM. If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable 5G smartphone that doesn‚Äôt compromise too much on features, this model is worth considering.

If audio quality isn't your top priority, it's still a good option for its price, especially with 5G connectivity.

product_name: Redmi 13C 5G (Startrail Green, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G | 90Hz Display
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best budget phone with decent features..
review_text: Replaced my 5 yrs old Redmi Note 7 pro (6+128gb) with 4+128 version of 13c 5G. The Redmi note 7 pro had costed me 14k and I got 2.8k under exchange plus another 300 as cashback so this 13c costed me effectively 5.9k only. And I Must say for this given price, the phone has not disappointed at all thus far. UI Experience is same and as good as my earlier phone (which I was habitual of), thus was a smooth experience to transition to the new device. Screen quality is super awesome, Camera is just okaish (Below par for a 50MP lens - but you can't ask for an iphone pro max quality at this price), battery is lasting more than 1.5-2 days on a full charge and normal usage as I am not into gaming or other heavy usage. The only con is it takes a good duration of time to charge up. I am using an 18w charger (recommended higher limit) and it takes about 3-4 hrs at min to charge it fully. (Users tend to make a mistake by using higher than recommended chargers in order to charge fast and thus end up damaging their Phones ICs). The charger provided along with the box is standard 10w charger which is useless and I am not using anyways. On the storage, I feel128 gb is more than enough as it was same in my old phone and after using it for 5 years I could use only 90gb of it. For the RAM, again I felt 4 gb should be more than enough as previous 6gb version always showed idle RAM capacity of 3.5-4 GB. And using it till now have not felt any lag or so in normal operations. No heating issues as such. Sound quality is fine. If you are a normal/conservative smartphone user, this is the Best phone you will find under this budget. Even if it lasts another 4-5 years, :) , it would be a complete Paisa vasool. Let's hope it does last that long. And this is also to set an example in an era where people are going crazy/gungho about phones exceeding 1.5lacs with blah blah features, that, if used properly, even a 6k smartphone can serve you equally well ;)

product_name: Redmi 13C 5G (Startrail Green, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G | 90Hz Display
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Nice budget mobile phone with good features.
review_text: The phone feels great in my hand, shine looks awesome.Pros:* expandable RAM from 4 GB to 4GB+2GB/4+4 GB or even more* performance is good when upgraded software to hyperOS* Decent battery life for basic to intermediate tasks* Smooth Multitasking* Big Display* Power button as Fingerprint sensorCons:* A little heat up is experienced while gaming* Front Selfie Camera is not Great as of our Last Redmi Note Series Phone* Little Laggy for 2-3 minutes just after restarting device afterwards smooth run* Fast charge, but Not quick charging as the Adapter included is of 20W, I used a 30W adapter and is was quickly charging.I‚Äôm impressed with the Design and more over the ram expandable feature which takes memory from storage to expand ram, and you can choose to keep 4GB or expand to 6 or 8 GB as well.

product_name: Redmi 13C 5G (Startrail Green, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G | 90Hz Display
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Decent Budget Phone, But 4 GB RAM Falls Short for Heavy Users
review_text: **Pros:**- Affordable price for the specs and features offered.- Ideal for lighter users, like parents, who don't use their phones heavily.- Front camera quality is surprisingly better than the rear camera.- Phone size and design match the description provided.**Cons:**- 4 GB of RAM feels insufficient for multitasking and heavier usage.- Installed 60 apps; frequently used 20-25 apps, and occasionally used 10-15, but still experienced issues with app refreshing when switching between them.- Lost progress in apps like Chrome, Prime Video, and Telegram due to background refresh.- The 6 GB variant would have been a better choice, though slightly over budget.- The phone feels large in hand, which might not be comfortable for everyone.

product_name: Redmi 13C 5G (Startrail Green, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G | 90Hz Display
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget Friendly
review_text: Performance:Powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G chipset, the phone offers adequate performance for casual use, browsing, social media, and moderate gaming. While it‚Äôs not a flagship-level processor, it handles daily tasks smoothly, especially with 4GB of RAM. However, for heavy multitasking or intensive gaming, users might experience some lag.Storage:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs plenty of room for apps, photos, videos, and other media. This amount of storage is generous for a phone at this price point, especially with the option to expand it via a microSD card.5G Connectivity:The inclusion of 5G is a standout feature, future-proofing the device for faster mobile internet speeds, making it a great option for those looking for an affordable entry into the 5G ecosystem.Battery & Charging:Although the battery details aren‚Äôt mentioned here, Redmi phones typically feature solid battery life. You can expect a full day‚Äôs use on a single charge, especially with power-efficient 5G chips like the Dimensity 6100+.Overall:The Redmi 13C 5G is a good choice for budget-conscious consumers who want 5G connectivity, a smooth 90Hz display, and ample storage. Its performance is decent for everyday use, though heavy users may feel limited by the 4GB RAM. If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable 5G smartphone that doesn‚Äôt compromise too much on features, this model is worth considering.

product_name: Redmi 13C 5G (Startrail Green, 4GB RAM, 128GB Storage) | MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G | 90Hz Display
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget 5G Phone with good design but poor speaker sound
review_text: The Redmi 13C is an impressive budget 5G phone with a sleek design that feels premium for its price range. The performance is solid, daily tasks are handled smoothly, and the display is bright and vibrant. However, the speaker quality is disappointing; low volume and muffled sound diminishes the overall experience. If audio quality isn't your top priority, it's still a good option for its price, especially with 5G connectivity.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Best budget phone with decent features..
review_text: Replaced my 5 yrs old Redmi Note 7 pro (6+128gb) with 4+128 version of 13c 5G. The Redmi note 7 pro had costed me 14k and I got 2.8k under exchange plus another 300 as cashback so this 13c costed me effectively 5.9k only. And I Must say for this given price, the phone has not disappointed at all thus far. UI Experience is same and as good as my earlier phone (which I was habitual of), thus was a smooth experience to transition to the new device. Screen quality is super awesome, Camera is just okaish (Below par for a 50MP lens - but you can't ask for an iphone pro max quality at this price), battery is lasting more than 1.5-2 days on a full charge and normal usage as I am not into gaming or other heavy usage. The only con is it takes a good duration of time to charge up. I am using an 18w charger (recommended higher limit) and it takes about 3-4 hrs at min to charge it fully. (Users tend to make a mistake by using higher than recommended chargers in order to charge fast and thus end up damaging their Phones ICs). The charger provided along with the box is standard 10w charger which is useless and I am not using anyways. On the storage, I feel128 gb is more than enough as it was same in my old phone and after using it for 5 years I could use only 90gb of it. For the RAM, again I felt 4 gb should be more than enough as previous 6gb version always showed idle RAM capacity of 3.5-4 GB. And using it till now have not felt any lag or so in normal operations. No heating issues as such. Sound quality is fine. If you are a normal/conservative smartphone user, this is the Best phone you will find under this budget. Even if it lasts another 4-5 years, :) , it would be a complete Paisa vasool. Let's hope it does last that long. And this is also to set an example in an era where people are going crazy/gungho about phones exceeding 1.5lacs with blah blah features, that, if used properly, even a 6k smartphone can serve you equally well ;)

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Nice budget mobile phone with good features.
review_text: The phone feels great in my hand, shine looks awesome.Pros:* expandable RAM from 4 GB to 4GB+2GB/4+4 GB or even more* performance is good when upgraded software to hyperOS* Decent battery life for basic to intermediate tasks* Smooth Multitasking* Big Display* Power button as Fingerprint sensorCons:* A little heat up is experienced while gaming* Front Selfie Camera is not Great as of our Last Redmi Note Series Phone* Little Laggy for 2-3 minutes just after restarting device afterwards smooth run* Fast charge, but Not quick charging as the Adapter included is of 20W, I used a 30W adapter and is was quickly charging.I‚Äôm impressed with the Design and more over the ram expandable feature which takes memory from storage to expand ram, and you can choose to keep 4GB or expand to 6 or 8 GB as well.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Decent Budget Phone, But 4 GB RAM Falls Short for Heavy Users
review_text: **Pros:**- Affordable price for the specs and features offered.- Ideal for lighter users, like parents, who don't use their phones heavily.- Front camera quality is surprisingly better than the rear camera.- Phone size and design match the description provided.**Cons:**- 4 GB of RAM feels insufficient for multitasking and heavier usage.- Installed 60 apps; frequently used 20-25 apps, and occasionally used 10-15, but still experienced issues with app refreshing when switching between them.- Lost progress in apps like Chrome, Prime Video, and Telegram due to background refresh.- The 6 GB variant would have been a better choice, though slightly over budget.- The phone feels large in hand, which might not be comfortable for everyone.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget Friendly
review_text: Performance:Powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6100+ 5G chipset, the phone offers adequate performance for casual use, browsing, social media, and moderate gaming. While it‚Äôs not a flagship-level processor, it handles daily tasks smoothly, especially with 4GB of RAM. However, for heavy multitasking or intensive gaming, users might experience some lag.Storage:With 128GB of storage, there‚Äôs plenty of room for apps, photos, videos, and other media. This amount of storage is generous for a phone at this price point, especially with the option to expand it via a microSD card.5G Connectivity:The inclusion of 5G is a standout feature, future-proofing the device for faster mobile internet speeds, making it a great option for those looking for an affordable entry into the 5G ecosystem.Battery & Charging:Although the battery details aren‚Äôt mentioned here, Redmi phones typically feature solid battery life. You can expect a full day‚Äôs use on a single charge, especially with power-efficient 5G chips like the Dimensity 6100+.Overall:The Redmi 13C 5G is a good choice for budget-conscious consumers who want 5G connectivity, a smooth 90Hz display, and ample storage. Its performance is decent for everyday use, though heavy users may feel limited by the 4GB RAM. If you‚Äôre looking for an affordable 5G smartphone that doesn‚Äôt compromise too much on features, this model is worth considering.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Budget 5G Phone with good design but poor speaker sound
review_text: The Redmi 13C is an impressive budget 5G phone with a sleek design that feels premium for its price range. The performance is solid, daily tasks are handled smoothly, and the display is bright and vibrant. However, the speaker quality is disappointing; low volume and muffled sound diminishes the overall experience. If audio quality isn't your top priority, it's still a good option for its price, especially with 5G connectivity.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Not for Everyone
review_text: I'm leaving a 5* here just because this phone is close to perfect for me. Do not expect wonders if you are planning to buy this phone. As the headline suggests, it is not for everyone.1. The build quality is good and the weight feels perfect as it is not on the heavier side. Since the weight distribution is good, it's easy to handle with one hand despite the screen size being close to "massive".2. The AMOLED screen works it's magic while watching videos. My primary aim to buy this phone was for viewing purpose since I spend a lot of time on YouTube and other streaming platforms. The color distribution is a chef's kiss since it does not try to forcibly add gradients. More on the natural side and hence the viewing experience will feel pleasant.3. Sound could have been better. The mono speakers feels cheap but yet surprisingly does the job. I use speakers and headphones so that it's that big of an issue for me (but if you depend on phone speakers for your entertainment, better look for another phone possibly POCO for stereo speakers at the same price point but then you will miss out on the display part )4. CHARGING ISSUE? The answer is NO, Although it's been just a day using this phone, i did not face any issues. I was skeptical after reading the reviews about the charging issues. It's true that I faced a little hiccup when i first charged the phone right after unboxing where the connection is interrupted during charger but that was just for a few seconds (Give it some time and the charging connection issue will disappear). Further the Hyper OS update completely rectified the issue.5. Refresh rate at 120Hz noticeably improves the social media experience. Brightness is good and you won't have any issues using the phone in sunlight. Switch to optimal settings for better using experience6. 5G works like a charm for me with JIO giving speeds of over 250 Mbps most of the time (Depends on the 5G zones. Some of you might get even better since stay near the outskirts of the city)7. Gaming: Not yet tested but it doesn't matter a lot to me so that's fine.8. Camera : Low light photos are good but make sure to stabilize your hand or else it would be blurry. 108 MP camera photos are good and provide good detailing. It could definitely have been a lot better but this phone is not for camera enthusiasts. If you like to create memories by clicking photos and not fuss about the details about them you can definitely go for it.Overall do not exclude this phone from your options (if you are planning on buying this) just by reading the negative reviews. I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews. People should update their phones to the latest firmware to bring out the best and eliminate any bugs.

review_text: The Redmi Note 13 5G unfortunately suffers from poor battery performance, which can be a dealbreaker for many users. The display quality is impressive, featuring vibrant colors and sharp details, making it great for media consumption. review_text: The Redmi Note 13 Pro offers great value for its price, featuring a sleek design, a vibrant 6.67-inch AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate, and solid performance powered by a Snapdragon 7 series processor. Its 5000mAh battery with 67W fast charging is excellent, and the 200MP main camera performs well in good lighting, though low-light results are average. MIUI software is feature-rich but may feel cluttered. Overall, it's a reliable mid-range option for everyday use, though power users might find some limitations in performance and camera quality.

4.0 out of 5 stars
A really good option as a daily driver.
review_text: Battery - Even though this phone has decent specs, this is not a gaming phone/or a phone for heavy usages imo. The main reason is battery backup, it's below par. Even though the device comes with 5100 mAh battery, battery backup is poor.Camera - Decent, does the job. Takes good photos in low-light conditions too. But I noticed a bug in the camera, whenever camera is opened, the exposure is too high for a 1-2 sec, only after that the camera adjusts to surrounding. This problem was not seen in other camera( When accessed through WhatsApp, or Instagram). So I believe it's something for the backend team of MI to fix.Display - Decent. Nothing much to complain. So far so good.NB : Hyper OS needs to be optimised. Because right now there are lot of bugs in the OS.Overall a 8/10. If you're looking for a device for day to day activities, this phone is more than enough. Stay away if you're a gamer or someone who's work depends a lot on mobile.Thanks.

title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
good phone.. but be careful with delivery agents if you are exchanging old phone.
review_text: Good phone. No issues with that.But if you are exhanging your old phone, you have to be little more careful.Dont handover your old phone straight away to the delivery guy, its better you get the otp required for the rabbit exchage app tests, from him and YOU RUN THE TESTS BY YOURSELF While having the agent nearby,..It seems some delivery agents wanted to reduce the attractive exchange prices thats declared during the time of order ( may be instructed by their lead)In my case: Handed the old phone straight away to the delivery agent, and after FEW minutes, he tried to create artificial panic by saying imei not found (invalid)and he started his bargain saying it could be stolen and created panics to the resident. Luckily i had the puchase bill(from a reputed offline store, where we used to buy highend phones). Same time i asked the resident to do a factory reset again and yes the imei was displaying after that.,I felt something fishyMy question:1. How did the imei ( which i used for registering exchange)got invalid after he received the phone.2. why didnt the delivery guy(or his team which he spoke to by call) suggest a solution (in my case:another factory reset) instead he tried to create artificial panic and started his bargain.( May be they have some technique to make it invalid , create panic, then pay extra)Anyways his behavior was not of a honest one. So guys if you exchange , do the tests yourself with the agent nearby., its not a rocket science, just an user freindly app.Note:My bad, I paid rs.3480extra through gpay, as my resident accidently dropped the phone while handing over due to which the display glass was cracked.This happened after the IMEI dramas, as explained above.The above mentioned amount was declared by the agent all of a sudden, i dont know from where he got that value., i asked him does the app was showing that value, for which he replied, if we go through the app, the amount to pay will be more only. The total scenario was fishy.Good phone , Good platform, fishy delivery n exchange service

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Powerhouse of a Phone - Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus Review
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus for a week now, and I must say, it's exceeded my expectations in almost every department! The phone's performance is lightning-fast, thanks to the powerful processor and ample RAM. The display is stunning, with vibrant colors and crisp visuals. Battery life is impressive, easily lasting a day with heavy usage. Cameras are top-notch, capturing detailed photos and videos. The design is sleek and premium, with a comfortable grip. Call quality is top notch, even in low network areas.Cons: software and security update as given are for 03 years and 04 years respectively, they could have offered for more like for 05 years, though the phone came with Hyper OS and Android 14 out of th the box, comparing to the initial phone which came with MIUI 14 and Android 13. It will be a long wait to see how many updates i will be getting.Other only minor gripe is the lack of wireless charging, but that's a small trade-off for the incredible value this phone offers. Overall, I'm thoroughly enjoying my Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus experience and would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a high-performance device without breaking the bank. My review - A premium package on a mid range budget.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Noteworthy!
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ for a while now, and I have to say, it's an amazing phone, especially for the price. Here‚Äôs why I love it:Design and Feel:First off, it looks and feels premium. The sleek design and solid build make it feel way more expensive than it actually is. It's comfortable to hold and use, which is a big plus.Display:The screen is gorgeous. The AMOLED display is bright and vibrant, making everything from videos to games look fantastic. Plus, the high refresh rate makes scrolling and animations super smooth.Performance:Even though it has a weaker processor compared to other upper mid-range smartphones, the performance is still really good. Apps open quickly, and multitasking is a breeze. I‚Äôve played some pretty graphics-heavy games on it, and it handles them surprisingly well.Camera:The camera setup is really impressive. Photos come out clear and vibrant, even in low light. The extra lenses for wide-angle shots and close-ups add a lot of versatility. It‚Äôs perfect for snapping great photos on the go.Battery Life:Battery life is solid. It easily lasts all day with heavy use, and the fast charging is a lifesaver when you‚Äôre in a hurry. No more waiting around for your phone to charge!Software:HyperOs is smooth and feature-packed. It takes a bit to get used to if you‚Äôre coming from another brand, but it‚Äôs intuitive and has a lot of useful features.Overall, the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ is a fantastic choice if you want a high-quality phone without spending a fortune. It delivers great performance, a beautiful display, and a top-notch camera all at an affordable price. Definitely recommend it!Bonus: There's no heating issue observed when doing demanding tasks!

title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Don't buy this!!!
review_text: As an Xiaomi user for many years , i have purchased this phone on 31 may 2024, initially i loved the phone the looks the performance and also it's offers the ip68(IP68 is an international standard rating for the protection of electrical enclosures against dust and water. The rating is made up of two numbers, with the first number indicating protection against solids and the second number indicating protection against water. In the case of IP68, the numbers are:6Total protection against solid ingress, including small dust particles like sand and dirt8Total protection against water ingress, including complete submersion for more than 30 minutes below one meter)Water spills on my phone and gets inside the phone which effects the fingerprint sensor , cellular network not working also the charging not working and primary mic stopped working after such issues i visited near mi care to resolve the issue, firstly the decline the warrenty as the water damage is there but i asked them this phone comes with ip68 ,the said and show the inside indicator for water is red so your warrenty is voided ,and the said your phone has many damages internally so after the inspection they said you have to pay 10000rs for the replacement of parts which is 1/3cost of the smartphone.....I asked Xiaomi is this is ip68 ??I asked Xiaomi is this is your service for many year user?I have been using mi smartphone from redmi 1s till nowI asked Xiaomi this is good experience for any user as he purchased a brand new phone and this happens??

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
An Average Performerwith Good Display
review_text: Well kudos to Amazon for delivering this fast.The phone itself is"simple"  yet has a gorgeous DCI P3 std display with wide color gamut.  Video diaply is amazing. perfect for watching movies etc.Bit heavy it does fit snugly in your hands. Out of the box synicing to the old phone and getting started to use your new phone is easy. I noticed minor lag on apps like YT however this was solved as soon as I updated the preinstalled apps. audio quality through stereo speakers is top notch.NOW the bad part of this phone is its camera department.. 200 MP is just a silly moniker.. the phone software seems to be over correcting edges around faces. portrait seem "watery" as from an old 90s phone  with lack of detail and texture.. on the plus side the macro camera is ok. Same story with the portrait mode.The AI in the camera doesn't show the scene detected eg food,  flowers, etc which is sad .. as you don't know what algorithm is been applied,Skin textures often seem to be blown out or phone seems to apply over smoothing in some places.  HDR mode blows out photos in bright highlights. Honestly not a  delight to use camera.The phone itself is blazing fast. and not much bloatware . Excellent for using office apps . I miss the quickball to take screenshots. and camera portions are prone to smudges or finger prints. Wish they had a more textured matte blacScreen k version.Advice... avoid if you want a good camera .. buy if you want second space feature and multi app support with powerful processing for office related apps amd occasional gamingI

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Powerhouse of a Phone - Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus Review
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus for a week now, and I must say, it's exceeded my expectations in almost every department! The phone's performance is lightning-fast, thanks to the powerful processor and ample RAM. The display is stunning, with vibrant colors and crisp visuals. Battery life is impressive, easily lasting a day with heavy usage. Cameras are top-notch, capturing detailed photos and videos. The design is sleek and premium, with a comfortable grip. Call quality is top notch, even in low network areas.Cons: software and security update as given are for 03 years and 04 years respectively, they could have offered for more like for 05 years, though the phone came with Hyper OS and Android 14 out of th the box, comparing to the initial phone which came with MIUI 14 and Android 13. It will be a long wait to see how many updates i will be getting.Other only minor gripe is the lack of wireless charging, but that's a small trade-off for the incredible value this phone offers. Overall, I'm thoroughly enjoying my Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus experience and would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a high-performance device without breaking the bank. My review - A premium package on a mid range budget.
