title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Noteworthy!
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ for a while now, and I have to say, it's an amazing phone, especially for the price. Here‚Äôs why I love it:Design and Feel:First off, it looks and feels premium. The sleek design and solid build make it feel way more expensive than it actually is. It's comfortable to hold and use, which is a big plus.Display:The screen is gorgeous. The AMOLED display is bright and vibrant, making everything from videos to games look fantastic. Plus, the high refresh rate makes scrolling and animations super smooth.Performance:Even though it has a weaker processor compared to other upper mid-range smartphones, the performance is still really good. Apps open quickly, and multitasking is a breeze. I‚Äôve played some pretty graphics-heavy games on it, and it handles them surprisingly well.Camera:The camera setup is really impressive. Photos come out clear and vibrant, even in low light. The extra lenses for wide-angle shots and close-ups add a lot of versatility. It‚Äôs perfect for snapping great photos on the go.Battery Life:Battery life is solid. It easily lasts all day with heavy use, and the fast charging is a lifesaver when you‚Äôre in a hurry. No more waiting around for your phone to charge!Software:HyperOs is smooth and feature-packed. It takes a bit to get used to if you‚Äôre coming from another brand, but it‚Äôs intuitive and has a lot of useful features.Overall, the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ is a fantastic choice if you want a high-quality phone without spending a fortune. It delivers great performance, a beautiful display, and a top-notch camera all at an affordable price. Definitely recommend it!Bonus: There's no heating issue observed when doing demanding tasks!

title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Don't buy this!!!
review_text: As an Xiaomi user for many years , i have purchased this phone on 31 may 2024, initially i loved the phone the looks the performance and also it's offers the ip68(IP68 is an international standard rating for the protection of electrical enclosures against dust and water. The rating is made up of two numbers, with the first number indicating protection against solids and the second number indicating protection against water. In the case of IP68, the numbers are:6Total protection against solid ingress, including small dust particles like sand and dirt8Total protection against water ingress, including complete submersion for more than 30 minutes below one meter)Water spills on my phone and gets inside the phone which effects the fingerprint sensor , cellular network not working also the charging not working and primary mic stopped working after such issues i visited near mi care to resolve the issue, firstly the decline the warrenty as the water damage is there but i asked them this phone comes with ip68 ,the said and show the inside indicator for water is red so your warrenty is voided ,and the said your phone has many damages internally so after the inspection they said you have to pay 10000rs for the replacement of parts which is 1/3cost of the smartphone.....I asked Xiaomi is this is ip68 ??I asked Xiaomi is this is your service for many year user?I have been using mi smartphone from redmi 1s till nowI asked Xiaomi this is good experience for any user as he purchased a brand new phone and this happens??

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
An Average Performerwith Good Display
review_text: Well kudos to Amazon for delivering this fast.The phone itself is"simple"  yet has a gorgeous DCI P3 std display with wide color gamut.  Video diaply is amazing. perfect for watching movies etc.Bit heavy it does fit snugly in your hands. Out of the box synicing to the old phone and getting started to use your new phone is easy. I noticed minor lag on apps like YT however this was solved as soon as I updated the preinstalled apps. audio quality through stereo speakers is top notch.NOW the bad part of this phone is its camera department.. 200 MP is just a silly moniker.. the phone software seems to be over correcting edges around faces. portrait seem "watery" as from an old 90s phone  with lack of detail and texture.. on the plus side the macro camera is ok. Same story with the portrait mode.The AI in the camera doesn't show the scene detected eg food,  flowers, etc which is sad .. as you don't know what algorithm is been applied,Skin textures often seem to be blown out or phone seems to apply over smoothing in some places.  HDR mode blows out photos in bright highlights. Honestly not a  delight to use camera.The phone itself is blazing fast. and not much bloatware . Excellent for using office apps . I miss the quickball to take screenshots. and camera portions are prone to smudges or finger prints. Wish they had a more textured matte blacScreen k version.Advice... avoid if you want a good camera .. buy if you want second space feature and multi app support with powerful processing for office related apps amd occasional gamingI

product_name: Redmi Note 13 Pro+ (Fusion White, 8GB RAM, 256GB Storage)
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
A Powerhouse of a Phone - Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus Review
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus for a week now, and I must say, it's exceeded my expectations in almost every department! The phone's performance is lightning-fast, thanks to the powerful processor and ample RAM. The display is stunning, with vibrant colors and crisp visuals. Battery life is impressive, easily lasting a day with heavy usage. Cameras are top-notch, capturing detailed photos and videos. The design is sleek and premium, with a comfortable grip. Call quality is top notch, even in low network areas.Cons: software and security update as given are for 03 years and 04 years respectively, they could have offered for more like for 05 years, though the phone came with Hyper OS and Android 14 out of th the box, comparing to the initial phone which came with MIUI 14 and Android 13. It will be a long wait to see how many updates i will be getting.Other only minor gripe is the lack of wireless charging, but that's a small trade-off for the incredible value this phone offers. Overall, I'm thoroughly enjoying my Redmi Note 13 Pro Plus experience and would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a high-performance device without breaking the bank. My review - A premium package on a mid range budget.

And the device heats up a bit still not overheating in gaming I didn't found any shutters or lags it works smoothCons:I think this stuff is a bit overpricedThe camera is not up to the mark in these price rangeBut still it can be fixed with a software updateAnd the battery drains fast I don't think it's 5000 mah my 5 yrs old vivo gives more backup than this but still 120w just full in 19 minsAnd the other features are good about these device the cons can be just fixed by an update and after all i love these phone don't mind the negative comments just go for it and i have a suggestion it's bit over priced so you can buy it on offer times and it's not an performance oriented device if you are a gamer or looking that types of phne you can go for iqoo neo 9 Or something and that's all about these device I think this review may help you and i I'll update if I faced any prblms thank youüòä

product_name: Redmi Note 13 Pro+ (Fusion White, 8GB RAM, 256GB Storage)
title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Noteworthy!
review_text: I've been using the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ for a while now, and I have to say, it's an amazing phone, especially for the price. Here‚Äôs why I love it:Design and Feel:First off, it looks and feels premium. The sleek design and solid build make it feel way more expensive than it actually is. It's comfortable to hold and use, which is a big plus.Display:The screen is gorgeous. The AMOLED display is bright and vibrant, making everything from videos to games look fantastic. Plus, the high refresh rate makes scrolling and animations super smooth.Performance:Even though it has a weaker processor compared to other upper mid-range smartphones, the performance is still really good. Apps open quickly, and multitasking is a breeze. I‚Äôve played some pretty graphics-heavy games on it, and it handles them surprisingly well.Camera:The camera setup is really impressive. Photos come out clear and vibrant, even in low light. The extra lenses for wide-angle shots and close-ups add a lot of versatility. It‚Äôs perfect for snapping great photos on the go.Battery Life:Battery life is solid. It easily lasts all day with heavy use, and the fast charging is a lifesaver when you‚Äôre in a hurry. No more waiting around for your phone to charge!Software:HyperOs is smooth and feature-packed. It takes a bit to get used to if you‚Äôre coming from another brand, but it‚Äôs intuitive and has a lot of useful features.Overall, the Redmi Note 13 Pro+ is a fantastic choice if you want a high-quality phone without spending a fortune. It delivers great performance, a beautiful display, and a top-notch camera all at an affordable price. Definitely recommend it!Bonus: There's no heating issue observed when doing demanding tasks!

product_name: Redmi Note 13 Pro+ (Fusion White, 8GB RAM, 256GB Storage)
title:
1.0 out of 5 stars
Don't buy this!!!
review_text: As an Xiaomi user for many years , i have purchased this phone on 31 may 2024, initially i loved the phone the looks the performance and also it's offers the ip68(IP68 is an international standard rating for the protection of electrical enclosures against dust and water. The rating is made up of two numbers, with the first number indicating protection against solids and the second number indicating protection against water. In the case of IP68, the numbers are:6Total protection against solid ingress, including small dust particles like sand and dirt8Total protection against water ingress, including complete submersion for more than 30 minutes below one meter)Water spills on my phone and gets inside the phone which effects the fingerprint sensor , cellular network not working also the charging not working and primary mic stopped working after such issues i visited near mi care to resolve the issue, firstly the decline the warrenty as the water damage is there but i asked them this phone comes with ip68 ,the said and show the inside indicator for water is red so your warrenty is voided ,and the said your phone has many damages internally so after the inspection they said you have to pay 10000rs for the replacement of parts which is 1/3cost of the smartphone.....I asked Xiaomi is this is ip68 ??I asked Xiaomi is this is your service for many year user?I have been using mi smartphone from redmi 1s till nowI asked Xiaomi this is good experience for any user as he purchased a brand new phone and this happens??

product_name: Redmi Note 13 Pro+ (Fusion White, 8GB RAM, 256GB Storage)
title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
An Average Performerwith Good Display
review_text: Well kudos to Amazon for delivering this fast.The phone itself is"simple"  yet has a gorgeous DCI P3 std display with wide color gamut.  Video diaply is amazing. perfect for watching movies etc.Bit heavy it does fit snugly in your hands. Out of the box synicing to the old phone and getting started to use your new phone is easy. I noticed minor lag on apps like YT however this was solved as soon as I updated the preinstalled apps. audio quality through stereo speakers is top notch.NOW the bad part of this phone is its camera department.. 200 MP is just a silly moniker.. the phone software seems to be over correcting edges around faces. portrait seem "watery" as from an old 90s phone  with lack of detail and texture.. on the plus side the macro camera is ok. Same story with the portrait mode.The AI in the camera doesn't show the scene detected eg food,  flowers, etc which is sad .. as you don't know what algorithm is been applied,Skin textures often seem to be blown out or phone seems to apply over smoothing in some places.  HDR mode blows out photos in bright highlights. Honestly not a  delight to use camera.The phone itself is blazing fast. and not much bloatware . Excellent for using office apps . I miss the quickball to take screenshots. and camera portions are prone to smudges or finger prints. Wish they had a more textured matte blacScreen k version.Advice... avoid if you want a good camera .. buy if you want second space feature and multi app support with powerful processing for office related apps amd occasional gamingI

Amazon won't accept any returns, support or replacement. You need to go to service center for that. Forget about returns at all!My sim slot wasn't working at al. It has not been damaged because it was stuck and won't come out to out a sim card, thanks to the Mi service center support who somehow managed to open it (though it's damaged now). I don't even want to get started with the rude, menacing and aggressive delivery agent.My two cents - Don't buy this.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Camera Beast
review_text: The Samsung Galaxy A14 5G is a budget-friendly smartphone that offers a decent mix of features and performance. It has a 6.6-inch 1080p LCD display with a 90Hz refresh rate, a MediaTek Dimensity 700 processor, 4GB of RAM, 64GB of storage, a 50MP rear camera, a 13MP front camera, and a 5,000mAh battery.The Galaxy A14 5G is a good choice for people who are looking for a basic smartphone with 5G connectivity. It's not the fastest phone on the market, but it's fast enough for most tasks. The display is sharp and vibrant, and the 90Hz refresh rate makes scrolling and animations feel smooth. The battery life is also excellent, and the phone can easily last a full day on a single charge.The camera is one of the weaker points of the Galaxy A14 5G. The main camera takes decent photos in good lighting, but the quality drops off significantly in low light. The front camera is also a bit underwhelming.Overall, the Samsung Galaxy A14 5G is a good budget-friendly smartphone with 5G connectivity. It's not the best phone on the market, but it offers a good value for the price.Here are some of the pros and cons of the Samsung Galaxy A14 5G:Pros:5G connectivitySharp and vibrant display90Hz refresh rateLong battery lifeAffordable priceCons:Camera is not great in low lightFront camera is a bit underwhelmingPerformance can be a bit slow at timesIf you're looking for a basic smartphone with 5G connectivity, the Samsung Galaxy A14 5G is a good option. However, if you're looking for a phone with a great camera or top-of-the-line performance, you'll want to look elsewhere.Enter a prompt hereBard may display inaccurate or offensive information that doesn‚Äôt repr

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Value for money
review_text: Well after a lit of deliberation finally settled for Samsung A35. Have been using samsung A22 for quite sometime now and wanted to switch over to moto or one plus but after a lot of review I brought this phone. For an average user this phone is worth it. The display is amazing, the camera is really good and the phone works pretty smoothly. No complaints at all. I did not find any heating issue. The phone goes on for about a day with normal usage. I have been using usual media app like YouTube insta etc and the pictures and sound quality is very good. The are some AI features added which come very handy using your cam. Best part is 4 yrs of software updates which Samsung is guaranteed to deliver ND the phone is safe. I dropped the phone a few times but the screen is good.The only draw back is they do not provide charger or other accessories in the box. Also the charing is pretty slow takes more than an hr to charge up.Else Samsung phones are very reliable. Happy with the product.

Also the battery comes down fast even with normal use and you will feel frustrated when you will have to leave the phone on charging again.  Samsung just wants its Customers to go for flagship higher end phones or else pay the price for buying this mid range good looking phone on lower price.

title:
2.0 out of 5 stars
Amazon cheating with price listings...
review_text: I have purchased the Samsung A35. Product is in good condition, and Samsung A35 is excellent.However I have an issue with Amazon's price listing:Two different Prices Listed on Amazon:1. With exchange bonous offer Price is Rs.30,999 and2. Other offer it is Rs.22,800With offer price is almost Rs. 8,199 more compared to other price.Amazon enhanced price and and giving offer on enhanced price (cheap trick).I have opted for with offer and exchange of my old Mi A3 as I thought I will get better price.Details:Price with Offer  :  Rs. 30,999 (price listed on Amazon)Bonous Discount  :  - Rs.  3,500Exchange on Phone:  - Rs.  2,610Bank Offer  :  - Rs.  5,000Exchange Price : Rs. 149----------------------------------------Effective Price  :  Rs. 20,038-----------------------------------------However, Amazon made me to pay Rs. 2610 for old phone saying due to damage.Means I got no exchange for my old phone.Now the effective price I paid is  Rs. 22,648Lets talk about without offer:Price Listed on Amazon is Rs. 22,800Therefore my old phone exchange value is just (Rs.22,800- Rs.22,648) = Rs.152 only.What a nonsence Amazon?Without exhange I would have got atleast Rs. 1,500 offer on credit card, which would have resulted in lesser price offered by Amazon.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Samsung Galaxy M05 Review
review_text: I  recently unboxed and tested the Samsung Galaxy M05, and I'm impressed with its performance and features, especially considering its price point. The device boasts a sleek design, vibrant display, and solid build quality, making it visually appealing.The camera quality is excellent, capturing sharp and vivid photos even in low-light conditions. The battery life is another standout feature; it easily lasts a full day of heavy use.With its user-friendly interface and smooth performance, the Galaxy M05 is an ideal choice for anyone seeking a reliable and affordable smartphone. Whether you're into gaming, photography, or everyday tasks, this device meets all demands without breaking the bank.Overall, the Samsung Galaxy M05 is a fantastic addition to the budget smartphone market, delivering great value for money. Highly recommended!

title:

A Solid Choice for Everyday Use
review_text: I've been using this Samsung phone for a bit, and here's the lowdown. Considering it costs around ‚Çπ6,500-‚Çπ7,000, I think it's a pretty great deal.Sure, there are some compromises. No fingerprint sensor (the face unlock compensates some what for that), and yeah, not having a charger in the box is a bit of a hassle if you don't already have one. The speakers could be better, and a Full HD display would've been nice.But let's be real, at this price point, you can't expect perfection. If you're like me and just need a reliable phone for everyday stuff ‚Äì calls, texts, social media, and some streaming ‚Äì this phone gets the job done.Gaming enthusiasts might want to look elsewhere, but for casual users, I think this Samsung device is a solid choice.Would I recommend? Absolutely, for basic usage.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Samsung Galaxy M05 Review
review_text: I  recently unboxed and tested the Samsung Galaxy M05, and I'm impressed with its performance and features, especially considering its price point. The device boasts a sleek design, vibrant display, and solid build quality, making it visually appealing.The camera quality is excellent, capturing sharp and vivid photos even in low-light conditions. The battery life is another standout feature; it easily lasts a full day of heavy use.With its user-friendly interface and smooth performance, the Galaxy M05 is an ideal choice for anyone seeking a reliable and affordable smartphone. Whether you're into gaming, photography, or everyday tasks, this device meets all demands without breaking the bank.Overall, the Samsung Galaxy M05 is a fantastic addition to the budget smartphone market, delivering great value for money. Highly recommended!

Overall, it's a decent phone but be cautious during exchanges.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A Solid Choice for Everyday Use
review_text: I've been using this Samsung phone for a bit, and here's the lowdown. Considering it costs around ‚Çπ6,500-‚Çπ7,000, I think it's a pretty great deal.Sure, there are some compromises. No fingerprint sensor (the face unlock compensates some what for that), and yeah, not having a charger in the box is a bit of a hassle if you don't already have one. The speakers could be better, and a Full HD display would've been nice.But let's be real, at this price point, you can't expect perfection. If you're like me and just need a reliable phone for everyday stuff ‚Äì calls, texts, social media, and some streaming ‚Äì this phone gets the job done.Gaming enthusiasts might want to look elsewhere, but for casual users, I think this Samsung device is a solid choice.Would I recommend? Absolutely, for basic usage.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Blue Topaz)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Celestial Blue)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

They said a technician will visit my home and gave me a schedule time. But nobody turned up. That technician called me over phone and took some details. Finally, Amazon gave me the weblink of Samsung service providers list.They are not offering either replacement or refund or collection of item from our door for repair service.Better keep away from this model.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition Blue Topaz,6GB RAM,128GB Storage
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Stone Grey)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

review_text: I have encountered the following problems with Samsung Galaxy M15 5G model phone:1- The bottom space, up to one centimetre on the screen, is unresponsive to the touch.2- Phone is getting heated during charging.3- Getting ear pain while talking over this phone.I have complained to Amazon. They said a technician will visit my home and gave me a schedule time. But nobody turned up. That technician called me over phone and took some details. Finally, Amazon gave me the weblink of Samsung service providers list.They are not offering either replacement or refund or collection of item from our door for repair service.Better keep away from this model.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Celestial Blue,6GB RAM,128GB Storage)| Super AMOLED Display| 50MP Triple Cam| 6000mAh Battery| MediaTek Dimensity 6100+| 4 Gen. OS Upgrade
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Stone Grey)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

review_text: I have encountered the following problems with Samsung Galaxy M15 5G model phone:1- The bottom space, up to one centimetre on the screen, is unresponsive to the touch.2- Phone is getting heated during charging.3- Getting ear pain while talking over this phone.I have complained to Amazon. Finally, Amazon gave me the weblink of Samsung service providers list.They are not offering either replacement or refund or collection of item from our door for repair service.Better keep away from this model.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition (Stone Grey)
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Honest Review - 5 Days of Usage
review_text: This is my first Samsung phone (coming from a Poco F1). Here is my genuine experience.PROS -1. It has a beautiful display, with very good resolution and brightness even in sunny daylight. I'm running the phone on 90Hz refresh rate without any noticeable difference in my battery consumption.2. Battery life is excellent. I'm using a single SIM in 4G and a full charge lasted around 2 days for me. It has very good standby time. I received a USB Type-C cable with the phone but had to buy the 25w adapter separately. The charging speed is good and the phone has fast charging.3. Camera is decent. Photos seem well lit but lack a bit of detail. That is expected in this price range. Maybe GCam would yield better photos. I have yet to try.4. It comes with OneUI 6.1 running on Android 14 out of the box and the software experience seems to be solid. I haven't encountered any crashes as of now. All the apps seems to be well optimised.5. I haven't encountered any major heating issues until now, maybe because I don't use my phone as a workhorse.Can't say anything about gaming since I'm not into it.CONS -1. The absolute biggest con that I noticed is that this phone has NO ALWAYS ON DISPLAY. Samsung users will know that AOD is something Samsung phones are known for. Although this phone is fully capable of it, the feature itself has been disabled by Samsung in the core software.2. I'm not sure if this is a con, but still worth mentioning. The Samsung M15 5G and the M15 5G Prime are NOT different phones. This one just has a "Prime" sticker pasted on the box. Even the software identifies the phone as an M15.3. Although there are no major lags, but if you are coming from a phone with better specs you will notice a lack of smoothness common in most budget phones.4. No form of toughened glass for the display like Gorilla, etc.Overall I feel this is an excellent phone for the price and in this range it is probably the best.Hope the above information helps.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
M35 5G
review_text: Pros:- Great battery backup. With moderate usage on WiFi, can easily last upto 2 days. Also, there is very less battery drain when idle, especially overnight. Definitely one of the best with 6000 mAh. One of my primary reasons to buy this phone.- Camera quality at this price is way above average.- Finally, punch hole display from Samsung for M series and at this price point.- One UI software is very stable and comes with plenty of customisations.- No issues in performance with multitasking involving streaming videos, music, social media apps, browser surfing, etc. Can't say about gaming as I am not a gamer.- Up to 4 gens of software updates which hardly any company provides even with flagship phones. But need to keep in mind that the product page on Samsung's website clearly states that this is not a promise but just their current plans, and it can be changed anytime at their own discretion.Cons:- Bulky (which is expected considering the massive battery), holding with one hand for extended period of time causes discomfort, specially if you are used to phones weighing below 175g.- Headphone jack missing. Considering the thickness of the phone, this could easily have been accommodated.- Phone does not come with any IP rating which is surprising, so any contact with water might potentially cause damage.- There is a noticeable battery drain with 5G network, but could be improved in future software updates.- Not specific to this phone but with all Samsung phones: Missing charging adaptor, back cover, and screen protector. So, need to shell out extra money for these.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good budget Samsung phone for everyday use
review_text: Satisfied (except for IP rating)..Pros:1. Huge upgrades over m342. NFC, knox security3. 6000 mAH battery with decent battery life4. Vapour cooling chamber5. Good enough OIS camera and image processing with 4k recording6. Exynos 1380 with 600k above antutu score7. 4 gen OS and 5 years security updates8. Dual sterio speakers9. Cornering gorilla glass victus plus10. Good quality 6.6" sAMOLED display with decent brightness11. One UI 6.112. Latest Bluetooth, wifi and 5G..13. No heating issues and lags in everyday use or light gaming14. Photo remaster, background blur, object erase etc15. Samsung is reliableCons:1. Heavy and bulky (222 grams and 9 mm thick without case), but it is due to 6000 mAH battery and vapour cooling chamber2. Thick bezels (but uniform)3. No IPXX rating (it is expected in INR 20k priced phone)4. No charger in box and charging takes 1 hour 40 minutes from zero to 100% with 25 watt charger, type-C cable in box but length is short5. Not for heavy gamersThis review is after 25 days of use, I bought 8 GB, 256 GB for INR 22.5k including 2k bank discount..I suggest buyers to install tempered glass and case immediately after receiving the unit..

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing
review_text: It's works just as they advertised it .THE DISPLAY is really good , after all it's a SAMSUNG OLED panel , the colour and viewing angles are astonishing .THE SOUND is crisp it's not too loud , it's on the comforting side but it is very crisp and it has DOLBY ATMOS support for compatible songs and videos too .THE PERFORMANCE is very good at this price point , it's not a gaming phone you have to keep that in mind it's an all-around balanced phone that checks all the boxes ... in that sense day to usage the performance is really good and heating isn't an issue the vapour chamber does work well . It keeps the phone cool , however you can absolutely do light gaming on it ... performance is very stable and it doesn't throttle at all .THE CAMERA is good it takes sharp and detailed images in good conditions and even in low lights the shots are decent ... The colour science on all the 3 cameras (excluding the macro lens) is very consistent . Shots taken are good , portrait mode has decent edge detection . Pictures are vivid and punchy coloured (as expected from SAMSUNG tuning)... Selfie are crisp too skin is almost perfect as the vivids the tones a bit .THE BATTERY is big changes grade , you can't kill the phone even if you use it all day ... even on heavy usage the phone lasted about a bit short of 1.5 days for me . The charging is capped to 25w but you have to buy the charger separately... but charging speed is fine . No complains on that .THE BUILD is really good , yes it is plastic frame with acrylic back but it's sturdy af ... front is Corning's Victus+ that's the same on from my Galaxy S22 , it has tougher Crack resistance but it can scratch , so I recommend using a protector film or glass .Overall the experience is reallllly good for the price I paid for it (‚Çπ18499 for 8 ,128GB variant) I will highly recommend this if you want an all-around balanced phone .

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
After 1 week usage review
review_text: Display(9/10): 6.5inch may feel small but still it's good. The amoled is working perfectly giving vibrant colours(not natural). Resolution is 1080p.Build(7/10): This feels very boxy type and bulky but still acceptable. It has plastic so scratches are possible.Performance(8/10): While this phone isn't made for gaming but it deliveres good performance in casual gaming and daily use. Not recommended for hardcore gamersCamera(10/10): In this price range camera is of best quality. Photo looks more natural, the ois is working perfectly. The video quality isn't that good but acceptable.Network(10/10): It has all the 13 bands so it can use 5g at full speed. Till now no network issue is found from the phone.Disadvantages: It does not have a 3.5mm audio jack. Charger cable was only included and it supports only 25watt charging which is low and takes 1 hours 25 minutes to full charge( tested on 22.5 watt charger). Heating issue is very bad point for this phone. It doesn't have basic settings features like show connection speed,etc.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
So far so good
review_text: Bought this phone with a bit of trepidation because 3 of the 7 Samsung phones I have bought prior to this one  - either for myself or family - have developed a screen issue, Although only one was serious enough to require a visit to the service center. Thought of switching to a different company but seeing as all of them usually end up with some issue or the other, and the ratings of most of them end up around 4 stars anyway, I decided to stick with the known devil. And besides the display issue, most have served for a good time, including its ancestor, the M30, that this will replace. That too developed a screen issue but it was after 4 years of use so not complaining too much.Initial impressions so far has been decent. They have finally got rid of the water drop notch and gone with the punch hole in the M3x series, so that is good, it looks nicer. Even the overall design has been upgraded to bring it closer to the flagship S series with the flat sides and no camera island. No sharp edges either, so it is not uncomfortable to hold... except for the weight.Samsung phones, particularly the non flagship ones, are heavier than they should be for some reason (comparing to similarly spec'd phones by other companies), And this one is on the heavier side even among those at 222g. My primary phone too is heavy (not Samsung) so I am used to it, but I would nonetheless like a lighter phone. My father's M52 which has a 5000mah battery is 50g lighter and so much more comfortable in the hand and the pocket.If you add a case and a screen protector, the weight will increase even further so note that. The 6000mah battery however does its job and the phone is lasting me 1.5 - 2 days between charge. I'm not a heavy user though, no gaming or constant camera usage and such so your mileage may vary.I like the fingerprint sensor in the power button, very responsive. Better than the in display type I think. It supports sd card (hybrid sim - sd card) so that's good. The base 128gb model should be enough because of this, can upgrade storage with an sd card when needed.They have dropped the audio jack, but I have moved on to wireless so not a concern for me but I know there are die hard fans. A related drawback though is that FM radIOS are no longer possible since they need a wired earphone to act as antenna. I didnt use it too frequently but it was nice to have for those rare occasions.Not much of a camera guy so cant comment on how good or bad it is. Didn't notice any slowness or other issues, works well enough for my basic needs. No heating either - it was slightly warm during charging which is normal and again a little bit during video recording and the like, but that was barely so, less than during charging. I dont really do too many heavy processing type tasks, or even gaming.For regular needs this phone should be fine I think. If it stays this way for a few years I think I will be happy with this phone. On paper it seems to be a good phone at a decent price. I took a gamble by buying it soon after launch, without waiting for reviews. I havent noticed any drawbacks so far and hopefully it wont give me any reason to regret later on. Fingers crossed. Giving it 5 stars for now, will update if anything happens.

title:
3.0 out of 5 stars
Partially satisfied partially dissatisfied
review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



Though heavily hyped in social media platforms, bragged much about battery, SOT, camera and bla bla, its performance is nearly average. In camera, back side photography is not up to the mark, but in this price range, videography and selfie camera are good. Battery backup is average, I am getting 7-8 hours of SOT even in average use of YouTube, browser, and social media that's it, though people hyped saying " iski battery khatam hi nahi hoti kitna hi use kar lo".I am partially satisfied with it. Even my last used phone F12 clicks much better photos than this. Before F12 I was using M51 which was also one of the best phones in battery backup and camera.Bezels are very big verifying that it is a cheaper phone. Phone get heats up while charging idle. Took ages to charge when One Plus and other brands giving 100W charging support. Also, charger is very expensive, unlike the phone. But we  Samsung users are like " noon roti khaenge par phone Samsung ka hi lenge, Theek Hai"I am satisfied with the pricing, I got in 47.60% discount from MRP in great India sales after returning my old phone though its screen was shattered but accepted.What to say but I can recommend only after seeing the pricing and when u don't care much about deeper things in the phone, suitable for our "bade bujurg" but not for choosy and techie type people.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
If you know what to expect, this is a solid device !!
review_text: I was using the Moto G85 but my uncle needed to change his phone and he loved that phone so I decided getting this as I was using the M34 as my secondary device for my work.Very honestly, let me come clean, this phone will make sense to you if you know what you are getting into. For starters, this is without the doubt the best camera setup under 20K. The images are mostly of natural colors and good sharpness and details. The video capabilities are great too with 4K recording on both front and rear cameras. The video stabilisation is good too. However, the selfie camera and low light selfie images could have been better. I got the 6/128 model at 14K and at that price it is the best camera rear camera setup. An image taken on this camera has been attached for reference.The battery life is awesome. Expect a solid 7 hours SOT with 30 percent juice left under moderate use like YouTube, social media, music, a bit of camera use, Whatsapp and and a few calls on WiFi as well as 5G.The OS is just brilliant and I love One UI, I guess even more than stock Android. I have used Apple devices in the past and loved the experience and I can say the same for One UI. Also, Knox security is something you will always appreciate.And now the main question everyone would ask - what about Exynos? Well, in my honest opinion, the 1380 is much more optimized than the 1280 was in the M34. This chip handles daily tasks well. There are very little micro stutters mainly in animation and app switching, but that's about it. The phone does get warm but never overheats. The vapour cooling chamber works well. The CPU doesn't throttle much too. The Geekbench scores are impressive with approximately 1000 single core and 2800 multi core scores. I don't game so I can't answer for that. But overall this is a solid chip for daily usage.Now there is one thing I have a slight confusion about. The display is great with a punch hole, though the bezels are big. That isn't a huge concern to me but what bothered me initially is that the bezels made the phone much wider and slightly uncomfortable initially. I am used to it now. The display is a solid A+ though. Samsung's inhouse 120Hz sAMOLED is awesome. Just the brightness under direct sunlight is 1000 nits which might be a bit less for outdoor usage.The fingerprint reader is accurate if not the fastest. But the lack of IP is a thing to keep in mind. Use a good case to reduce chance of water damage. It should be fine, just don't dunk it in a lake.The stereo speakers sound good if not great. I felt it could have used a little more bass. But the Dolby Atmos support helps it a lot.Overall, what I feel is if you keep your expectations in check, this is a solid phone and perhaps the best phone if you can get it at 15K-17K price range for moderate use.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
One of the best in the segment from Samsung
review_text: Pros:- Great battery backup. With moderate usage on WiFi, can easily last upto 2 days. Also, there is very less battery drain when idle, especially overnight. Definitely one of the best with 6000 mAh. One of my primary reasons to buy this phone.- Camera quality at this price is way above average.- Finally, punch hole display from Samsung for M series and at this price point.- One UI software is very stable and comes with plenty of customisations.- No issues in performance with multitasking involving streaming videos, music, social media apps, browser surfing, etc. Can't say about gaming as I am not a gamer.- Up to 4 gens of software updates which hardly any company provides even with flagship phones. But need to keep in mind that the product page on Samsung's website clearly states that this is not a promise but just their current plans, and it can be changed anytime at their own discretion.Cons:- Bulky (which is expected considering the massive battery), holding with one hand for extended period of time causes discomfort, specially if you are used to phones weighing below 175g.- Headphone jack missing. Considering the thickness of the phone, this could easily have been accommodated.- Phone does not come with any IP rating which is surprising, so any contact with water might potentially cause damage.- There is a noticeable battery drain with 5G network, but could be improved in future software updates.- Not specific to this phone but with all Samsung phones: Missing charging adaptor, back cover, and screen protector. So, need to shell out extra money for these.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A very good phone for the budget!!
review_text: I purchased the phone on its launch and received the product on 22nd of July 2024. The variant that I purchased was 8gb+256gb and got for a price of around ‚Çπ20,500 including all the offers and cashback. I have used this phone for almost 40 days now and here is my honest opinion and feedback.PROS:1. The display is brilliant and smooth as always and the auto brightness functionality works pretty well. Even in direct sunlight, the screen is visible and can be used without much trouble.2. Both the front and back cameras does it job beautifully, be it in terms of pictures as well as the videos.3. The stereo speaker is wonderfully loud and clear and the audio quality is excellent.4. The battery backup is amazing. I use Hotspot and Bluetooth for almost 7 hours in a day on a continuous and simultaneous basis but still have around 25 to 30 percent battery life at the end of the day.5. The best part of the phone is the One UI which is too good and is highly customizable according to our needs and wants.6. The promise of 4 OS updates and 5 years of security updates.7. The ram management in the phone seems pretty good. Even if many apps are running in the background the speed is good and does not tend to hang.8. There is no issues relating to connectivity and call drops which was observed in the older galaxy M models.Cons:1. The phone is big and single hand navigation is pretty difficult.2. The phone actually is a bit heavy in terms of weight. However, one you start using it you will get used to the same.3. They should have provided a fast charging brick in the box.4. The phone does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack and is kind of a let down.5. The phone heats up occasionally but also tends to cool down pretty fast.So, overall it is a good buy for people who want a good phone in a  decent budget for a regular use.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Not well optimised.
review_text: I usually buy Nokia mobiles ( windows,lumias, nokias). First time I touched a Samsung mobile. Physically it is sturdy. The Ram is not well optimized. I don't know whether it is software or hardware issue. Navigation programming is basic phone level. I never had that kind of experience in any other mobile. May be it is issue with this model. Hope upgrade will rectify it.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
BEST phone under 15K
review_text: Bought this phone for Rs 13749 in the Great Indian Sale.Package does not include a charger, so keep that in mind.>>DESIGN: 7/10Nothing special, typical samsung design with 3 vertically stacked cameras.Display bezels are a bit thicker than the competition but they are uniform on all sides.Plastic back does not look good, no matter which color you choose, but a back cover solves that problem.>>DISPLAY : 10/10The best part about this device is the display, 1080p super amoled with punchy colors and great viewing angles. Samsung finally moved on from outdated U shaped notches and brought a punch hole.If you like viewing content then you are in for a treat. Display quality is comparable to what other brands offer in a segment above.>>SOUND: 9/10Dual speakers with dolby sound, ideal for media consumption. Upper speaker has a bit less volume compared to the bottom one, still it gives a good stereo effect.Sound is crisp, loud and clear.>>SOFTWARE : 10/10Another great aspect of this device. Well designed one ui with tons of features and device level optimizations. Bloatware is present, but can be uninstalled easily.Software support is just unbeatable : 4 major os updates and 5 years of security patches.One thing to note that goodlock is not available, but a lot of 3rd party workarounds are available.>>PERFORMANCE : 8/10Surprise, surprise. A well performing phone budget phone from samsung, isn't it great? Antutu scores are above 600k and real life performance is also good. I'm not a gamer , for me the performance is more than enough. no lags , no stutters and no app crashes.Phone doesn't heat up in normal usage and video calls, can't tell about gaming, coz I'm not a gamer.>>CAMERA : 9.5/10One of the best set of cameras available on any budget phone. PERIOD.50 MP main camera has OIS and clicks great photos with typical samsung colors and great details.8 MP ultrawide is good for occasional photography and making wide angle videos. Wish it was 13MP.2 MP macro is useless as always. Just don't know why manufacturers give it.13 MP Selfie camera is good, produces social media ready pictures.4k video capture is supported from both front and back cameras & you can also switch in between wide and normal lenses just like Iphones. OIS is not available in videos, but the EIS works well.>>BATTERY : 9/10Battery life is great, gives a screen on time of 8-9 hours on a single charge. Will easily last 2 days on medium usage and 1 full day on heavy usage. Charging is slow, even with the 25 watt charger that samsung sells for  Rs 999, it takes 1.5 hrs to charge fully. I'm getting 2 days backup with 5g turned on all the time and about an hour of video calls and some social media.>>VERDICT:Finally a great budget phone from Samsung that actually peforms well. Camera is great, display is beautiful, speakers are good , battery life is descent and software support is unmatched. Plus the brand value of samsung and knox safety along with it make this a great deal for people who do not game a lot.For gamers please choose some other device.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A mixed bag of good, bad & ugly
review_text: So I used a pixel 6A before buying M35 and since both phones fall in the same price segment, my review is largely based on comparison between the two.The good:Display quality: aside from uneven bezels, the brightness, color quality and the touch response is amazing.Battery: Just Amazing, wonderful. I could go almost 3 days with low to moderate usage & an entire day with heavy usage.The Bad:Size: it's an extremely large phone so someone with smaller hands may fund it difficult to reach the ends of the screen.The Ugly:Sensors: All sensors in this phone are extremely bad. The adaptive brightness does not adapt at all & has to be manually changed when coming out of the room or into the sun.Pick to wake: Does not work at all. Have to double tap on the screen or use the button to wake up the screen.Comfort: Very little as the phone is extremely heavy, if held for over 10 minutes the arm starts aching.Performance: I bought the 8GB version just to ensure there's no lag but still the phone froze a few times and had to be restarted. Now I've set schedule to restart the phone every night automatically to avoid such situation again.In conclusion, the phone is wonderful if you are looking for a good display, decent performance & a great battery life.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
Good phone for medium use, very slow charging, no charger with phone, quite heavy.
review_text: Bought this phone close to the Prime day sale. It came for around 19.5K, not with the best of discounts they offered.The packaging was minimum, but good. The phone is really heavy, may be due to the glass and battery. The Sumsung migrate application made the move very easy from my old (Samsung) phone. It didn't copy the Whatsapp chats and media though, I lost most of it when my old phone failed just a day later. I know Samsung migrate can't touch Whatsapp chat contents due to encryption used, but it would be good to have a solution for that. Loss of data is big.The phone came with 70% battery charge which was good enough to switch on and data migration. The charging takes a lot of time. The chargers which used to charge my old Samsung phone in fast charging mode aren't charging this phone the same way, its working in normal charging only. If the samsung knew this, they should have provided the charger with this phone also, its a major pain point for me.With single charge Im able to use the phone for 24 hours, which is good enough for a medium phone user like me. But for heavy gaming type users, this may not be suitable. So, study before buying this phone.At the moment, Im happy with the selection at this price point. Being heavy and missing charger are the main pain points.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
M35 5G
review_text: Pros:- Great battery backup. With moderate usage on WiFi, can easily last upto 2 days. Also, there is very less battery drain when idle, especially overnight. Definitely one of the best with 6000 mAh. One of my primary reasons to buy this phone.- Camera quality at this price is way above average.- Finally, punch hole display from Samsung for M series and at this price point.- One UI software is very stable and comes with plenty of customisations.- No issues in performance with multitasking involving streaming videos, music, social media apps, browser surfing, etc. Can't say about gaming as I am not a gamer.- Up to 4 gens of software updates which hardly any company provides even with flagship phones. But need to keep in mind that the product page on Samsung's website clearly states that this is not a promise but just their current plans, and it can be changed anytime at their own discretion.Cons:- Bulky (which is expected considering the massive battery), holding with one hand for extended period of time causes discomfort, specially if you are used to phones weighing below 175g.- Headphone jack missing. Considering the thickness of the phone, this could easily have been accommodated.- Phone does not come with any IP rating which is surprising, so any contact with water might potentially cause damage.- There is a noticeable battery drain with 5G network, but could be improved in future software updates.- Not specific to this phone but with all Samsung phones: Missing charging adaptor, back cover, and screen protector. So, need to shell out extra money for these.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
Amazing
review_text: It's works just as they advertised it .THE DISPLAY is really good , after all it's a SAMSUNG OLED panel , the colour and viewing angles are astonishing .THE SOUND is crisp it's not too loud , it's on the comforting side but it is very crisp and it has DOLBY ATMOS support for compatible songs and videos too .THE PERFORMANCE is very good at this price point , it's not a gaming phone you have to keep that in mind it's an all-around balanced phone that checks all the boxes ... in that sense day to usage the performance is really good and heating isn't an issue the vapour chamber does work well . It keeps the phone cool , however you can absolutely do light gaming on it ... performance is very stable and it doesn't throttle at all .THE CAMERA is good it takes sharp and detailed images in good conditions and even in low lights the shots are decent ... The colour science on all the 3 cameras (excluding the macro lens) is very consistent . Shots taken are good , portrait mode has decent edge detection . Pictures are vivid and punchy coloured (as expected from SAMSUNG tuning)... Selfie are crisp too skin is almost perfect as the vivids the tones a bit .THE BATTERY is big changes grade , you can't kill the phone even if you use it all day ... even on heavy usage the phone lasted about a bit short of 1.5 days for me . The charging is capped to 25w but you have to buy the charger separately... but charging speed is fine . No complains on that .THE BUILD is really good , yes it is plastic frame with acrylic back but it's sturdy af ... front is Corning's Victus+ that's the same on from my Galaxy S22 , it has tougher Crack resistance but it can scratch , so I recommend using a protector film or glass .Overall the experience is reallllly good for the price I paid for it (‚Çπ18499 for 8 ,128GB variant) I will highly recommend this if you want an all-around balanced phone .

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
So far so good
review_text: Bought this phone with a bit of trepidation because 3 of the 7 Samsung phones I have bought prior to this one  - either for myself or family - have developed a screen issue, Although only one was serious enough to require a visit to the service center. Thought of switching to a different company but seeing as all of them usually end up with some issue or the other, and the ratings of most of them end up around 4 stars anyway, I decided to stick with the known devil. And besides the display issue, most have served for a good time, including its ancestor, the M30, that this will replace. That too developed a screen issue but it was after 4 years of use so not complaining too much.Initial impressions so far has been decent. They have finally got rid of the water drop notch and gone with the punch hole in the M3x series, so that is good, it looks nicer. Even the overall design has been upgraded to bring it closer to the flagship S series with the flat sides and no camera island. No sharp edges either, so it is not uncomfortable to hold... except for the weight.Samsung phones, particularly the non flagship ones, are heavier than they should be for some reason (comparing to similarly spec'd phones by other companies), And this one is on the heavier side even among those at 222g. My primary phone too is heavy (not Samsung) so I am used to it, but I would nonetheless like a lighter phone. My father's M52 which has a 5000mah battery is 50g lighter and so much more comfortable in the hand and the pocket.If you add a case and a screen protector, the weight will increase even further so note that. The 6000mah battery however does its job and the phone is lasting me 1.5 - 2 days between charge. I'm not a heavy user though, no gaming or constant camera usage and such so your mileage may vary.I like the fingerprint sensor in the power button, very responsive. Better than the in display type I think. It supports sd card (hybrid sim - sd card) so that's good. The base 128gb model should be enough because of this, can upgrade storage with an sd card when needed.They have dropped the audio jack, but I have moved on to wireless so not a concern for me but I know there are die hard fans. A related drawback though is that FM radIOS are no longer possible since they need a wired earphone to act as antenna. I didnt use it too frequently but it was nice to have for those rare occasions.Not much of a camera guy so cant comment on how good or bad it is. Didn't notice any slowness or other issues, works well enough for my basic needs. No heating either - it was slightly warm during charging which is normal and again a little bit during video recording and the like, but that was barely so, less than during charging. I dont really do too many heavy processing type tasks, or even gaming.For regular needs this phone should be fine I think. If it stays this way for a few years I think I will be happy with this phone. On paper it seems to be a good phone at a decent price. I took a gamble by buying it soon after launch, without waiting for reviews. I havent noticed any drawbacks so far and hopefully it wont give me any reason to regret later on. Fingers crossed. Giving it 5 stars for now, will update if anything happens.

title:

review_text:
The media could not be loaded.
                



Though heavily hyped in social media platforms, bragged much about battery, SOT, camera and bla bla, its performance is nearly average. In camera, back side photography is not up to the mark, but in this price range, videography and selfie camera are good. Battery backup is average, I am getting 7-8 hours of SOT even in average use of YouTube, browser, and social media that's it, though people hyped saying " iski battery khatam hi nahi hoti kitna hi use kar lo".I am partially satisfied with it. Took ages to charge when One Plus and other brands giving 100W charging support. Also, charger is very expensive, unlike the phone. But we  Samsung users are like " noon roti khaenge par phone Samsung ka hi lenge, Theek Hai"I am satisfied with the pricing, I got in 47.60% discount from MRP in great India sales after returning my old phone though its screen was shattered but accepted.What to say but I can recommend only after seeing the pricing and when u don't care much about deeper things in the phone, suitable for our "bade bujurg" but not for choosy and techie type people.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
If you know what to expect, this is a solid device !!
review_text: I was using the Moto G85 but my uncle needed to change his phone and he loved that phone so I decided getting this as I was using the M34 as my secondary device for my work.Very honestly, let me come clean, this phone will make sense to you if you know what you are getting into. For starters, this is without the doubt the best camera setup under 20K. The images are mostly of natural colors and good sharpness and details. The video capabilities are great too with 4K recording on both front and rear cameras. The video stabilisation is good too. However, the selfie camera and low light selfie images could have been better. I got the 6/128 model at 14K and at that price it is the best camera rear camera setup. An image taken on this camera has been attached for reference.The battery life is awesome. Expect a solid 7 hours SOT with 30 percent juice left under moderate use like YouTube, social media, music, a bit of camera use, Whatsapp and and a few calls on WiFi as well as 5G.The OS is just brilliant and I love One UI, I guess even more than stock Android. I have used Apple devices in the past and loved the experience and I can say the same for One UI. Also, Knox security is something you will always appreciate.And now the main question everyone would ask - what about Exynos? Well, in my honest opinion, the 1380 is much more optimized than the 1280 was in the M34. This chip handles daily tasks well. There are very little micro stutters mainly in animation and app switching, but that's about it. The phone does get warm but never overheats. The vapour cooling chamber works well. The CPU doesn't throttle much too. The Geekbench scores are impressive with approximately 1000 single core and 2800 multi core scores. I don't game so I can't answer for that. But overall this is a solid chip for daily usage.Now there is one thing I have a slight confusion about. The display is great with a punch hole, though the bezels are big. That isn't a huge concern to me but what bothered me initially is that the bezels made the phone much wider and slightly uncomfortable initially. I am used to it now. The display is a solid A+ though. Samsung's inhouse 120Hz sAMOLED is awesome. Just the brightness under direct sunlight is 1000 nits which might be a bit less for outdoor usage.The fingerprint reader is accurate if not the fastest. But the lack of IP is a thing to keep in mind. Use a good case to reduce chance of water damage. It should be fine, just don't dunk it in a lake.The stereo speakers sound good if not great. I felt it could have used a little more bass. But the Dolby Atmos support helps it a lot.Overall, what I feel is if you keep your expectations in check, this is a solid phone and perhaps the best phone if you can get it at 15K-17K price range for moderate use.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A very good phone for the budget!!
review_text: I purchased the phone on its launch and received the product on 22nd of July 2024. The variant that I purchased was 8gb+256gb and got for a price of around ‚Çπ20,500 including all the offers and cashback. I have used this phone for almost 40 days now and here is my honest opinion and feedback.PROS:1. The display is brilliant and smooth as always and the auto brightness functionality works pretty well. Even in direct sunlight, the screen is visible and can be used without much trouble.2. Both the front and back cameras does it job beautifully, be it in terms of pictures as well as the videos.3. The stereo speaker is wonderfully loud and clear and the audio quality is excellent.4. The battery backup is amazing. I use Hotspot and Bluetooth for almost 7 hours in a day on a continuous and simultaneous basis but still have around 25 to 30 percent battery life at the end of the day.5. The best part of the phone is the One UI which is too good and is highly customizable according to our needs and wants.6. The promise of 4 OS updates and 5 years of security updates.7. The ram management in the phone seems pretty good. Even if many apps are running in the background the speed is good and does not tend to hang.8. There is no issues relating to connectivity and call drops which was observed in the older galaxy M models.Cons:1. The phone is big and single hand navigation is pretty difficult.2. The phone actually is a bit heavy in terms of weight. However, one you start using it you will get used to the same.3. They should have provided a fast charging brick in the box.4. The phone does not have a 3.5mm headphone jack and is kind of a let down.5. The phone heats up occasionally but also tends to cool down pretty fast.So, overall it is a good buy for people who want a good phone in a  decent budget for a regular use.

title:
5.0 out of 5 stars
BEST phone under 15K
review_text: Bought this phone for Rs 13749 in the Great Indian Sale.Package does not include a charger, so keep that in mind.>>DESIGN: 7/10Nothing special, typical samsung design with 3 vertically stacked cameras.Display bezels are a bit thicker than the competition but they are uniform on all sides.Plastic back does not look good, no matter which color you choose, but a back cover solves that problem.>>DISPLAY : 10/10The best part about this device is the display, 1080p super amoled with punchy colors and great viewing angles. Samsung finally moved on from outdated U shaped notches and brought a punch hole.If you like viewing content then you are in for a treat. Display quality is comparable to what other brands offer in a segment above.>>SOUND: 9/10Dual speakers with dolby sound, ideal for media consumption. Upper speaker has a bit less volume compared to the bottom one, still it gives a good stereo effect.Sound is crisp, loud and clear.>>SOFTWARE : 10/10Another great aspect of this device. Well designed one ui with tons of features and device level optimizations. Bloatware is present, but can be uninstalled easily.Software support is just unbeatable : 4 major os updates and 5 years of security patches.One thing to note that goodlock is not available, but a lot of 3rd party workarounds are available.>>PERFORMANCE : 8/10Surprise, surprise. A well performing phone budget phone from samsung, isn't it great? Antutu scores are above 600k and real life performance is also good. I'm not a gamer , for me the performance is more than enough. no lags , no stutters and no app crashes.Phone doesn't heat up in normal usage and video calls, can't tell about gaming, coz I'm not a gamer.>>CAMERA : 9.5/10One of the best set of cameras available on any budget phone. PERIOD.50 MP main camera has OIS and clicks great photos with typical samsung colors and great details.8 MP ultrawide is good for occasional photography and making wide angle videos. Wish it was 13MP.2 MP macro is useless as always. Just don't know why manufacturers give it.13 MP Selfie camera is good, produces social media ready pictures.4k video capture is supported from both front and back cameras & you can also switch in between wide and normal lenses just like Iphones. OIS is not available in videos, but the EIS works well.>>BATTERY : 9/10Battery life is great, gives a screen on time of 8-9 hours on a single charge. Will easily last 2 days on medium usage and 1 full day on heavy usage. Charging is slow, even with the 25 watt charger that samsung sells for  Rs 999, it takes 1.5 hrs to charge fully. I'm getting 2 days backup with 5g turned on all the time and about an hour of video calls and some social media.>>VERDICT:Finally a great budget phone from Samsung that actually peforms well. Camera is great, display is beautiful, speakers are good , battery life is descent and software support is unmatched. Plus the brand value of samsung and knox safety along with it make this a great deal for people who do not game a lot.For gamers please choose some other device.

title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
A mixed bag of good, bad & ugly
review_text: So I used a pixel 6A before buying M35 and since both phones fall in the same price segment, my review is largely based on comparison between the two.The good:Display quality: aside from uneven bezels, the brightness, color quality and the touch response is amazing.Battery: Just Amazing, wonderful. I could go almost 3 days with low to moderate usage & an entire day with heavy usage.The Bad:Size: it's an extremely large phone so someone with smaller hands may fund it difficult to reach the ends of the screen.The Ugly:Sensors: All sensors in this phone are extremely bad. The adaptive brightness does not adapt at all & has to be manually changed when coming out of the room or into the sun.Pick to wake: Does not work at all. Have to double tap on the screen or use the button to wake up the screen.Comfort: Very little as the phone is extremely heavy, if held for over 10 minutes the arm starts aching.Performance: I bought the 8GB version just to ensure there's no lag but still the phone froze a few times and had to be restarted. Now I've set schedule to restart the phone every night automatically to avoid such situation again.In conclusion, the phone is wonderful if you are looking for a good display, decent performance & a great battery life.

title:

Good phone for medium use, very slow charging, no charger with phone, quite heavy.
review_text: Bought this phone close to the Prime day sale. It came for around 19.5K, not with the best of discounts they offered.The packaging was minimum, but good. The phone is really heavy, may be due to the glass and battery. The Sumsung migrate application made the move very easy from my old (Samsung) phone. It didn't copy the Whatsapp chats and media though, I lost most of it when my old phone failed just a day later. I know Samsung migrate can't touch Whatsapp chat contents due to encryption used, but it would be good to have a solution for that. Loss of data is big.The phone came with 70% battery charge which was good enough to switch on and data migration. The charging takes a lot of time. The chargers which used to charge my old Samsung phone in fast charging mode aren't charging this phone the same way, its working in normal charging only. If the samsung knew this, they should have provided the charger with this phone also, its a major pain point for me.With single charge Im able to use the phone for 24 hours, which is good enough for a medium phone user like me. But for heavy gaming type users, this may not be suitable. So, study before buying this phone.At the moment, Im happy with the selection at this price point. Being heavy and missing charger are the main pain points.
